ARIE 1939-1943 [vol. 062]


A. List of copper-plates examined during the year 1939-40.


ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/1 (page 20)
Placement
Mr. P.Sheik Mohideen, Merchant contractor, Trichinopoly, through the late Sir T.Desikacharya.
Dynasty
Western Gaṅga
King
Mādhava Mahārāja (Mā-dhavavarman III).
Date
Śaka 24(?), Sōbha-kṛit, Kārttika, śu. [7], Wednesday, Śravaṇa.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
…
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Only a set of photographs of the written sides of the plates has been received for examination. The inscription is full of mistakes in phraseology. Seems to re-cord the grant issued by the king from Talavanapura, of the village Bhintavāḍi situated in Kuḍugu-nāḍu to a few speci-fied Gāvuṇḍas in appreciation of their valour in killing the king's opponents in a fight and capturing their wives and treasures.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/2 (page 20)
Placement
A resident of Purushottampuri, H.E.H.Nizam's Dominions, through the Director of Archaeo-logy, Hyderabad.
Dynasty
Yādava
King
Rāmachandradēva
Date
Śaka 1232, Sādhā-raṇa.
Language
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the Director.
Edition
Published in Epi-graphia Indica,. Vol. XXV, pp. 199 ff.
Remarks
Registers the grant of four villages in Kānhairī-Khampaṇaka by the king to Mahāmaṇḍalika Purushōttama alias Puru-shai-Nāyaka of the Vaśishṭha-gōtra who made them over as agrahāra to 80 Brāh-maṇas on the day of Kapila-shashṭhī in Bhādrapada of the same year. Gives some details of the king's conquests and those of his ancestors.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/3 (page 20)
Placement
Sri Vēmparla Suryanarayana Sas-tri, Telugu Pandit, Board High School, Amalāpuram, through the late J.Ramayya Pantulu, Muk-tēśvaram.
Dynasty
Eastern Chāḷukya
King
Sarvalōkāśraya Vishṇu-vardhana Mahārājā-dhirāja.
Date
…
Language
Sanskrit in early characters
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
Epigraphia Indica
Remarks
Records a grant by the king of the village Kōḻūru in Pañchūrikuṟu-vishaya, free of all taxes to his three generals Bhīmana and his sons Vijayāditya and Daṇḍi in appreciation of their valour in destroy-ing his enemies in several battles. The donee's ancestry is given.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/4 (page 20)
Placement
District Judge, Ramnad, Madura
Dynasty
Sētupati
King
Muttu Rāmaliṅga Vija-ya Raghunātha Sētu-pati-kāttadēva.
Date
Śaka 1703, Kali 4882, Śubhakṛit, Uttarā-yaṇa, Vasanta-ṛitu, Vaigāśi, ba. amavāsyā, Monday, Rōhiṇī, Siddhi-yōga, Chatushpāda-karaṇa.
Language
Tamil
Origin
Deposited in the Madras Museum.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the gift, made by the king, of the village Kuḷavippaṭṭi-pāḍi to a certain Suppiramaṇiya-ayyaṉ, son of Rāmaṉ Śivaṉ of the Bhāradvāja-gōtra, Āpastan-pa(mba)sūtra and Yajuś-śākhā.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/5 (page 20)
Placement
Government Epigraphist for India, Ootacamund.
Dynasty
Eastern Chāḷukya
King
Vikramāditya II
Date
…
Language
Sanskrit in Telugu
Origin
Returned to the Government Epigraphist.
Edition
Published in Epi-graphia Indica, Vol. XXV, pp. 186 ff.
Remarks
Records an order of the king to the Rāsh-ṭrakūṭas and others inhabiting the Kaṇḍē-ruvāḍi-vishaya. The grant portion and date are lost since a later inscription re-corded below was engraved as a palimp-sest over the erased portions of the plate.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/6 (page 21)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Triyaṁbaka
Date
Śaka 1377 (express-ed by chronogram), Yuva, Kārttika, full-moon, Monday.
Language
Sanskrit in NandiNāgarī
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Bomme-hāḷu renamed Lakshmīpura after his mother, by the king, to the Brāhmaṇa Māchivōkta, son of Vallabhōkta of the Śukla-Yajuś-śākhā.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/7 (page 21)
Placement
Sri Virabhadrayya, Kaulūr Math, Sirsi, North Kanara district, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1631, Virōdhi, Phālguṇa, ba. 5.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records a gift of land belonging to the suburb Balugaṇi alias Chennamallāmbāpura of Bēḍakaṇi-grāma by the queen Chenna-mallammāji to Basavaliṅgadēva, disciple of His Holiness Mahattadēva of Uppina-halli.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/8 (page 21)
Placement
Sri Sanjiva Rao Desai, High Court Pleader, Gulbarga, Hyderabad State, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷu-kya.
King
Vinayāditya Satyāś-raya Vallabha.
Date
Śaka 516 (?), Ānanda, Vaiśākha, Paur-ṇamāsī, Thursday, Vyatīpāta.
Language
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Evidently a forgery. Records the grant of the village Niḍagundi in Kisukāḍu-70 by the king to a certain Brāhmaṇa by name Bhāskara Chauvēra-Bhaṭṭa of the Kammeya family and the Kāśyapa gōtra. The king is said to have been ruling from his capital at Raktapura on the north bank of the river Malāpa-hārī. The phraseology of the inscription is very incorrect. See below Part II, para II.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/9 (page 21)
Placement
The residents of Pullūr, Polur taluk, North Arcot district, through Mr. G.V.Srinivasa Rao of this office.
Dynasty
Pallava
King
Vijaya Nandivarman (II) Pallavamalla.
Date
33rd year
Language
Sanskrit & Tamil in early Pallava characters
Origin
Purchased by the Indian Museum, Calcutta.
Edition
Epigraphia Indica
Remarks
Records the grant of four villages situated on the southern bank of the Cheyyār in Kīḷvēṇāḍu, a subdivision of Palguṇṛa-kōṭṭaṃ, which were clubbed into one and called Nayadhīramaṅgalam after his own surname, by the king, as an agrahāra di-vided into shares among 108 learned Brāhmaṇas of various gōtras and sūtras. The grant was made at the request of his feudatory chief Avanichandra-Yuvarāja ‘the lord of Vilvalapura’, and the exe-cutor (ājñapti) of the grant was his minister Nāga-Śarma alias Brahmādhirāja.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/10 (page 21)
Placement
Sri Kasinath Ganapati Dikshit Mārigōḷi, Gōkarṇ, North Kanara district, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Kadamba
King
Vīra-Kāvadēvarasa (Kāmadēva) ‘ruling from his capital at Chandāura’.
Date
Śaka 1177, Rāksha-sa, Māgha, śu. 15. Thursday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
Epigraphia Indica
Remarks
The king is styled Paśchimasamudrā-dhipati, etc. Records a sarvamānya gift by the king at the anādi-agrahāra, Mūṟūru to some Brāhmaṇas.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/11 (page 21)
Placement
Sri G.R.Hegade, Teacher, Hule-kal, North Kanara district, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīrapratāpa Harihara-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1326, Svabhā-nu, Phālguṇa, śu. 1, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa & Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the endowment of the village named Hebbāruvana Taṭṭagāra to Sarvajña-Sarasvati of the Ādityēśvara temple at Gōkarṇa by the ‘Kārṇāta-Mahā-pradhāna’ Īchappa-Vaḍeya of Gōvā, at the instance of the king, on the occasion of a solar eclipse.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/12 (page 21)
Placement
Sri Hāḷatakaṭṭi Gangadhara Bhat of Siddhāpur, North Kanara district, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1692, Virōdhi, Śrāvaṇa, śu. 6, Mon-day.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records a gift of land in the village of Siruvaḷige and the appropriation of its revenue for the expenses of worship and offerings and of the car festival in the temple of god Gaṁgādharēśvara at Sidhāpura by Biḷigi Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/13 (page 22)
Placement
Sri Guggari Virabhadrappa of Siddhāpur, North Kanara dis-trict, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1638, Manma-tha, Māgha, ba. 10.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records a gift of land in the village of Chika-Biḷilahaḷḷi of the Gutti-vēṇṭhe (subdivision) in Banavāsi 12000 to Mallikārjunadēva, son of Sātenahaḷi Mallappadēva by Chenna mallammāji and Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka, ‘the great lord (Mahāprabhu) of Biḷigi’.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/14 (page 22)
Placement
Sri Hāḷatakaṭṭi Gangadhara Bhat of Siddāpur, North Kanara dis-trict, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1692, Virōdhi Śrāvaṇa, śu. 10.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records a gift of the customs duties on all articles of merchandise passing through the nāḍu, by the chief, the mahānāḍu, śeṭṭis, etc., for the rathōtsava of god Gaṅgā-dharēśvaradēva near Hāḷitakaṭṭi at Siddāpura.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/15 (page 22)
Placement
The Pontiff of the Jaina Bhaṭṭā-kaḷaṁka-maṭha at Sōṇḍa, North Kanara district, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
…
King
Immaḍi Dēvarāja Oḍeyaru
Date
Śaka 1444, Vishu, Śrāvaṇa, śu. 5, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Only the last plate of a set, the others being lost. States that a certain Malli-Śeṭṭi made, after purchase from the chief, a sarvamānya endowment (of land) in the Māsūru Mosaḷeyakuṟuvu for the main-tenance of certain services in the Śaṁkha-Jinara-Basti of Huligeṟe, on the advice of Chandraprabhadēva, a disciple of Vijaya kīrtidēva of the Dēsi-gaṇa.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/16 (page 22)
Placement
The Pontiff of the Sri Baḷaga Bāvā-ji-maṭha, Chicacole, Vizagapatam district, through the Sub-Collec-tion, Chicaccle.
Dynasty
Eastern Gaṅga
King
Dēvēndravarman, son of of Bhūpēndravarman.
Date
…
Language
Sanskrit in archaic characters
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the royal grant of the village Nāpitavāṭaka in Kōḷuvartani (division) to two learned Brāhmaṇas, viz., Narasiṁha-Bhaṭṭa and his brother Mādhava-Bhaṭṭa of the Kāmukāyana-gōtra, well versed in the Bahvṛicha-Vēda and all the Śāstras, on the occasion of Uttarāyaṇa to secure religious merit for the king and his parents. Published in the Telugu Journal, Bhārati, Vol. XIV, Part 2, pp. 67 ff.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/1 (page 23)
Placement
Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchāryavarya of the Jaina Maṭha, Mūḍabidure, Karkala taluk, South Kanara district, through Mr. H.K. Narasimhaswami of this office.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1485, Rudhi-rōdgāri, Mēsha [13,] Friday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records an endowment in money made by Śaṅkaraśeṭṭi alias Biraṇantara at the request of his sister, Śaṅkaradēvī, for the benefit of Chaṇḍōgra Pāriśva-Tīrthakara (basti) of Bidure. The grant was made into the hands of the Seṭṭikāras at the command of Abhinava Chārukīrtti-Paṇḍita. Out of this amount lands were purchased. Records also another endowment of 1250 varāhas.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/2 (page 23)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Vīrappodeya
Date
Śaka 1468, Viśvā-vasu, Kārttika śu. 1; and Parābhava, Pra-thama Āshāḍha, śu. 10.
Language
Sanskrit & Kannaḍa in Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Gives the ancestry of the chief for six genera-tions. Records the gift, by the chief, of the income from certain lands in the village Kuḍuginabayalu included in the Chikkamāḷige-nāḍu for worship in the basti called Tribhuvanachūḍāmaṇi at Bidure. Records also a gift by the chief of a silver cup and of money for the provision of rice-offering to god Chandra-nātha in the (same) basti in the name of Vīramamma, the wife of his uncle Timma-rasa. Refers also to a gift of money for the milk-bath of the deity in the name of Timmappa, son of Ghaṇṭoḍeya.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/3 (page 23)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
Date
Śaka 1493, Pra-jōtpatti, Pushya, śu. 8, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records an endowment of land at Marakata in Mīchāra-māgāṇe for āhāradāna (feeding) in the basti (at Bidure) by Abbakkadēvī of the Chaüṭa (family) for the merit of her sister Padumaladēvī. Contains the injunction that the chiefs of Puttige should not destroy the charity.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/4 (page 23)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
Date
Śaka 1554, Āṅgirasa, Dīvāḷi.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
States that the two sections of Jaina residents living in Beṭṭakēri and Mādalaṅgaḍikēri at Bidure, who were celebrating the Dīvāḷi festivals hitherto by mutual fights with sticks, slings, stones and shields, were, by solemn vow, made to give up this violent method as it was against the tenets of their faith and to observe the festival in future by harmless diversions of dīpā-rādhana and other special worship in the Chandranātha-basti, at the instance and intercession of their Pontiff, Samanta- bhadradēva of the Sēna-gaṇa who, with the assistance of his immediate disciples and the ascetics of the four gaṇas and the active sympathy of his friend Dēvaṇṇa, brought pressure upon them by threats of suicide by starvation.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/4a (page 24)
Placement
Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchāryavarya of the Jaina Maṭha, Mūḍabidure, Karkala taluk, South Kanara district, through Mr. H.K. Narasimhaswami of this office.
Dynasty
Keḷadi
King
Veṅkaṭappa-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1544, Rudhi-rōdgāri, Vaiśākha.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records separately in the same plate the earlier activities of this Samantabhadra who is stated to have visited the king at Ikkēri and his local officer Chinna-bhaṇḍāra Dēvappa and secured their financial and official assistance for the renovation of the chaityālaya called Tribhuvanatilaka, dedicated to Chandranā-thasvāmi at Bidure.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/5 (page 24)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
Lakshmapparasa alias Bhaira[ra*]sa ‘of the Kadaṁba family’.
Date
Śaka 1426 (expired) Krōdhin, Āśvīja, ba. 5.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
States that the chief conceded certain ecclesiastical rights and privileges over some part of his dominions to a disciple of Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchārya, the high pontiff of the 72 religious saṁsthānas of the Jainas.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/6 (page 24)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vijaya Sadāśiva Mahārā-ya ‘ruling at Vidyāna-gara’.
Date
Śaka 1679, Rākshasa, Mārgaśira, śu. 1.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records an endowment of certain lands in the village Beṇṇegāve in the Sōde province by the chief Immaḍi Arasappoḍeya, son of Arasappa-oḍeya of Sōde, to his teacher Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitadēva who bears a number of birudas like Rāya-rājaguru, etc.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/7 (page 24)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Durmukhi, Vṛisha-bha, 15, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records that Barmananda and his young-er brother Kuṅgiya Barmiseṭṭi of the Karbarabaḷi agreed to pay into the trea-sury of the basadi of Chaṇḍōgra Parśva-dēva built by Chārukīrti Paṇḍitadēva, 600 gadyāṇas from out of the income of lands in their enjoyment. Also records another endowment of 110 gadyāṇas from the Vṛiśchika month of the Hēviḷaṁbi year by the same brothers.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/8 (page 24)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Keḷadi
King
Vīrabha dra-Nāyaka ‘ruling the Maṅgaḷūru and Bārakūru king-dom’.
Date
Śaka 1562, Vikrama, Mārgaśira, ba. 2, Friday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records an agreement given in the presence of Narasiṁhoḍeya who was holding the mudra of Maṅgaḷūru by Chikkarāya Oḍeya of Puttige belonging to the Chauṭa family to Abhinava Chārukīrtti Paṇḍita-dēva and the several seṭṭis and others of the mercantile guild of Bidure undertak ing not to encroach, in future, upon the- civic rights and privileges hitherto enjoyed. by the latter and to preserve intact the property of the gods and the priests since the excesses of his subordinates had resulted in their abandoning their homes and settling elsewhere.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/9 (page 25)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
(a) Tāraṇa, Vṛisha-bha, 22, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
(a) Records an endowment of 200 honnu for offerings to the 24 Tirthaṅkaras by Chandrakīrttidēva. This amount was advanced to a certain Vishṇu-Kalūṁvaru (?) who mortgaged some of his lands for the amount received and agreed to pay 16 maunds of rice as in terest thereon every year.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/9 (page 25)
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
(b) Svabhānu, Karka-[ṭaka] 9, Wednesday
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
(b) Records a similar agreement entered into with the treasury of the Pārśavanātha basti at Bidure by Śrīdhara-paḍikōdi, who after mortgaging his lands, received 2100 Vīrarāya-phaṇa and agreed to pay as interest thereon 28 muḍe of rice every year. This was to be utilised for providing offerings and worship to the bronze image of the deity in the basti set up by Lalitā-dēvī of Gerasoppe.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/9 (page 25)
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
(c) Nandana, Mēsha, prathamā, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
(c) The third record is an agreement by three brothers to pay a fixed sum every year as interest for the amount borrowed by them from the basti of Pārśvnātha out of the endowments made by Lalitādēvī.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/10 (page 25)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1671, Śukla, Māgha, ba. 13.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records a gift of money to reclaim a land at Paduvakōḍu in Perañjada-māgāṇe which had been endowed by his ancestors for worship in the basti of Chandranātha-svāmi at Mūḍabidure, by Timmaṇarasa alias Achela, as the land had become fallow after sometime and consequently worship in the basti had stopped.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/11 (page 25)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
.
King
…
Date
Yuva, Mithuna, 16, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the mortgage of his lands for 15 years by Mañjiseṭṭi of Pejāra to the several seṭṭikāras of Bidure for 200 varāhas of gold received by him from the treasury of the basti of Chaṇḍōgra Pārśvadēva at the instance of (the pontiff) Abhinava-Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitadēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/12 (page 25)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1643, Plava, Māgha, śu. 10.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records a gift of land to the Kallu-basti of Chandranātha-svāmi at Mūḍabidure by Sātabeḷe-Ballāḷa of Marōvōḍi-grāma in Keḷada-māgāṇe, a subdivision of Achela-sīme. The land was entrusted to a lady by name Chandramati-avva Biyyāni for performing the Śalākshaṇika-nōhi (festi-val) in the basti.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/13 (page 26)
Placement
Coārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchāryavarya of the Jaina Maṭha, Mūḍabidure, Karkala taluk, South Kanara dis-trict, through Mr. H.K.Narasim-haswami of this office.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1589, Plavaṅga, Kārttika, śu. 5, Friday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records an endowment of land made into the hands of Lakshmīsēna-Bhaṭāraka of the Śēna-gaṇa, the family preceptor of the chiefs of Puttige, by Abakadēvī Chauṭaru for the maintenance of a feeding house and worship in it.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/14 (page 26)
Placement
Lokanathacharya of the same place through Mr. H.K.Nara-simhaswami of this office.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Raudri, Mēsha, 15, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Seems to record an endowment in money for offerings to the images of Chandranātha and Ananta-Tīrthakara by two brothers Gōvindāsraṇa and Rāmāsraṇa of Yēṇūru (Vēṇūr) who pledged their brahmadēya lands for the purpose, redeemable by themselves only after a period of 40 years.

ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/22 (page 27)
Placement

Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Harihara
Date
Śaka 1301, Siddhā-rthin, Jyēshṭha, Tuesday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Sanskrit & Kannaḍa in Nāgarī

Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the endowment of 22 villages in Gadag-dēśa for the maintenance of worship in the two temples of Travaṁbakēśa and Vīranārāyana at Gadag, made by the king in the presence of god Virūpāksha on the banks of the Tungabhadrā at the instance of his preceptor Kriyāśakti-guru, and the appointment of Sammaṇāchārya, son of Śarvāchārya and grandson of Śaṅkhaṇāchārya of the Kāśyapa-gōtra, a resident of Kratupura, to supervise the worship in the temples and manage their property.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/23 (page 27)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Do.
Language
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Connected with copper-plate No. 22 above States that Gadag-dēśa of 66 villages was divided by the king into three parts, one part being set apart as Rājāṁśa, the second part for the worship of the two gods men-tioned above and the third made into an agrahāra to be enjoyed by the scholar Sammaṇāchārya, the accountant of the Gadag-dēśa and other persons of vari-ous gōtras and sūtras selected by him. (Text published in J.B.B.R.A.S., Vol. XII, pp. 352 ff.)

ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/25 (page 27)
Placement

Chāḷukya
King
Hemmāḍi ‘ruling from Kalyāṇapura’.
Date
Śaka 1102, Saumya
Language
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Written in very faulty characters. Seems to record a grant of several plots of land in two villages Shaṭṭiyakere (Seṭṭigere) and Māḍaṁgere in the division Kuṇḍi 3000 to a sāvanta named Kāṭeya by the king who was pleased with some exploits of the former.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/26 (page 28)
Placement
Sri Revanappa Battali, Dalal, Hubli, Dharwar district, through Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
…
King
Rukumāṅgadēva-chakra-varti ‘ruling at Ahichapura’.
Date
Prabhava, Chaitra, śu. 8, Monday.
Language
Marāṭhī & Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
In characters of about the 13th century A.D. The language seems to be a corrupt dialect of Mahrāṭhī with an admixture of old Kannaḍa. Purports to record a grant of land at Maṇināga-grāma in Kuṇḍi 3000 province to twelve gāvuṇḍas of the place by the king, on the occasion of his victori-ous campaign in the southern region while he was camping on the bank of the Malāpahārī river at Kōḷanūr, probably in recognition of some service rendered by them.

Yādava

Kandharadēva Mahārāja

Remarks
Records the confirmation by the king, at the request of his minister Chauḍi-seṭṭi, of the grant of a village named Tāmrapurī in Vēṇugrāma-dēśa to 110 Brāhmaṇas which had been made by the minister Mahāmātya Malliśeṭṭi, the father of Chauḍiśeṭṭi, in the presence of god Vishṇu at Pauṇḍarīka-kshētra, for securing prosperity to the king's dominion.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/31 (page 28)
Placement
Mrs. Rudravva, wife of the late Basa ppa-Dalavāyi of Murugod, Saun-datti taluk, Belgaum district, thro-ugh Mr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Permāḍidēva
Date
22nd year of reign, Vibhava, Māgha, Pūrṇimā, Monday.
Language
Sanskrit in Nāgarī

Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Doḍḍa-vāḍa in the Navilugunda-kaṁpaṇa of the Beḷuva-dēśa to Brāhmaṇas of various gōtras by the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/32 (page 28)
Placement
Sri Annamalai Mudaliar, Appar-maḍam, Tiruvaṇṇāmalai, North Arcot district, through Mr. V. Venkatasubba Ayyar of this office.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 14[3]5, Āṅgiras, Makara, śu. 5, Thurs-day, Uttirāḍam.
Language
Tamil
Origin
Returned to the Mutt.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records an endowment of the village Mēl-Pālaiyūr and of 400 poṉ in cash by the king for worship and offerings to the images of Aḻiyāviradaṅgoṇḍa-Vināyaka and Appar Taṁbirānār which had been set up in the Periyanāṭṭumaḍam built by the nāṭṭavar of the 84 vaḷanāḍus outside the temple of Aruṇādri-Īśvara near the main gōpura at the instance of Aḻiyāvira-daṅkoṇḍa-Taṁbirānār and for sacred bath and offerings during one service of the day for the god Aruṇādri-Īśvara and god-dess Uṇṇāmulaiammaṉ. Further, it records an agreement among these 84 nāṭṭavar to collect certain imposts among themselves on specified occasions for the main-tenance of a feeding charity in the maṭha, and the appointment of a person by them to look after the management of the affairs of the maṭha. In the pre-amble of the inscription reference is made to the construction of the 1000 pillared maṇḍapa by the king within the precincts of the temple at Tiruvaṇṇāmalai in the place occupied by the Periyanāṭṭu-maṭam after paying a compensation of 500 poṉ to the latter (Cf. No. 574 of 1902).
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/33 (page 29)
Placement
The Pontiff of the Vēṁbattūr Mutt, South car street, Tinnevelly, through Mr. G.V.Srinivasa Rao of this office.

…
King
Dēvaśikhāmaṇi Mahā-bali-Bāṇādhirāya.

Śaka, 1499, Īśvara, Uttarāyaṇa, Hē-manta-ṛitu, Makara, ba. Amāvāsyā, Mon-day, Śravaṇa.
Language
Tamil
Origin

Remarks
Records the endowment of the village Śendoṭṭiyēndal in Vaigai-vaḷanāḍu, a sub-division of Mūvaraśaṅkōṭṭai-śīrmai in two equal shares to the temple of Kailāsanātha at Vēmbattūr in Kulaśēkhara-chatur-vēdimaṅgalam in Teṉkarai Vēḷvināḍu and to the Śaiva-śikhāmaṇi-maṭha situated in the Tirumaḍaiviḷāgam of the temple and presided over at the time by Śaṅkara-Nārāyaṇāchārya of the Naidhruva-Kāśya-pa-gōtra and of the Dakshiṇa-Gōḷakī-maṭha.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/34 (page 29)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Madura Nāyaka
King
Vīrappa-Nāyaka
Date
Saka 1493, Kollam 747, Prajōtpatti, Paṅguṉi 14, ba. 11 Monday, Śravaṇa.
Language
Tamil
Origin
Returned to the Pontiff.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the grant of the villages Āraikkuḷam and Kiṇattāṅguḷam in O1manallūr-śīrmai of Teṉkarai-nāḍu, a subdivision of Teṉ-maṇḍalam, made at the instance of the chief by the nāṭṭavar of Teṉkarai-nāḍu including those of Siṅgikuḷam for the worship of god Aḻagiyaśokkanāthasvāmi set up in the Teṟku-maṭha at Tirunelvēli in Kīḻvēṁbu-nāḍu and for the maintenance of feeding and for other expenses therein. The maṭha is said to have been presided over by Īśānaśivāchārya, the disciple of Push-palaka. Śivāchārya who was again the dis-ciple of Sarvaśikhāmaṇi Vēmbattūr Muda-liyār Aghōra-Śivāchārya of the Naidhṛiva-Kāśyapa-gōtra.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/35 (page 29)
Placement
Śri Nallagaṇṭla Chenchi Reddi of Dommara-Nandyāla, Jammala-madugu taluk, Cuddapah dis-trict, through Mr. H.K.Nara-simhasvami of this office.

Chōḷa
King
Puṇyakumāra ‘the lord of Hiraṇyarāshṭra’.

King
…

Śaka 1685, Pārthiva, Āshāḍha, śu. 15.
Language
Telugu
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records a grant of land to a certain Vīṇe Kṛishṇamāchārlu by the Reḍḍi and Karaṇam of Kūlūru for worship of god Āñjanēyasvāmin of the place. Also refers to an agreement entered into bet-ween Vīṇe-Krishṇama and others on Vaiśākha, śu. 15, in the cyclic year Vikṛiti, but the details of the agreement are lost.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/37 (page 30)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1683, Tāraṇa, Vaiśākha, śu. 15.
Language
…
Origin
Returned to the Pontiff.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Registers grant of lands as bhaṭavṛitti-mänya by the Reḍḍis and Karaṇams of the villages Paiḍela and Arakaṭavēmula to Vīṇe Kṛishṇamāchāryulu, the archaka of the village Paiḍela. The first few lines on this plate (lines 1 to 10) seem to be connected with the agreement entered into between Vīṇe Krishṇama and others referred to above (No. 36) and lines 11 to 57 to another agreement entered into by the same person with certain others on Mārgaśira, śu. 12, in the cyclic year Virō-dhin.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/38 (page 30)
Placement
Prof. S.V.Venkatesvara, M.A., Gopalapuram, Madras.
Dynasty
Sāḷuva
King
Immaḍi Nṛisiṁharāya
Date
Śaka 1414 (expressed by chronogram), Parīdhāvi, Vaiśā-kha, śu. paur-ṇamāsī.
Language
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the Pontiff.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Māgenagere as an agrahāra under the new name Immaḍi-Śrī-Narasiṁhapuram in the Rodda-nāḍu, a subdivision of Penuguṇḍa-sthala, by the king, divided into 28 shares among several learned Brāhmaṇas of various gōtras and sūtras.
ARIE/1939-1943/A/1939-40/39 (page 30)
Placement
The Tahsildar, Gurazala, Guntur district, through Mr. G.C. Chandra, Archaeological Super-intendent, Southern Circle, Madras.
Dynasty
Eastern Chāḷuk-ya.
King
Jayasiṁhavallabha-Mahā rāja (I)
Date
30th year, Āśvayuja, śu. [5], Chandravāra, Śravaṇa.
Language
Sanskrit in early Telugu characters
Origin
Acquired for the Indian Museum, Calcutta.
Edition
Epigraphia Indica
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Kōṇeki in Paḷḷi-rashṭra by Vishṇuvardhana-Mahā-rāja, son of Indravarma-Mahārāja, the younger brother of the ruling king, on the occasion of the lunar eclipse in the month of Māgha. The village was divided into 120 shares and allotted to several Brāhmaṇas in specified proportion. Re-fers to a previous donee of part of the village by name Vidu-Śarmā of Ātukūru, the son of Mahāsēna-Śarmā, who is said to have been known as Adyakāla-Vararu-chi on account of his great scholarship.

APPENDIX A


List of copper-plates examined during the year 1941-42.


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/1 (page 31)
Placement
Krishnattevar of Kuppaṇāpuram, Kadambur Zamindari.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1579, Kollam, 833, Friday, daśa-mī, Mṛigaśīrshā.
Language
Tamil
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the conferment of the title of Valaṅgai-puli and the insignia of a Hanuma-koḍi (monkey-flag), with the right of collect-ing certain matrimonial and funeral dues in the neighbouring localities, by the heads of seventy-four families of the gold-smith community, on Nallaperumāḷ Tēvaṉ for his victory over their opponents.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/2 (page 31)
Placement
Dr. N.Venkataramanayya, M.A., Ph.D., Madras University, Mad-ras.
Dynasty
Pallava
King
Siṁhavarma Mahārāja
Date
12th year, Jyēshṭha, ba. 13.
Language
Sanskrit in Pallava characters
Origin
Returned to the owner.
Edition
Epigraphia Indica
Remarks
Registers the grant of the village Neḍuṅ-garāya in Muṇḍarāshṭra, by Yuvama-hārāja Vishṇugōpavarman, the son of Skandavarman, the grandson of Vīra-varman and the great-grandson of Skanda-varman of the Bhāradvāja-gōtra, to the three donees Doḍḍisvāmin, Kaṇṇa-svāmin and Nandisvāmin, of whom the first is given half the share, the second two-thirds of the remaining half, and the third the rest of the village which was con-verted into a Śāraṇikayrāma (asylum) and was exempted from the 18 kinds of imposi-tions (?), the dēvabhōga lands in it being set apart. These exemptions were ordered to be maintained by the state officers such as the āyuktakas, naiyōgikas, rājavallabhas etc. (Edited in the Telugu Journal, Bhārati Vol. XVIII, part I, pp. 699 ff.)
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/3 (page 31)
Placement
Rao Bahadur S.T. Srinivasagopa-lacharya, Advocate, Vepery, Madras.
Dynasty
…
King
Narapatirāya Chōḷa-Chakravarti.
Date
Virōdhi. Śrāvaṇa, śu. 5, Saṅkramaṇa, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Origin
Do.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records the purchase of the village Heb-baṭa by Nariya of that place, for which transaction Chōḷa-Baicha advanced the money at a specified interest and Guru-rāja and Gaṅga-Perma stood as witnesses. The engraver of the record was Rāyēndra-chōḷāchāri. In characters of about the 13th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/4 (page 31)
Placement
Dr. N.Venkataramanayya, M.A., Ph.D., Madras University, Madras.
Dynasty
Gajapati
King
Pratāpa Haṁvīra
Date
Śaka 1383, Vṛisha, Bhādrapada, śu. 1, Friday.
Language
Sanskrit & Telugu in Telugu
Origin
Do.
Edition
Do.
Remarks
Registers the grant of the village Chiru-vṟōlu together with Mēḷḷamiṟṟus situated on the bank of the Kṛishṇā, as a oarvamān-ya-agrahāra to several Brāhmaṇas of various gōtras by the king, renaming the village Pratāpa-Hamvīrakumāra-pura, after his own name.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/7 (page 32)
Placement
Rao Bahadur, S.T.Srinivasagopa-lacharya, Advocate, Madras.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēvarāya
Date
Śaka 1435, Āṅgirasa, Māgha, Makara-saṅkramaṇa, Kṟishṇa-paksha, Monday.
Language
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Origin
Do.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Registers the gift of the village Haralakuṇṭa alias Kṛishṇarāyasamudra in Kōlāḷa-mahārājya as sarvamānya and ēkabhōga to the Brāhmaṇa Varadarāja who belonged to the Kauṇḍinya-gōtra and Āpastamba-sūtra, who was well versed in the Vēdas, Vēdāṅ-gas, Śāstras and Alaṅkāras and who adorned, like the moon, the sea (i.e., the family) of Kēśava. The gift was made in the presence of god Virūpāksha on the bank of the Tuṅgabhadrā.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/8 (page 32)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
…
Date
…
Language
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Origin
Returned to the Pontiff.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
The set of plates is incomplete. The pre-served portion which consists of the first and the last plates of the set gives the genealogy of the dynasty as in other re-cords commencing with the moon and as far as Narasa of the Tuḷuva dynasty. The portion delineating the boundaries of the gift village mentions its name as Kāla-vaṁgapāḍi alias Basavāpuram.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/9 (page 32)
Placement
Pūjāri Appayya of Sōmaghaṭṭa, Hindupur taluk, Anantapur dis-trict.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1413, Bahu-dhānya, Kārttika, śu. 15, Wednesday.
Language
Telugu
Origin
Returned to the Pontiff.
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions.
Remarks
Records that Pedda Hōbaḷa Reḍḍi, adminis-tering the six samutus under Mahāṃaḍalēś-vara Mahārāja Śrī Munnā Kṛishṇarāyala-vāru ruling from Penugoṇḍa-paṭṭaṇa, having undertaken to go on a pilgrimage to Ahōbilam to fulfil a vow made by his forefathers, was instructed by the god, in a dream, to construct a temple for him at Śāṇḍilya-kshētra near Sōmaghaṭṭa, where-in he (the god) would appear as Madhugiri Lakshmī-Narasiṁha, and that having constructed the temple accordingly he secured the village Kanirāḷḷapalle in the Gōraṇtla-samutu to the god as rāyadatti from the king and also arranged for en-dowments for an archaka to conduct wor-ship of the god.

List of copper-plates examined during the year 1942-43.

Mr. Periyasvami Iyer of Tārā-maṅgalam, through the Tahsildar of O1malūr, Salem district.

Language

Origin
…
Edition
South Indian Inscriptions
Remarks
Records a grant of land by different persons for worship of God Sōmēśvara at Vana-vāsi included in the Kāvēripuram-sīrmai of Vañji-nāḍu. Also records a subse-quent endowment of land to the same temple in the next year, Durmukhi, by different officials. Same as C.P. No. 195 of Sewell's List.
ARIE/1939-1943//1942-43/2 (page 33)
Placement
Śiva temple at Sarugani, (Parama-gudi taluk), through the Revenue Divisional officer, Dēvakōṭṭah, Ramnad district.

Kumāra Muttu Vijaya Raghunātha Sētupati.

Language
Tamil
Origin
…
Edition
…
Remarks
Records a gift of land besides authorising a levy of 2 paḍi of paddy per family, for the upkeep of a maṭha and a tank, evidently at Śivagaṅga. The Sētupati chief is introduced with a number of high-sounding titles.

Also states that this is a copy of a stone record engraved on the east side of the central shrine of the Śiva temple at Rādhāpuram (No. 356 of 1930).

Remarks
Records grant of land in the village of Maṇḍa in Guddavāḍi-vishaya, by the king to Āṁkaya alias Samastabhuvanā-śraya Brahmamahārāja, son of Rāmadēva and grandson of Śivakumārabhaṭṭa of the Bhāradvāja-gōtra and Āpastaṁba-sūtra. The land granted is stated to have been measured by the rod called Mummaḍi-Bhīmakōla. Published in Bhārati, Vol. XX, pt. 2, pp. 177-193.

APPENDIX B


List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40.


CUDDAPAH DISTRICT


SIDDHAVATTAM TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/1 (page 35)
Placement
Aṭlūru.--Two fragments of a slab lying near the Gaṅgamma temple.
Dynasty
Kākatīya
King
[Ru]dradēva-Mahārāja, ‘lord of Anu-makoṇḍapura’.
Date
Śaka 1190, [Pra]bha-va, Phālguṇa, śu. 15, Thursday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary. Registers certain grants of money-income made for the worship of the god, probably at Jyōti by a subordi-nate (name lost) of the king, of whose titles Maṇḍalika-brahmarākshasa and Jagaddaḷa-Gaṇḍapeṇḍāra are preserved.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/2 (page 35)
Placement
Slab lying in a field about a furlong to the east of the Gaṅgamma temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivarāyadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1464, Parā-bhava (wrong), Āshāḍha, ba. 14.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the grant of several taxes such as Kaṭṭapannu (?) Kāṇike, Veṭṭikūḍam and Dommaripannu to the barber, Koṇḍōju of Aṭlūru, by Māḍrāja Rāmarājayyadēva-Mahārāja at the instance of Rāmarāja and with the permission of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/3 (page 35)
Placement
Brāhmaṇapalle.--Slab set up in the tank-bed to the north of Gaṭṭupalle.
Dynasty
Kāyastha
King
Aṁbadēva-Mahārāja
Date
Saka 1212, Vikṛita, Bhādrapada, śu. 5, Thursday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged. Records the construction of the tank at Rāvula-kolanu, the demarcation of its boundaries and gift of some land (?) by Mahāpradhāni Gōḍerāya Gaṅgidēvayaṁgāru.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/4 (page 35)
Placement
Chelamāreḍḍipalle.--Slab set up near the well on the way to Ponnavōlu.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Characters are of the 17th century A.D. Registers a grant of land as baṭṭayitu (bhaṭṭavṛitti)-mānyam made by the sthānikas of the Ishṭakāmīśvara and Bhairavēśvara temples to Kāma-rusu Timmayaṁgāru for having constructed a tank and channels at Ponnavōlu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/5 (page 35)
Placement
Cheṇḍuvāyi.--Slab in a field (Survey No. 50) near the satra.
Dynasty
Kākatīya
King
Pratāparudra
Date
Śaka 1241, [Si]ddhār-thin, Śrāvaṇa, śu. 15, Wednesday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that while Mahāpradhāni Juṭṭaya-Leṁka was ruling over Pottapi, Sakhali and Mulkināṇḍu, his younger brother Rudraya-Leṁka, who was staying at Kaḍapa in Mulki-nāṇḍu, having taken a sacred bath on the day of the lunar eclipse, granted for the merit of the king, the several incomes such as the rācha-śrōtriyam, the arigōru-pannu, kāṇika, etc., in the village Cheṇḍuvāyi, situated in Sakhali-bhūmi, for the midday offerings of the god Siddhanātha.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/6 (page 35)
Placement
Slab set up near the temple of Ellamma
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1694, Nandana, Chaitra, śu. 15.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers grants of land made by the Reḍḍi and Karaṇam of the village to Ellamma, the village goddess situated on the bank of the Pinākinī and the god Mallēśvara of Kūrmagiri.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/7 (page 35)

…
Language
Telugu (archaic)
Remarks
In characters of about the 8th century A.D. Mentions a certain Bōdaṟāviti and seems to refer to some writing exe-cuted by Bārāṇuṇḍu in accordance with the former's wish (?).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/8 (page 35)
Placement
Chiṭṭāyapalle. (hamlet of Malinēnipaṭ-ṇam).--Broken slab lying near the ruined temple of Śiva to the east of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1172, Sādhāra-ṇa, Pushya, Ar-dhōdaya.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Registers certain grants of land made by Mahāsāmanta Kāṭama-Nāyaka, and his brother, for the merit of their overlord.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/9-12 (page 35)
Placement
Doṅgalasāni.--(hamlet of Kuruguṇṭa-palle).--Slab set up by the side of the image of Āñjanēya.
Dynasty
Telugu-Chōḍa
King
Nallasiddharasa-Dēvachōḍa-Mahārāja
Date
Śaka 1081, Pramādi, Māgha, śu. 15, Ar-dhōdaya.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records that Nallachiddarasa (Nallasiddharasa) ruling at Nellūrupaṭṭaṇa, having started out on a campaign of victory, his subordinates Mahāpradhāni, Sandhivigrahi Rēvaṇa-Heg-gaḍe and his brother Pōtaṇa-Heggaḍe encountered. Mallidēva and Sōmēśvaradēva, the chiefs of Pottapidēśa, at Doṅgalasāni and that the former, i.e., Rēvaṇa-Heggaḍe having routed Mallidēva and killed Sōmēśvaradēva along with twelve other chiefs and a thousand men, dispersed several others and lost his life in the battle field. His brother Pōtaṇa-Heggaḍe, along with others, having reported the success of the fight to his overlord Nallachiddarasa, installed perpetual lamps at the mahāsthānas of Mallikār-juna, Tripurāntaka, Siddhavaṭa, Aṇaṁpura and Māhēśvara for the merit of his brother and himself. Also records the pratishṭhā of a Vishṇu image at the frontier of Peḍanāḍu and the endowment of 10 vṛittis of land made to it by Kāvaṇa-Heggaḍe, son of Rēvaṇa-Heggaḍe, for the merit of his parents Rēvaṇa and Dāramāmbike. The Telugu (in Telugu and Nāgarī characters) and Tamil versions of the same inscrip-tion are written in order after the above. The Tamil version, besides mentioning the above details, adds that Sōmēśvara and Mallidēva were the sons of Vimalāditya and that the inscription was engraved in the time of Kulōttuṅgadēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/13 (page 36)
Placement
Slab lying in front of the Āñjanēya temple
Dynasty
Telugu-Chōḍa
King
Vaṁkeya-Chōla Mahārāja
Date
[4]1st regnal year (in words), Chiṭṭe (Chaitra), [śu.] daśami, Sunday.
Language
Telugu (archaic)
Remarks
Commences with the praśasti ‘Svasti charaṇa-sarōruha’, etc.; registers grants of land made by the king, who bears the titles Teṅkaṇāditya, Komarara-Bhīma and Pusiyilladāmta, to the goddess Kuruva-Bhaṭāri. The characters belong to about the 9-10th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/14 (page 36)
Placement
Back of the slab containing the image of Āñjanēya.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Hēviḷaṁbi
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Seems to register a remission of some tolls in favour of a certain individual (name lost).

…

Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/18 (page 36)
Placement
Two broken slabs lying in Survey No. 186
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
The beginning of the inscription on one slab is lost. It regis-ters a gift of taxes collected at the Li gāla-tīrtha by the Reḍḍis and Karaṇas of Gaṅgapērūru to the goddess Vuṭa-laṁma of the village, the goddess Gaṇa-Kalidēvī of Māṁ- chupalle and other deities for the annual worship. The other inscription which is a fragment refers to (god) Rāma seated on the throne in the E1kavīra-mukhamaṇḍapa at Māchupalle and to the śeṭṭis, who were probably the devotees of the god. The characters of both the inscriptions belong to about the 15th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/19 (page 37)

Language
Telugu

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/23 (page 37)
Placement
Guṇḍlamaḍa.--Slab set up in the Mukti-kōṭīvarasvāmin temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1457, Man-matha, Chaitra śu. 15.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged. Registers gift of land made by Nainārayya, the Kāryakartta of Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Salakarāja China-Tiru-malayyadēva-Mahārāja to god [Muktikō]ṭīśvarasvāmin of Kalikiri in the Siddhavaṭam-sīma, for daily worship.

Another slab set up in the same place
Dynasty

King
…

Language

Jonnavanam


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/25 (page 37)
Placement
Slab set up in front of the image of Āñja-nēya in the tank-bed to the north-east of the village.
Dynasty
[Vijayanagara]
King
…
Date
Śaka 146[6]
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Highly damaged. Seems to register gift of taxes made by Māḍrāju samarājayyadēva-Mahārāja at Jonnavaram, prob-ably to the local temple. To the north of the same village is a broken slab lying in the ‘nīlitoṭṭi’ containing a damaged inscription in which only a few letters in Telugu and Tamil are alone legible.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/31 (page 37)
Placement
Kōṭapāḍu.--Slab in the Āvulamāla, 1(1/2) miles to the west of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1530 (wrong), Paridhāvin, Māgha, śu. 1.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that Kōṭapāṭi Basi-Reḍi, China-Māchu Māchi-Reḍḍi, Karaṇam Vīrappa and China-Rāmanna conducted a parsha for the cattle belonging to Rāvivāru, had the cows and bulls sculptured (on slabs) and endowed lands at Kōṭapāḍu in the name of Ellappa, probably for having carved the sculptures.

Language
Telugu

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/33 (page 38)
Placement
Māchupalle.--Slab set up near a well called Guruvi Reḍḍi-bhāvi near the ruined temple of Śiva.
Dynasty
…
King
Traiḷōkyamalla Sōmidēva-Mahārāja
Date
Śaka [11]78, Rāk-shasa, Karkaṭaka, śu. Paurṇamāsī, Tuesday, Tiruvō ṇam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Māśaruppaḷḷi near the southern gateway of Śrīparvata by Gaṅgaiyasāhaṇiyār, the chief of Vallūr in Mutti-vaḷanāḍu, to a certain Kālaḍi Vāsudēva-Nāyakar of Malaimaṇḍalam, who in turn endowed some lands therein for early morning service in the temple of Siddavaḍam-uḍaiya-Nāyaṉār and for feeding Sanyāsis and Brāhmaṇas coming from Malai-maṇḍalam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/34 (page 38)
Placement
Māḍapūru.--Slab lying near the image of Mādhavarāya on the hill to the west of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1451, Virōdhin, Kārttika, śu. 1[5].
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Records a gift of land at Māḍa-pūru made by Pōtināyani Nāgamanāyaniṅgāru to Mādha-vayaṁgāru, the Karaṇam of the village, probably for the worship of god [Tiru]veṅgaḷanātha. The village Māḍupūru is stated to have been included in the Udayagiri-durga and to have been given to the donor by Ayyaparusu-Nāyaṁkulu, son of Rāyasam Timmarusu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/35 (page 38)
Placement
Maddulēṭigaḍḍa (hamlet of Kuruguṇ-ṭapalle)--Slab lying on the hillock west of the tank.
Dynasty
Telugu-Chōḍa
King
Tirukāletidēva-Chōḍa-Mahārāja ‘ruling at Kāñchīpuram’.
Date
Śaka 1153, Nandana
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Mutilated. Registers grants of land made into the hands of Sigabaḷa and [Vi]llinaṁbi probably for the worship of god Śrī Rāmadēva and for paying certain wages and main-taining some evening lamps, etc. The donor's name is lost.

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks

States also that the heroine, Nimatyamma, the daughter of Māchi-Reḍḍi, took her (final) stand to the north of the Rāmasvāmin temple at Oṇṭimiṭṭa.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/53 (page 40)
Placement
Rāchāyapēṭā (hamlet of Chintarāju-palle).--Slab set up on the tank bund.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1710, Saumya, Māgha, ba. 5, Fri-day, Hastā.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that Appalreḍḍi-Gaṅgireḍḍi, Peda-Pōlreḍḍi, Veṅgal-reḍḍi and China-Pōlreḍḍi, sons of Kaluvāyi Buchchi-Rāmi-reḍḍi Nārāyaṇamma, having decided to construct a tank across the Tummalayēru at Rāchāyapalle, Ādūri Pāpireḍḍi, the Reḍḍis and Saṁbaṭūri Rāmachandruḍu and others, and the Karaṇams of the village obtained permission of the government (divāṇaṁvāru), constructed the tank, established an agrahāra on śu. 15 in Māgha in the year Ānanda, on the occasion of a lunar eclipse, and settled in it Brāhmaṇas of the three sects granting them 10 vṛittis of land. Also gives details of the taxes levied on lands cultivated under the tank, the mānyas given to the bōyas who constructed the tank and to the others who were entrusted with its upkeep.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/54 (page 40)

Language
Persian verse-in-T6h6ult6h6.
Remarks
The mosque was built by Sayyid Muh2ammad in 1113-H during the reign of Aurangzeb. Sayyid Muh2ammad also laid out a garden around the mosque. This and the following four inscriptions were kindly deciphered and translated by Mr. G.Yazdani, the Government Epigraphist for Moslem Inscriptions.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/68 (page 41)
Placement
Vīrūru.--Broken slab lying near the image of Vīrabhadra.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1446, Sarvajit, Vaiśākha, ba. 15, Monday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Seems to register a grant of their incomes by Sarasvati Mādha-varāju, Taligaḷa Tirumalarāju, Kūtari Tirumalayya Gōvin-dayya, etc., at the instance of the twenty-four families of their community to a person named Bōḍiliṅgaya for worship of Mahāliṅga, Vīrēśvara, Perumāḷu, Akkaladēvī and other deities of Vīrūru, and for offering food to the local people (suradēśis, i.e., svadēśis) as well as the outsiders (paradēśis). The grant was made in the presence of the assembly of the members of Ayyāvaḷi.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/69 (page 41)

…

Śaka 1608, Krödhana, Phālguṇa, śu. 12.

Telugu
Remarks
Damaged. Seems to refer to the construction of a tank to the east of Boḍḍecherla alias Achchutarāyapuram and west of Mallemkoṇḍa in O1baḷam situated in Siddhavaṭam-sīma included in the Udayagiri sīma, and to the grants of land made probably for its upkeep.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/70 (page 41)
Placement
O1gūru.--Broken slab in a field about a furlong to the east of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary and damaged. Only the imprecatory portion of the inscription is preserved. The characters belong to about the 16th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/71 (page 41)
Placement
Slab in a field near the shrine of Gaṅg-amma.
Dynasty
Telugu-Chōḍa
King
Tirukāḷattidēva-Chōḍa-Mahārāja
Date
Śaka 1159, Hēmaḷaṁ-bin, Māgha, śu. 11, Monday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the pratishṭhā of god Mallināthadēva at O1ṁgūrū and the gifts of land made to the temple for daily worship of the god by Nala-Sūrapa-Nāhiḍu, a servant of Mahā-maṇḍalēśvara Kāmayadēva-Mahārāja of the Mukaṁṭi Kāḍuveṭṭi family. Mentions also Mallajiyya, Mupajiyya and Pinnajiyya, the sthānapatis of the temple.

GUNTUR DISTRICT


PALNAD TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/72 (page 41)
Placement
Mācherla.--A hero-stone lying by the side of the stream Chandravaṅka.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records that Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Mallidēvarāja, son of Vijaya-ladēvī, along with his uncle Vallamarāja, killed a certain Baṁḍabolle (?). The characters belong to about the 11th century A.D.

BAPATLA TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/73 (page 42)
Placement
Chēbrōlu.--White marble pillar in front of the Bhīmēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
Chōḍa
Date
Śaka 1089,...rākā, i.e., Paurṇamī.
Language
Sanskrit in Telugu
Remarks
Built in towards the end. Registers a gift of ten perpetual lamps made by Kāṭama-Śeṭṭi, the son of Nārāyaṇa and the grandson of Kāṭama-Śeṭṭi who belonged to the Māsaṁta-gōtra.

KARKAL TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/74 (page 42)

…
King
…
Date

Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers gifts of lands made by Pārśvadēvī Binnāṇi, the sister of Pāṇḍyapparasa-Binnāṇi and others for the worship of the deities such as Pārśvanātha, Ananta-Tīrthaṁkara, the 24 Tirthaṁkaras, Chandranātha, etc., in the temple.

Placement
Another broken slab set up behind the same basti.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1520, Hēmaḷaṁ-bi, Pushya, śu. 2, Friday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of land made by the donor mentioned above, i.e., Pārśvadēvī Binnāṇi, to the temple for worship of the deities, Mēgaṇanele Chandranātha, Ananta-Tīrthaṁkara, Chavis-Tīrthakaras, Vardhamāna-Tīrthakara, etc.

Do.

Tamil

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/92 (page 44)
Placement
West wall of the Naṭarāja-maṇḍapa in the same temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍya-dēva.
Date
1[2]th year, Kārtti gai 6, Sunday, Hastā.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the Turivāyppāḍi-nāṭṭavar of the eighteen coun-tries assembled in the hall called Amudavallavan-tiru-maṇḍapa, agreed to give for each tiṟam (i.e., herd of 80 sheep, 80 cows and 80 buffaloes), a heifer, a lamb and a young buffalo to the god Tiruvottūruḍaiya-Nāyaṉār for the favours received by their ‘caste and family’.

Tribh. Rājarājadēva

14th year (in words)
Language
Tamil

Records the gift of the village Śiṟṟiyāṟṟūr in Māvaṇḍūr-ērivāyp-paṟṟu, in Kāśirambēḍu-nāḍu, a subdivision of Kāliyūr-kōṭṭam, a district of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, by Seṅgēṇi Vīrapperumāḷ Attimallaṉ Ediriliśōḻa-Śambuvarāyaṉ as dēva-dāna to the temple. States further that the chief confirmed the order of his great-great-grand-father remitting the taxes on the dēvadāna villages of Tiruvottūr, Vayalūr, Aṇḍili, etc. for worship and offerings to the god.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/106 (page 45)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
17th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the village Śiṟṟiyāṟṟūr mentioned above was resumed by Vikramaśōḻa-Śambuvarāya, and that Dāmō-daraṉ Perumāṇḍi-Nāyaka, with the permission of Gaṇḍa-gōpāla, got back half of this village as dēvadāna of the temple, while the other half was assigned as maḍappuṟam for feeding itinerant Māhēśvaras in the Puṭpagiri (Pushpagiri)-jīyar-maṭha. This new order was engraved in the temple with the permission of Vīrapperumāḷ alias Ediriliśōḻa-Śambu-varāyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/107 (page 45)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Sāḷuva
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Narasiṅgayyadēva-Mahārāja.
Date
Virōdhi, Māgha, śu. 15.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that on information being received from his officers Mādirāja Chennaya and Chokka-Nāyiṉār that the village and the temple lands were completely washed away by the floods, the king remitted an amount of 150 honnu (gold) out of the jōḍi, śūlavari, paṭṭaḍai and nūlāyam due from the temple and the village, to provide for the repair of the breaches and for conducting festivals in the temple.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/110 (page 46)
Placement
East wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāja
Date
Śaka 1466 (1469 ?), Plavaṅga, Pushya, ba. 10, Thursday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the renovation of the Yāgaśāla and the kitchen in the temple of god Vēdapurīśvara at Tiruvattūr and the gift of some ornaments to the god by Daḷavāyi Gōpa Nāyiniṅ-gāru.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/111 (page 46)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Śambuvarāya
King
Sakalalōkachakravartin Rājanārāya-ṇa Śambuvarāya.
Date
6th year, Mārgaḻi, 20
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the details of taxes to be collected per loom from the Kaikōḷas of Tiruvottūr.

King

Tamil

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/123 (page 47)

King

Date
15th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/126 (page 47)
Placement

Dynasty
Pallava
King
Kōpperuñjiṅgadēva
Date
21st year (in figures and words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the temple of Āḷuḍaiyār Tevvai-Nāyaka at Tiruk-kāmakkōṭṭapuṟam-Sumaṅgali in Kāyirambēḍu-nāḍu, a sub-division of Kāliyūr-kōṭṭam, a district of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, was in ruins for a long time and that it was dismantled and re-constructed of stone by three persons of Vāvalūr named Udaiyaṉ Oṟṟikoṇḍāṉ, Āḍuvāṉ Śelvan and Perumāṉ Agattiyāḻvāṉ.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/144 (page 49)
Placement
Slab set up in front of the same temple
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva-Mahārāya, son of Nara-siṁhadēva-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1431, Śukla, Makara, śu. 10, Thursday, Punar-pūśam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that owing to the levy of jōḍi tax on temple lands by Rāmappa-Nāyaka, the Mugappāvāḍai officer of Narasiṁha-rāya, many temples became neglected, and that Krishṇa-dēvarāya, on the occasion of his accession to the throne, made all the dēvadāna lands sarvamānya including those belonging to the Jaina and Buddhist temples in Paḍaivīṭṭu-rājya, and Chandragiri-rājya, by which the Jaina temple Vīrarājēndraśōḻapperumbaḷḷi at Karandai was also bene-fited.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/145 (page 49)
Placement
Pedestal with marks of two feet cut in relief, set up near the same gōpura.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Sanskrit in Grantha
Remarks
An invocation for the undying fame of Samantabhadra, the sun to the lotus heart (i.e., teacher) of Pushpasēna-yōgīndra. In characters of about the 16th century A.D.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/148 (page 49)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
[Parakēsari]varman alias Rājēndra-Chōḷadēva.
Date
(Lost)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Built in the middle. Begins with the introduction Tiru-maṉṉi vaḷara, etc. Seems to record an agreement given by the ūrār of Paṟambūr to measure out a specified quantity of paddy in the temple for the money endowed by a certain Paṇḍārakkiḻāṉ Ravi of the village. On the top of this inscription is a record of two lines stating that a certain Ottūr Śivaṉ set up a pāda-pīṭha for Mahādēva.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/154 (page 50)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
[Rājakēsari]varman alias Rājarājadēva
Date
[23]rd year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Commences with the introduction Tirumagaḷ-pōla, etc. Seems to record an endowment for lamps to the parivāradēvas such as Gaṇapati, Sapta-mātrikas, Subrah-maṇya, Tirukkēṭṭaikkiḻatti-Bhaṭāri, i.e., Jyēshṭhādēvī, Durgā Chaṇḍēśvara and Kshētrapāla, in the tiruvuṇṇāḷigai of the temple of Ūrāṇi-Nakkar at Paṟambūr in Śrīkāmakkōṭṭapu-ṟam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/155 (page 50)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Stones lost in the middle. Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷpōla, etc. States that the officer, Śēnāpati Rāja-rāja-Mārāyar, made arrangements for burning lamps before the goddess Mukkarai-Naṅgai at Tiruppaṟambūr, including those endowed previously and in the 25th year of Kaṉṉa-radēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/156 (page 50)
Placement
Ukkal.--North wall of the central shrine, Vaidyanāthasvāmin temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman Tribh. Vīra-Pāṇḍyadēva
Date
25th year and 360th day.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an order of Kulaśēkhara Śambuvarāya remitting certain specified taxes due from the tirumaḍaiviḷāgam of the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/157 (page 50)
Placement
North and west walls of the same shrine
Dynasty
[Śambuvarāya]
King
Sakalalōkachakravarttin Rājanārāya-ṇaṉ.
Date
7th year (in words) Āḍi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a remission of taxes due from Paḻampaṭṭu including Attippaṟṟu, by the chief, to provide for offerings, worship, lamps, etc., to the temple of Peruntirukkōyiluḍaya-Nāya-ṉār at Ukkal.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/158 (page 50)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-chōḷadēva ‘who took Pūrvadēśam, Gaṅgai and Kiḍāram’.
Date
29th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that this stone temple was constructed by the officer Kumārakāḷaṉ Vāsudēvaṉ alias Atiśayaśōḻa-Mūvēndavēḷār of Ukkal.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/162 (page 51)
Placement
North and east walls of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Śambuvarāya
King
Sakalalōkachakravarttin Rājanārāya-ṇaṉ Śambuvarāya.
Date
2[6]th year, Śaka 1284, Śubhakṛit, Mēsha, śu. 4, Wed-nesday, Rōhiṇī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records sale of the village Pādiritāṅgal by the assembly of Ukkal alias Vikramābharaṇa-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Pāgūr-nāḍu to two persons for 200 Vīrachampaṉ-kuḷigai to provide funds for renovating thersluice of the tank to the south of the village, which had been in disrepair for a long time.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/163 (page 51)

Dynasty

Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/166 (page 51)
Placement
Three stones built into the same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Parakē....
Date
15th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragmentary. Seems to record a sale of land by the Mahā-sabhā of Vikramābharaṇa-chaturvēdimaṅgalam to ‘Vīra-śōḻaterinda-Kaikkōḷar’ for being endowed to the temple. Two other fragments in slightly later characters found on the same wall record an endowment of land for providing offer-ings during the last service of the day in the temple of Perun-tirukkōyil-perumānaḍigal, by a number of persons.

…
Language
Early Brāhmī
Remarks
Seems to record that this cavern was the gift of a certain chief (name lost) who captured Toṟūr and was the work of a mason (?) called Chālāvaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/171a (page 51)

Tamil

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/172 (page 52)
Placement
Kūḻamanḍal.--West and south walls of the central shrine in the ruined Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1451, Virōchchi (Virōdhi), Mithuna, ba. 10, Monday, Attam (Hastā).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Seems to record the sale of the tenancy right over two villages called E1ḻāyirachchēri and Kurukambichchēri belonging to Ukkal alias Vikramābharaṇa-chaturvēdimaṅ-galam in Kāliyūr-Pākka-nāḍu, a subdivision of Jayaṅ-goṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam by their four joint owners Śīrāmaṉ Baṭṭar Periyanādar Piḷḷai, Śiṟunādar Piḷḷai, Kēśavabaṭṭar Achchā Piḷḷai and Gaṅgaiyāḍi Nārāyaṇa Piḷḷai, to certain Mudaliyārs residing at Śaṉṉaiviḷāgam, in specified propor-tion.

VELLORE TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/173 (page 52)
Placement
Tippasamudram.--Stone called ‘Śūlak-kal’ set up in the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Śrīraṅgadēva-Mahā-rāya.
Date
Śaka 1497, Yuva, Makara, ba. trayō-daśi, Wednesday.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of the village Vaḻiviḷattimaṅgalam alias Tippasamudram by Chiṉṉa Bommu-Nāyaka of Vēlūr with the permission of Kṛishṇappa-Nāyaka and Śrīraṅgadēva-Mahārāya to the temple of Jvarakaṇṭhēśvara-svāmi at Vēlūr. The other face of the stone contains in relief the figures of a śūla, sun and moon.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/174 (page 52)
Placement
Stone set up on the bund of the lake
Dynasty
Pallava
King
Kampavikramavarman
Date
17th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records that Pṛithiyaṅgaraiyar and his wife Ilāḍapperun-dēviyār constructed as the gift of their daughter Ayyakkuṭṭi, a channel, called Viḻuppēraraiyaṉ, from the river to the tank at Valivalakkamaṅgalam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/175 (page 52)
Placement

Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājadēva
Date
Śaka 1159, 22nd year (in words), Āḍi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of land by Āṭkoṇḍavilli Eppōdumiṉiyāṉ, the headman of Valivalam after purchase from Piḷḷayār Edirili-śōḻa-Śambuvarāyar for burning a perpetual lamp in the temple of Uḍaiyār Vaḻittuṇai-Nāyaṉār.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/193 (page 53)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 13th century A.D. Records the imposition among themselves of the magamai tax on articles of merchandise at certain specified rates, in favour of the god Vaḻittuṉai-Nāyaṉār ‘who changed green-gram into pepper’, by the ‘merchants of the 18 countries trading in the four directions.’
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/194 (page 54)

Dynasty

Tamil

Do.
King

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/196 (page 54)
Placement
East wall of the second prākāra in the same temple.
Dynasty
Śaṁbuvarāya
King
Sakalalōkachakravarttin Rājanārā-yaṇa-Śambuvarāya.
Date
3rd year, Mīṉa, ba. [10], Wednesday, Uttiraṭṭādi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Records grant of land and house-site by the trustees of the temple of Vaḻittuṇai-Nāyaṉār at Tiruviriñchipuram to Arippāḷidēva of Perumbaṟṟappuliyūr for the consideration of a tūṇi of paddy every day and 20 paṇam per year to be paid by him to the temple.

Placement
South wall of the same prākāra
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
5th year, Āḍi
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the grant made by the temple to Aṇṇāḻvi Arippāili-dēva (see the number above) should also be extended to god Varadarāja on the same terms.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/198 (page 54)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Dundubhi, Āḍi 9
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Refers to the destruction of a channel by floods in the river and to the digging of a tank and a channel in the limits of the village Vēppūr. Registers re-gift of 1500 kuḻi of land presented for that purpose by the ūrār to Araśar Viṭṭappar, in return for which the authorities (bhaṇḍārat-tār) of the temple agreed to maintain three lamps before the god.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/199 (page 54)
Placement
West wall of same prākāra
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Viruppaṇṇa-Uḍaiyar, son of Hari-hararāya.
Date
Āṅgira, .., śu. 13, Monday, Aniḻam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Purports to be an order of the god granting 7(1/2) vēli of land and house-sites for adhyayana to the Uttiran-bhaṭṭas (Rudra-bhaṭṭas) under the lake Okkaniṉṟāṉ-ēri instead of at Śivaṉ-agaram alias Umāpati-chaturvēdimaṅgalam as the latter proved unsuitable for their living.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/200 (page 54)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Bukkaṇa-Uḍaiyar, son of Harihara-Mahārāja.
Date
Śaka 1324, Chitra-bhānu, Kumbha, śu. 5, Sunday, Aśvati.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Purports to be an order of Chaṇḍēśvara-Nāyinār ratifying the grant of 3 vēli of land under the tank at Paśumāttūr alias Maratakavallinallūr belonging to the god Vaḻittuṇai-Nāyaṉār, and a house-site in the Śeyyāṟṟuveṉṟāṉ-tiruvīdi at Tiruvi-riñchipuram by the ūravar to Tiruvāñjiyamuḍaiyār, a maṭhapati-māhēśvara of the place, for a maṭha and for feed-ing therein five Māhēsvaras daily, in consideration of his efforts in having the tank dug.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/201 (page 55)
Placement
North wall of the same prākāra
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Tribh. Kulaśēkharadēva
Date
25th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Portions left unengraved in the middle. Seems to record gift of cows to the temple, by Amarakōṉ alias Periyāṉ, a shepherd of Tiruvallam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/202 (page 55)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Prauḍha Immaḍi Mallikārjunadēva-Mahārāya, son of Dēvarāya Bhūpa-tirāya, ‘who witnessed the elephant hunt.’
Date
Sarvajit, Mēsha, śu. 10, Rōhiṇī, Friday.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the grant of the hereditary right of tirunundāviḷa-kku-kuḍi for the maintenance of a perpetual lamp in the temple, to Varitta-kōṉ, a shepherd of Śevvūr alias Pāḍi.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/203 (page 55)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
mallikārjunarāya, son of Dēvarāya-Mahārāya, ‘who witnessed the ele-phant hunt.’
Date
Śaka 1370, Prabhava, Mēsha, śu. 1, Utti-rāḍam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a similar assignment, by Deyvaṅgaḷ-Perumāḷ Vayirava-Nāyiṉār, of the tirunundāviḷakku-kuḍi right of the temple of Vaḻittuṇai-Nāyiṉār, to the sons of the shepherd Ariyāṅkōṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/204 (page 55)
Placement
Two stones found in the third prākāra of the same temple, now kept in the first prākāra.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
One of the pieces seems to record a gift of land as tirumaḍa-viḷāgam for the temple of Ādīśvaramuḍaiyār. The other mentions a vaittīyka-bhāga.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/205 (page 55)
Placement
Another stone removed to the same place
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Madiraikoṇḍa Parakēsarin
Date
[3]rd year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Refers to a cattle raid and records the death of a warrior whose figure, holding in his hands a bow and an arrow, is cut in relief beside the inscription,. This inscrip-tion is published in South Indian Inscriptions, Vol. I, No. 126, where, however, only the first two lines are given.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/206 (page 55)
Placement
Third stone in the same place
Dynasty
Pallava
King
Nandivikramavarman
Date
9th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. Mentions Viḍēlviḍugu. Published in South Indian Inscriptions, Vol. I, No. 124, where only the first two lines are given. Seems to record a royal order to the Nagarattār of Śeruvālai-maṅ[galam*] making a sarvaparihāra gift.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/207 (page 55)
Placement
Fourth stone set up in the same place
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
47th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Mentions Kalanippā[kka*]m in Mēyāṟu-nāḍu and refers to a [ka]ṉṉāḍu evidently erected in memory of the hero, who is represented in relief near the inscription with a bow and arrow in his hands. First two lines of the record are published in South Indian Inscriptions, Vol. I, No. 125.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/208 (page 55)
Placement
Fifth stone set up in the same place
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Uḍaiyār Rājēn-dradēva.
Date
5th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷ-virumba, etc. Records a gift of land by a certain Appaṉ Kaṟpakam alias Śōḻa[chūḷā]-maṇi-Viḻupparaiyaṉ, after purchase from the assembly (ūr) of Gaṅgamāttāṇḍapuram in Miyaṟai-nāḍu, a subdivision of Adhirājēndra-vaḷanāḍu in Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, for worship, flowers and lamps to the god Sōmīśvaramuḍaiya-Mahādēva and also for worship in the temple of Durgā in the village. The earlier portion of this inscription is published in South Indian Inscriptions, Vol. I, No. 127.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/209 (page 55)
Placement
Hero stone set up in the same place
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Highly damaged. Seems to refer to the grant of a kannāḍu-to the hero represented, by the side of the inscription, with a bow and a dagger in his hands. The characters are of about the 10th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/210 (page 55)

Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Stones misplaced and portions erased. Records the remission of the taxes such as jōḍi and śūlavari by the king for providing offerings and worship in the temple.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/212 (page 56)
Placement

Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Veṅkaṭapatidēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1527, Viśvāvasu, Ṛishabha, śu. 10, Śrīvāra, Hasta.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an order of Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Jillēḷḷa O1baḷadēva to his pārapatyam officer Periya Kēśava-Nāyaka fixing the rates of taxes on specified professions, made over to the temple, from Viriñchipuram on the south bank of the Pālāṟu in Karaivaḻi Āndi-nāḍu, a subdivision of Paḷuvūr-kōṭṭam, in Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḷa-maṇḍalam, for the merit of Kṛishṇama-rājayaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/213 (page 56)
Placement
Slab set up in front of the Sundarēśvara shrine in the west Māḍa street.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Kali 4994, Nandana, Chittirai 5.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that Mahādēvēndra-Sarasvatisvāmi of the spiritual lineage of Upanishad-Brahmēndra-Sarasvati of Kāñchīpuram, repaired the Mīnākshi-Sundarēśvara temple constructed by Appaya-Dīkshita at Viriñchīpuram with the help of Rāju-Dikshitar belonging to the family of the latter and others, celebrated the kumbhābhishēka and also provided for the worship and offerings of the god therein.

GUDIYATTAM TALUK

SOUTH ARCOT DISTRICT


GINGEE TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/218 (page 56)
Placement
Gingee (Śeñji).--Rock near the magazine in the Rājagiri hill.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Nāgarī (peculiar)
Remarks
The writing seems to be a peculiar mixture of northern and southern varieties of the script and may be assigned to about the 10th century A.D. Mentions Narasiṁha-nṛipa as the donor of some village.

Placement
Tiruvadikkuṉṟam.--Rock on the hill

Do.
King

Date

Damaged and incomplete. Records a royal order issued to the tāṉattār of the temple at Tiruvēṟṟukkuṉṟu remitting certain specified taxes on the lands belonging to the temple.

CUDDALORE TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/223 (page 57)
Placement
Vaḻudalampaṭṭu.--Pillar set up in front of the Subrahmaṇya temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Jaya, Aṟpaśi 10 .. Thursday, Pū-rāḍam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Engraved in characters of the 18th century A.D. Records the offer of asylum and the grant of exemption from āḷ-amañji and talayāri-vari to the settlers in the hamlet of Iḍaṅkoṇḍāpaṭṭu, for the merit of Ayyaṉ Gōvindap ...... by the son of Kayilappar.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/224 (page 57)
Placement
Another pillar set up in the same place.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman alias Rāja-[rājadēva].
Date
[20]th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷpōla etc. Highly damaged. Records the setting up of (this) lamp post. On a stone at the entrance into the temple is a seriously damaged record of about the 15th century A.D. which men-tions Vaḻudalambaṭṭu-śāvaḍi.

TIRUKKOYILUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/225 (page 57)
Placement
Tirunāmanallūr.--North wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the central shrine, Bhaktajanēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-chōḷadēva.
Date
6th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Commences with the introduction Tirumaṉṉi-vaḷara, etc. Records a grant of land by the nagarattār of Tirunāvalūr alias Rājādittadēvapuram, a city in Tirumuṉaip-pāḍi Mēlūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍa-lam, for offerings to the images of Sūryadēva and Nambiyā-rūraṉār (i.e. Sundaramūrti-Nāyaṉār) in the temple of Tirut toṇḍīśvaramuḍaiyār. Records also a further grant of land, after purchase from the same assembly, as dēvadāṉa to the same temple, by Nārakkan Śrī Aranga[ṉ*] Irāmaṉ alias Sēnāpati Rājēndraśōḻa-Brahmamārāyar.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/226 (page 57)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman
Date
3rd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records grant of land to five persons (tirumeḻukiḍum-aḍigaḷmār) for cleaning the precincts of the temple of Tiruttoṇḍīśvarat-tāḷvār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/227 (page 57)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-Chōḷadēva.
Date
6th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumaṉṉi-vaḷara, etc. Records a gift by Āyppāḍi Maḻapāḍi, a Vīraśōḻa-aṇukkaṉ of Śellūr, on behalf of Rājēndraśōḻa-Brahmamārāyar, of a bronze vessel, sheep for providing curds daily to the images of Āḍavalār Nambiyārūraṉār and Gaṇapati, and cows for supplying milk for the bath of the god during the early morning service on Sundays. He arranged for further supply of milk and curd daily to the temple in return for the 32 cows and sheep present-ed by different persons.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/228 (page 57)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
12th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Commences with the same introduction. Records the details of expenditure in the temple as fixed by Āyppāḍi Guṇanidhi of Viḻiyūr, the Kaṇgāṇi-nāyaka of Tirumuṉaippāḍi Mēlūr-nāḍu along with the Karaṇattāṉ, Bhaṇḍāri, Vāriyar, Nagara-ttār, etc., from its income of 1473 and odd kalam of paddy and 79 kaḻañju of gold.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/229 (page 58)
Placement
South wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Choḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra Chōḷadēva.
Date
12th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Do. Records gift of sheep by Vaḍavāyil Ulagaṉ on behalf of Pichchaṉ Vaḍavāyil of Parikkal, for a lamp in the temple of Tiruttoṇḍīśvaramuḍaiya-Paramasvāmigaḷ at Tirunāvalūr alias Rājādittapuram.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/232 (page 58)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman alias Rājarāja-dēva.
Date
23rd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Commences with the introduction Tirumagaḷpōla, etc. States that the sabhā of Aviyaṉṉūr endowed a lamp in the temple of Tiruttoṇḍīśvaramuḍaiya-Mahādēva and a half lamp in the shrine of Peruṅguḷattūrdēva (in the same temple) in expia-tion of their unfounded charge against Seṅgaṉ Adigaḷ Kuṭṭēṟaṉ and Kāmaṉ Eḻuvaṉ of Peruṅguḷattūr Vīrasundarappēraiyaṉ.
