ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/240 (page 59)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarāja Rājakēsarivarman (Rāja-rāja I).
Date
18th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged and built in towards the end. Commences with the introduction Tirumagaḷpōla, etc. Seems to refer to two gold paṭṭams presented to the god by ... Uttamaśōḻa Neṉmali-nāṭṭu Mūvēndavēḷār and Arumoḻi-Mūvēndavēḷār and to their subsequent loss in weight, which was later on detected and reported by a temple official to Maṅgalaṅkiḻāṉ Kāḷappaṉ Pāḻi Nakkaṉ, an officer of the nāḍu, who after enquiry had the loss made good.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/241 (page 59)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 10th century A.D. States that Śāttukuṭṭi Mādēvaṉ alias Vāmaśivaṉ consecrated the image of Chaṇḍēśvara and constructed a shrine of stone for this deity, in the temple of Tiruttoṇḍīśvara at Tirunāvalūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/242 (page 59)
Placement
North wall of the mahā-maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Pallava
King
Sakalabhuvanachakravartin Peruñ-jiṅgadēva.
Date
6th year, Aṟpaśi
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an order of Peruñjiṅgadēva granting land free of taxes in Kōvaḷai Kuṟumbūr situated in Tirumuṉaippāḍi-nāḍu as tirunāmattukkāṇi to god Viśvēśvaradēva set up by Gaṅgōli-Jñānaśiva alias Svāmidēva, in the temple of Tiruttoṇḍ-Īśvara uḍaiya-Nāyaṉār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/243 (page 59)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
19th year (in words), śu. 13, Wednesday, Mṛigaśīrsha.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a gift of 32 cows and a bull by the chief for a perpetual lamp in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/244 (page 59)

Dynasty
Do.
King
Sakalabhuvanachakravartin Peruñ-jiṅgadēva.

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an agreement given by Trimū[r*]tti-Bhaṭṭaṉ Dēvapiḷḷai, a Śivabrāhmaṇa of the temple to burn a lamp before the god for the cows received by him from one Daṇḍuśāyi Udayaṇa-paṇḍitar.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/248 (page 59)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Saumya, Chittirai 2
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The first three lines are engraved over an erasure. Seems to record a sale of the sēvugam (service) right with its perquisite of half mā of land and a house site.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/249 (page 59)
Placement
East wall of the same mahā-maṇḍapa
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śārvari, Tai 10
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the walls and the maṇḍapas in the temple of Toṇḍa-gaḷ-Nayiṉār at Tirunāvalūr had fallen, that worship in it had also been in abeyance, and that Śidāṟuḍaiyār Śēdirāyar represented the matter to his lord Tiruvēṅgaḍanādar Toṇḍai-māṉ who is given the titles, ‘Pagaittavargaḷ-kālaṉ’ ‘Gaṇḍa-Nārāyaṇaṉ’ and ‘Tiruppaḍi-Vēḷaikkāṟaṉ’ and with the latter's permission and for his welfare, made a gift of land, for reviving worship along with the services Pagaittavarkālaṉ-śandi and Śidāṟuḍaiyāṉ-śandi.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/250 (page 60)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Sāḷuva
King
Narasiṅgadēva Mahārāja
Date
Vikriti, Mārgaḻi 16
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the temple of Toṇḍagaḷ-Nayiṉār at Tirunāvalūr, an independent village in Karuma[v*]ūr-paṟṟu, situated in Vaḷudilampaṭṭu-śāvaḍi, had become desolate for some years with the maṇḍapas and gōpuras fallen and that Annamaraśar, the avasaram officer of the king, repaired them and after rehabilitating the village, made a gift of certain taxes accruing therefrom for reviving worship in the temple, for the merit of the king. (See A.R. Nos. 111 and 213 of 1934-35). The order regarding this gift was communicated to the trustees of the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/251 (page 60)
Placement
South side of the verandah round the central shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śukla, Āvaṇi 10
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 16th century A.D. Records sale of the tirumeykāval right in the temple of Toṇḍargaḷ-Nayiṉār at Tirunāvalūr by the trustees to Tirumalaikkoḻundar alias Ālakālasaundara Vāṇavadaraiyar, son of Vāṇavadaraiyar Śellapperumāḷ.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/266 (page 61)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Achyutadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 145[7], Man-matha, Dhanus, śu. [8] Thursday, Uttiraṭṭādi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Stones lost in the middle. Seems to record the assignment of the income of 50 poṉ due from the village Mēṭṭu-Urattūr as umbaḷi-poṉ to Pāpparāja and seven others for carrying the taṇḍigai (palanquin) and umbrella, evidently of the god at Tirunāvalūr. Also records a gift of 1 mā of land at Mēṭṭu-Urattūr by the beneficiaries to Meññāna-māmuni, the disciple of Śīkāḻivaḷḷal-Paṇḍāram, for the benefit of the maṭha at Tirunāvalūr. Mentions Salakarāja Tiru[malai]dēva-Mahārāja and Tipparājar Bhōgaiyar belonging to the family of Uṟaiyūr Chōḷas.

Language

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/280 (page 63)
Placement
Kaḷḷakkuṟichchi.--Slab set up near the ruined Chandraśēkhara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Kīlaka, Āvaṇi 10
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Modern. Damaged at the end. Records a gift of land as sarvamānya at Kallaikurichchi, to god Chandraśēkhara, by Peddu-Reḍḍiyār of Vallūr, the agent of Veṅgappayyaṉ, for the merit of Śūrappa-Nāyakarayyaṉ, Veṅgappaiyar, the nāṭṭār of the 12 paṟṟu and the tāṉattār of Śēndavaṉmaṅgalam. Kallaikuṟichchi is stated to have been the tiruviḷaiy-āṭṭam of god Āvattaikkāttaruḷiya-Nayiṉār.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/283 (page 63)

Tamil

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/284 (page 63)
Placement
Māmbākkam Pullūr.--Stone set up be-hind the Ādikēśava-Perumāḷ temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Veṅkaṭapati-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 15[11], Virōdhi, Paṅguṉi 5, śu, Monday, Saptamī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
A triśūla is engraved above this inscription and hence it should have belonged to a Śiva temple. The reverse side of the inscribed stone is highly damaged. Seems to record the gift of the village, Māmbākkam, for offerings in a temple (name lost) at Vṛiddhāchalam by Koṇḍama-Nāyakkar-Ayyaṉ, son of Kṛishṇappayya-Nāyakkar-ayyaṉ.

Date
…

Telugu
Remarks

Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the ūravar and other residents of Pullūr made themselves responsible, by setting apart 700 kuḻi of land out of their service lands (ilakkai-nilam) for the maintenance of worship in the temple of god Śokkachchīya-Viṇṇagar-āḻvār consecrated in the village by Peṟṟāṉ Teṉṉavadarayaṉ, for the welfare of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/288 (page 64)
Placement
Stone set up in a wet land called ‘Kīḻ-muḍi’.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Vijaya
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The characters are of about the 14th century A.D. Records a gift of 480 kuḻi of wet land as tax-free tiruviḍaiyāṭṭam to god Kēśava-Perumāḷ by Perumāḷ Toṇḍaimāṉār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/289 (page 64)
Placement
Maḻavarāyaṉūr (Elavanaśūr).--Stone set up in front of Kaḻuvattarāyaṉ temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Do. Above the inscription are carved the Pāṇḍya emblems of two carps and an anchor (?). States that Maḻavarāyanallūr alias Parākrama-Pāṇḍyaṉ-paṭṭiṇam is a place of resort for the refugees (añjināṉ-pugaliḍam).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/290 (page 64)

Language
Tamil
Remarks
The writing belongs to about the 13th century A.D. Records the digging of this tank and the construction of a sluice for it by Nīrvēli Kūttaṉ alias Kōvalrāyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/291 (page 64)
Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Vikāri, Māśi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The characters are of about the 16th century A.D. Prescribes the standard land-measuring red at 48 feet for dry lands in the village Śiruputtūr by Śennaravuttu Nandināyakkar, the agent of E1chchama-Nāyakkarayyaṉ.

Language

Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/294 (page 64)
Placement
Kumāramaṅgalam(Elavanaśūr).--Stone found in the debris of the ruined Śiva temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka, 1767, Kali 4947, Viśvāvasu, Paṅ-guṉi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Seems to record the construction and consecration of the temple of Tribhuvanēśvarasvāmi and Tripurāmbāḷ-Ammaṉ in the village by Subbarāya-Iḍaiyāṉ of the Kshatriya (caste) who was the trustee of the temple, and by another person called Meyyaṉ Muttayyaṉ. Refers to a certain Kalyāṇa-Gurukkaḷ as being instrumental for this work.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/295 (page 64)
Placement
Vēlūr.--Slab set up in a dry field to the north of the village.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Rājarājadēva
Date
7th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the confirmation of the remission, previously granted, of the āḷ-amañji and other taxes due from the dēvadāṉa village Mēlūr made by Āḷappiṟandāṉ Mōgaṉ alias Rājarāja-Kāḍa-varāyaṉ. This remission is stated to be confined only to the Āḷappiṟandāṉ-ēri and the channel Āṭkoṇḍāṉ-kāl.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/296 (page 65)
Placement
Pāchchāpāḷaiyam.--Rock near the tank called Gōvindaṉkuḷam to the west of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Sādhāraṇa, Tai 21
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The characters are of about the 18th century A.D. Incomplete. Records the remission granted by Tiruvēṅgaḷa-Ayyaṉ of all the taxes for a period of twelve years to the artisan families who colonised Pēṭṭai, a tiruviḷaiyāṭṭam of god Aḻagar.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/297 (page 65)
Placement
Kaḷamarudūr.--East wall of the Śelli-yamman temple by the side of the road.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Sādhāraṇa, Āḍi
Language
…
Remarks
The characters are of about the 16th century A.D. Records an order of one Vīramarasaiyaṉ granting full remission of taxes for the first six months and levying for the subsequent period three-fourths of the prevailing taxes on the artisan families colonising Ayyaṉ-[Śeṟu]ḍaiyāṉ-Marudūr situated in the śīrmai (jurisdiction) of Veṅkappaṉ, the agent of Sūrappa-Nāyaka.

Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Uḍaiyār Rajēndra-[Chōḷadēva].
Date
Lost
Language
…
Remarks
Fragmentary. Contains only a small portion of the historical introduction of the king. Records a gift of sheep for a perpetual lamp in the temple (name lost). A fragment of another inscription close by, of the same king, mentions god Mahādēvar Tiruchcheṅgēṇi-Nakkar at Kaḷamarudūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/299 (page 65)

…
Date

Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/300 (page 65)
Placement
Rock on the west side of the same verandah
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias
Date
(Lost)
Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
Damaged, and right and left ends built in. Begins with the historical introduction Tirumaṉṉi-vaḷara, of Rājēndra-Chōḷa I. Records a gift of 96 sheep for a lamp to god ... Pāḻiyilava (?) by Kalimānaṉ Vijayālayamallaṉ of Tiru-maṇañjēri in Rājēndrasiṁha-vaḷanāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/301 (page 65)
Placement
Rock at the entrance into the main shrine in the same temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias
Date
…
Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
Fragmentary and damaged. Contains the introduction of Kulōttuṅga I beginning with the words Pugaḻmādu-viḷaṅga. Seems to record an endowment of paddy for a lamp in the temple by Rājēndraśōḷa-Chēdirā[jaṉ]. Mentions Uḍaiyār Mallishēṇa, evidently a Jaina deity.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/302 (page 65)
Placement
Lintel over the entrance into the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
The characters are of about the 16th century A.D. A verse in praise of Guṇabaddira-Muṉivaṉ, evidently a Jaina saint who was famous in the southern land as a great scholar both in Tamil and in Sanskrit and who was a native of Koṇḍai-malai.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/303 (page 65)
Placement
East wall of the front maṇḍapa right of entrance, in the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1283, Śubhakṛit, Dhanus, śu. 13, Wednesday, Kārt-tigai.
Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
Records a gift of land for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Appāṇ[ḍār] by a person (name lost), son of Śembādi Villa-vadaraiyaṉ of Paḻampaṭṭiṇam in Pattiṉa-nāḍu, a subdivision of Śembūr-kōṭṭam in Jayaṅkoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam. Tirunaruṅ-goṇḍai is said to have formed part of Ādanūr in [Kuru]kkai-kūṟṟam in Tirumuṉaippāḍi-nāḍu, a subdivision of Naḍuvil-maṇḍalam. Mentions Gōppaṇṇa-Uḍaiyar as being instru-mental for this gift. On the same wall is a short inscription in characters of about the 16th century A.D. mentioning Guṇabhadrāchārya, called also Vīrasaṅghapratishṭhāchāryan.

Do.
Language

Records another gift of land for the same purpose by the Nāṭṭavar of Ādanūr-paṟṟu.

Language
Tamil (verse)

Built in at the right end. Records the Śaiva doctrine that all our actions have their origin in the Supreme Śiva. The characters belong to about the 13th century A.D.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/321 (page 67)

Tamil (verse)
Remarks

A piece of land was endowed (by themselves) for this purpose.

MADRAS DISTRICT


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/328 (page 68)
Placement
San Thome.--Triangular slab kept in the Bishop's house.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Portuguese
Remarks
Reads LOVVADA SEA A PVRISSIMA CONCEICAO (Praised be the most pure conception). The stone has a relief image of Our Lady in the centre. In the same place is kept another stone containing a part of the historical introduction of Rājēndra-Chōḷa.

CHINGLEPUT DISTRICT


SRIPERUMBUDUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/329 (page 68)
Placement
Kōvūr.--South wall of the Sundarēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Vijaya-Gaṇḍagōpāladēva
Date
3rd year, Makara, śu. 5, Monday, Uttaram.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an agreement given by Perumāḷ-Bhaṭṭaṉ, a Śira brāhmaṇa of the temple of Rājarājēśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉā at Kōvūr, to burn a twilight lamp in the temple for the ten paṇam received by him from Kāmaṉ Peruṅgāṭṭuppiḷḷai who claims to belong to one of the 70 families including that of E1lēlaśiṅgaṉ at Tirumayilāppūr and whom Karikāla-Chōḷa is stated to have settled at Rāmadēvachehēri in Kāñchī.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/330 (page 68)
Placement
Loose pillar lying in the prākāra of the same temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman
Date
9th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged and mutilated. Seems to record an endowment of land for the daily worship of the god Tirumē........ dēva at Kōvūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/331 (page 68)
Placement
Slab lying in the Vishṇu temple in the same village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīrapratāpa Kṛi[shṇa] yadēva-Mahārāja.
Date
Śaka 14[38], Dhātu, Makara, śu, [Mon-day]....
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Seems to record a grant of land which had formerly been in the enjoyment of the Mahājanas, to Vishṇu-Māśayan as sarvamānya. Mentions Muṉiya-dāvaḷam at Chaturvēdi-maṅgalam alias Kōvūr.

TIRUVALLUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/332 (page 68)
Placement
Tiruvūr.--North and west walls of the central shrine of the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Kṛishṇadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1449, Vyaya, Kārttigai 28.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of a house-site as maḍaviḷāgam to the temple of Siṅgēśvaraṃuḍaiya-Nayiṉār at Tirumalai alias Turugūr by Sadāśiva-Nāyaka, the agent of Immaḍi-Tirumalai-Nāyaka after purchasing the same from the Mahājanas of the village.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/333 (page 68)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
11th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that this sacred stone temple was the work of Tiru-aṇṇāmalai-Uḍaiyāṉ, the headman of Paiyūr-[Tugaḍūr] and a native of Oḻugarai alias Kulōttuṅgaśōḻanallūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/334 (page 68)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do.
Date
18th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of a piece of land as dēvadāṉa to the temple by a merchant named Periya-Vāndavar alias Kollattaraiyaṉ-of Oḻugarai alias Kulōttuṅgaśōḻanallūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/335 (page 69)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Vijaya-Gaṇḍagōpāladēva
Date
18th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the restoration of the old dēvadāna village Ayattūr to the temple of Ṛishyaśṛiṅgīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Turugūr forming part of Perumuḷaiyūr alias Ulagaḷanda-śōḻa-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Īkkāṭṭu-kōṭṭam for the usual worship and special festivals in Chittirai month by Pich-chadēvaṉ alias Villavarāyaṉ by regularising the accounts as it was not in the enjoyment of the temple till the 17th year (of the king).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/336 (page 69)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.

Language
Tamil

A copy of No. 333 above. The donor is here called Maḻaiyan Tiruvaṇṇāmalai-Uḍaiyān.

Tamil
Remarks

Do.

Placement

Dynasty
Do.

Language
Tamil

Records the grant of the annual income of 6 poṉ due as nīrkūli (water cess) to the village Turugūr from the dēvadāṉa villages Maṇḍalapurushaṉpaṭṭu and Varadarājaṉ-paṭṭu, to the temple of Śiṅgīśuram-uḍaiya-Nāyiṉār by Immaḍi Tiruma-lai-Nāyakkar and the Mahājanas of Turugūr.

CONJEEVARAM TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/343 (page 69)
Placement
Conjeevaram.--Slab built into the wall of the outermost prākāra of the E1kāmranätha temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The writing is of the 13th century A.D. States that the Īśānadēvar-maḍam was the gift of Periyanāṭṭār. On the top of the slab is engraved a human figure seated on a pedestal holding a lotus stalk in either hand. To its right is a long-necked pitcher (?) and to its left a triangular object. Below the pedestal is an ornamental kumbha with a lamp on either side.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/344 (page 69)
Placement
Slab built into a cross wall, adjacent to the above.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Pallava Grantha
Remarks
A label reading Gṛihēśailā in characters of about the 7th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/345 (page 69)
Placement
Five stones built into the outer walls of the same temple
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājādhirājadēva(I)
Date
33rd year, 280th day
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In disconnected pieces with introduction commencing with Tiṅgaḷērtaru, etc. Mentions a flower-garden belonging to the temple of Tiruvēkampam-Uḍaiyār. Seems to record the formation of a new village with its boundaries specified.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/346 (page 70)
Placement
Slab built into the same wall
Dynasty
…

…

Language
Tamil

King
Vijayarāya-Mahārāya

Language
Kannaḍa & Tamil
Remarks
This is a bilingual record stating that the sixteen-pillared chitra-maṇḍapa in front of the Tāṇḍavadēva shrine (Kākku Nāyaka in the Tamil portion) and the Tryambakēśvara shrine were the gifts of Tryambakadēvī, the daughter of the king.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/354 (page 70)
Placement

Dynasty
Moghul
King
…
Date
Śaka 1647, (1637 ?), Jaya, Māśi 13, Thursday, Hasta.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The ruling king is merely mentioned as Ḍilli-Pādshah with his name not specified. Records a sale of land by the residents of Śittēri-mēḍu to the (community ?) Āyirattutuḷāyira-Mudalis of Kāñchīpuram who are also called Dēvasiṅgadāna-Karttar for the purpose of being endowed by the latter for any charity they thought fit.

CHITTOOR DISTRICT


CHITTOOR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/355 (page 71)
Placement
Kalavaguṇṭa.--South wall of the cen-tral shrine, Mukkaṇīśvara temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Achyutadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1467 (1457 ?), Jaya, Makara, ba. [3], Uttiram, Fri-day.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Registers an endowment of the village Śāttambākkam for the expenses of daily worship and offerings and of special festivals in the temple of Mukkaṇṭīśvaram-Uḍaiya-Nayiṉār at Kalvāykuṭṭai in Iruvārappaṟṟu, a subdivision of Tūya-nāḍu in Toṇḍaimaṇḍalam by Mahānāyaṅkara [Vayyappea]-Nāyaka, son of Chinna-Timmappa-Nāyaka, for the merit of the king, of his own family and of the Nāṭṭavar of Iru-vārappaṟṟu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/356 (page 71)
Placement
North wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Kṛishṇarāyadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1439, Īśvara, Makara, śu. 5, Mon-day, Śravaṇa.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Registers a similar endowment of the village Mēlai-Murukkam-paṭṭu in Iruvārappaṟṟu for the requirements of the temple by one Rāmachandra-Dīkshita, for the merit of the king, the Nāḍu and his own family.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/357 (page 71)
Placement
North wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the allotment of lands at Pāṟaipūṭṭai for the several requirments of the temple by Vaḍamalai Nāyakar, the officer (maṇiyakāṟaṉ) under Basavappa-Nāyaka, the agent of Aḷiya-Rāmappaiyyadēva-Mahārājayya, for the merit of the latter two, and the fixation of the extent of lands held as tenants by the several temple craftsmen and artisans in the dēvadāṉa village Śāttambākkam.

SALEM DISTRICT


NAMAKKAL TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/366 (page 72)
Placement
Bommasamudram.--Two stones built into the walls of the central shrine in the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragments in characters of about the 10th century A.D. One of them gives the 10th year of a king whose name is lost and seems to record a gift of land to the temple for a per-petual lamp.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/367 (page 72)
Placement
Two other stones built into the same walls.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
...... ‘who took Madura’
Date
40th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragmentary. This evidently belongs to Parāntaka I. Mentions a wall starting from Viraikkōṭṭai and refers to Śāttamaṅgalam in Muḻaiyūr-nāḍu. A third stone near these contains a fragmentary record in the same characters, and records a provision made for offerings and worship to the deity. Mentions a grain measure called Śōḻagam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/367A (page 72)
Placement
Three other stones built into the same walls.
Dynasty
Do. (?)
King
(Lost)
Date
17th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The characters may be assigned to about the 10th century A.D. Fragmentary. Mentions Rāśiyūr.

Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1806, Pārthiva, Chittirai 1.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the Garuḍaśērvai-maṇḍapa was built by Tītta-Śeṭṭiyār, son of Tiruvaṁbala-Śeṭṭiyār of the Sāttandai-gōtra, one of the Nagarattār (merchants) living in Pudu-pēṭṭai near Salem.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/369 (page 72)
Placement
Three slabs lying on the bund of the tank by the road side.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The inscriptions on two of the slabs are complete ones and are dated, one in Vikṛiti, Aṟpaśi and the other in Ānanda, Āṉi, 30, and are both modern. The former refers to a gift by one Ādimūla-Śeṭṭi and the latter to the setting up of a Vināyaka image by one Śeṅgaḻani-Mudaliyār, son of Kāvāṇḍai Mudaliyār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/370 (page 72)
Placement
Kuḷippaṭṭi.--Boulder in a field
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Vikrama, Chittirai 2
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Modern. States that this land to the south of Rāmipuram was endowed as sarvamānya for the maintenance of a water shed by Rāmi-Reḍḍiyār of Nāmakkal-śīrmai-subai (subah ?).

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/372 (page 73)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 10th century A.D. States that a gift of 14 kaḻañju of gold was made to the temple of Tiru-vīraṭṭānattu-Perumānaḍigaḷ for two forehead-plates and two gold-flowers to the god by the Pāraga-Nagarattār. These were also responsible for the payment of interest in paddy to the temple for the 33 and odd kaḻañju of gold (received by them).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/373 (page 73)
Placement

…

Tamil

Records the gift of a house-site with its income from trees, etc., for the expenses of abhishēkha and for twilight lamps in the temple of Kāśi Viśvanāthasvāmi at Pāṇḍamaṅgalam.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/375 (page 73)
Placement
Nāmakkal.--Side of rock opposite the Munīśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Rudhirōdgāri, Āvaṇi 8.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 17th century A.D. Incomplete. Records an agreement (the nature of which is not clear) given in the temple at Tiruvāraikkal in E1ḷūr-nāḍu by the 17 families of stone masons (Kambaḷattār) to a certain Śukkāḍar. Mentions Jagadēvarāya as wielding sway over Kuṉṟattūr-durgam and a number of other petty officers or chieftains of Pūndurai-nāḍu, Paruttippaḷḷināḍu and Rāśi-pura-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/376 (page 73)
Placement
Same rock
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
4+1st year, Kar-kaṭakaṭ 13, ba. 11, Saturday, Rōhiṇī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Records grant of a thousand kuḷi of land as sarvamānya to Pariśāṟṟūr Sarvadēva-bhaṭṭa-Sarvakratunāj-bhaṭṭa residing at Muppavaisamudra-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Teṉpūvāṇiya-nāḍu, a subdivision of Koṅgu alias Vīraśōḻa-maṇḍalam by the sabhā, the nāṭṭār and the Nagarattār of Eḻu-nāḍu in Nāḍāḻvā-nāḍu.

TRICHINOPOLY DISTRICT


TRICHINOPOLY TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/377 (page 73)
Placement
Uyyakkoṇḍāṉ-Tirumalai.--Base of the Chidambarēśvara shrine in the Ujjī-vanātha temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Vīra-Pāṇḍyadēva
Date
(Lost)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Slightly damaged. Records an endowment of 4 mā and odd of tax-free land at Aḻagiyaśēmanallūr for the worship of certain deities in the temple at Tirukkāṟkuḍi in Uṟaiyūr-kūṟṟam, a subdivision of Rājagaṁbhīra-vaḷanāḍu, by Aḻagiyaśēman Araśargaṇḍarāmaṉ Tiruvaṁbalapperumāḷ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/378 (page 73)
Placement
Wall of the Ammaṉ shrine in the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Saumya, Āvaṇi 5
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Purports to record an order of god Ādi-Chaṇḍēśvara on behalf of god Viḻumiya-Nāyiṉār to a Kaikkōḷa named Vayittaya-nādak(Vaidyanātha)-Kāliṅgarāyaṉ alias Peruvēḻppaiyaṉ, son of Tirumēṉiaḻagiyāṉ of Tirumaḻapāḍi making a sarva-mānya grant of land and house-site to him out of the temple property through Kōnēridēva-Mahārāja (see No. 384 below).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/379 (page 73)
Placement
Inner wall of the outermost gōpura in the same temple, left of entrance.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman, alias Tribh. Kula-śēkharadēva, ‘who was pleased to take all countries’.
Date
29th year, Mēsha, ba. 7, Monday, Tiruvōṇam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment made by the Mahāsabhā of Jagadēka-vīra-chaturvēdimaṅgalam of tax-free land for providing sixty kalam of paddy annually for offerings to god Uyyakkoṇḍa-Nāyiṉār on the 12 days of festival in the Vaigāśi month.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/380 (page 74)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya-Mahārāya ‘who witnessed the elephant hunt’.
Date
Śaka 1366, Raktā-kshi, Makara, ba. 9, Friday, Chittirai.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment of tax-free land by the Sabhaiyār and Nāṭṭavar of Rājagaṁbhīra-vaḷanāḍu for the expenses of the four days festival called the Vasantan-tirunāḷ in the temple of Viḻumiya-Nāyiṉār at Tirukkaṟkuḍi Uyyakkoṇ-ḍāṉ-Tirumalai.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/381 (page 74)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Kōṉēriṉmaikoṇḍāṉ
Date
39th year, 229th day.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal gift of 20 mā of land at Śōḻakulanallūr, a hamlet of Jagadēkavīra-chaturvēdimaṅgalam for worship and offerings to the images of Śellapiḷḷaiyār and Iḷaiyanāyaṉār consecrated in the name of the king's father in the garden-land attached to the royal palace at Vīradāvaḷam. The land after being entered into the tax remission accounts was added to the dēvadāṉa of the Viḻumiya-Nāyaṉār temple. The record is signed at the end by Ponnāṇḍāṉ Pallavarāyaṉ of Tuñjalūr in Miḻalai-kūṟṟam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/382 (page 74)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Kula-śēkharadēva, ‘who was pleased to take all countries’.
Date
32nd year, Aippaśi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the remission of the kaḍamai and kuḍimai taxes on the village Nelkuṉṟam alias Irunīkkinaperumāḷ-nallūr-which was a tirunāmattukāṇi of the temple of Viḻumiya-Nāyaṉār at Tirukkaṟkuḍi in Uṟaiyūr-kūṟṟam, by the Nāṭṭavar of Vaḍa-kōnāḍu in Urattūr-kūṟṟam as ordered by the king (Ulaguḍaiya-Perumāḷ) to provide for the usual and special festival requirements of the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/383 (page 74)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Kōṉēriṉmaikoṇḍāṉ
Date
28th year (in words), Māśi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the royal gift of two plots of land in the village Neṟkuṉṟam alias Iruṇīkkipperumānallur in Kōnāḍu alias Kaḍalaḍaiyādilañgaikoṇḍasōḻa-vaḷanāḍu, free of all taxes, for services in the temple of Viḻumiya-Nāyaṉār and for a festival in the Paṅguṉi month instituted formerly by king Aḻagiyaśokkaṉār.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/387 (page 75)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Chak-ravartin Kulōttuṅgaśōḻadēva.
Date
3[0]th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pugaḻśūḻnda, etc. Damaged. Seems to record a gift of land after purchase by a native (name lost) of Kākkaḷūr-nāḍu in Ikkāṭṭu-kōṭṭam, a sub-division of Jayaṅkoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, for the expenses of the ardhayāma service in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/388 (page 75)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Kōnērimaikoṇḍāṉ
Date
24th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Much damaged. Seems to record the formation of a new colony of merchants after acquiring lands and house-sites for the purpose in the village, under the name Koṅgu[koṇḍa]-śōḻapuram, by order of the king, at the request of Toṇḍaimān fixing the annual revenue payable to the State thereon at 23,000 kalam of paddy on cultivable lands and 1000 kāśu on dry lands (by the inhabitants). Quotes the 14th year of Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva, ‘who abolished the tolls’.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/389 (page 75)
Placement
Same wall, right of entrance
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Rājarājadēva
Date
26+1st year, Risha-bha, ba. 11, Wed-nesday, Rēvatī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a tax-free gift or land after purchase at Jagadēkavīra-chaturvēdimaṅgalam by Piḷḷaiyāḻvār alias Dēvargaḷ Sēnā-patinaṅgai, a maid-servant of the temple, for worship and offerings and special festivals in honour of the goddess ins-talled by her.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/390 (page 75)
Placement
Pēṭṭaivāyttalai.--South wall of maṇ-ḍapa in front of central shrine Madhyār-juna temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya [Mahārā]ya, son of Vīra Vijayarāya-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1 *** Kīlaka, Mithuna, ba. 10, Monday, Aśvati.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Built in at the ends of lines and incomplete. Seems to record there-consecration of two temples, viz., of Avanīśvara and Tiruvakkīśvara, while renovating the temple of Madu-rāntīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Rājēndraśōḻa-pēṭṭai in Śūralūr-kūṟṟam, a subdivision of Rājagaṁbhīra-vaḷanāḍu, by the nagarattār of the place, who also made provision for worship in them.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/391 (page 75)
Placement
Peruṅguḍi.--North wall of the central shrine, Agastyēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍya-dēva.
Date
10+1st year, Kar-kaṭaka, śu. 5, Friday, Uttiram.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gift of land by the Peruṅguri-Mahāsabhā of Jagadēkavīra-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Uraiyūr-kūṟṟam, a subdivision of Rājagambhīra-vaḷanāḍu on the southern bank, for con-ducting a festival in the temple of Tiruvagastīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyanār at Peruṅguḍi, a hamlet of their village.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/394 (page 75)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Hoysaḷa
King
Vīra Rāmanāthadēva
Date
10th year, Kaṉṉi, ba. 13, Sunday, Punarpūśam and 19th year.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that a goldsmith of the place, named Kūttaṉ gave three kaḻañju of gold for completing an unfinished portion of the temple and that he presented a forehead plate to the god in the 19th year, in gratitude for the recovery of the eye-sight of his son Nallamaṅgai.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/398 (page 76)
Placement
East wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
12th year .... ba. 10, Sunday, Utti-ram.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an agreement given to the temple by the dēvakanmis to pay at a kalam of paddy on every mā on 84 mā of land belonging to the village (which they had probably taken out on lease) for meeting the expenses of the festival in the month of Āṉi.

…

…

Tamil
Remarks
The characters are of about the 11th century A.D. States that this pillar was set up by Śandaṉ Kāḍaṉ of Arumuḷai.

MALABAR DISTRICT


PALGHAT TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/402 (page 76)
Placement
Peruvamba.--Slab set up in the pre-cincts of the ruined temple of Nandīś-vara.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Vaṭṭeḻuttu
Remarks
Highly damaged. The writing may be assigned to about the 11th century A.D. Mentions some cheṭṭis and [Padi]-neṇbhūmi Tiśaiy-Āyirattaiññūṟṟu[var] communities and the Vaḷañjiyar.

List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41.


NORTH ARCOT DISTRICT


WALAJAPET TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/1 (page 77)
Placement
Kaṇiyanūr.--Slab lying near the Vīra-rāghava-Perumāḷ temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-Chōḷadēva.
Date
24th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning lost. Gives a portion of the historical introduction commencing with the words, Tirumaṉṉi-vaḷara, etc. Records a gift of land, made tax free for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Aṇigōva-Viṇṇagarāḻvār by the assembly of Vīradivākara-chaturvēdimaṅgalam situated in Peruntimiri-nāḍu, a sub-division of Paḍuvūr-kōṭṭam in Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam.

Proper right door-jamb of entrance into the Aṇigōpanāthēśvara temple.

Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks

13th year

Language
Tamil

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/5 (page 77)
Placement

…

…

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records purchase of land in Agaram Kaṇiyaṉūr for the lake at Agaram Veḷḷambai and refers to the construction of a channel, evidently in the same land.

Language
Tamil
Remarks

Placement
Puṅgaṉūr.--North wall of the deserted Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷa
Date
16th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that on the representation of the villagers that Puṅ-gaṉūr and its hamlets were without a blacksmith, Vēḍaip-perumāḷ alias Vikramaśōḻa-Śambuvarāyaṉ appointed Tēttāṉ, a blacksmith of Śembai, to serve in the locality.

Do.

Rājarājakēsarivarman

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/9 (page 77)
Placement
West wall of the same temple
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman, ‘who destroyed ships at Kāndaḷūr-śālai.’
Date
11th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a gift of land, after purchase, as taragubhōga by Poṉṉ-ayaṉ, son of Tiruvārūr-aḍigaḷ, the headman of Aṉiyūr in Aṉiyūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Veṇkuṉṟa-kōṭṭam for providing water during summer and firewood during winter in the hall called Vīraśōḻaṉ constructed by him at Puṅgaṉūr in Peruntimiri-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/10 (page 78)
Placement
West and south walls of the same temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the order of Lāḍamādēviyār, wife of Vīraśōḻar, granting land as tiruppalibōgam, for conducting the śrībali ceremony in the temple during three sandis with 5 persons. Poṉṉayaṉ mentioned above was entrusted with this endowment.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/11 (page 78)
Placement
South wall of the same temple
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman, ‘who destroyed ships at Kāndaḷūr-śālai’.
Date
11th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of land, after purchase, from the assembly (ūr) of Puṅgaṉūr, to the temple by the same Poṉṉayaṉ. The assembly also undertook to maintain a lamp in the temple in lieu of the interest on the money received by them from Poṉṉayaṉ.

Pallava
King

Date
17th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Refers to the construction of a well and a water-trough by Arigaṇḍaṉ and Paṟikkuṭṭi.

…
King
…

Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/14 (page 78)
Placement
Broken slab lying near the same temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 9
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of the 10th century A.D. Records an endow-ment of (the taxes) kaṇṇāḷakkāṇam (marriage fee), ūrppadiṉ-kāḍi and pidānāḻi accruing from the village Puṅgaṉūr by (the chief) Ānaiyammaṉ, son of Ilāḍarāyaṉ Taṭṭālaṉ, for the maintenance of a tank called Paramaṇḍalādittap-pērēri, dug by the donor in the village.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/15 (page 78)
Placement
Stone set up in S. No. 68 to the north of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Kīlaka, Vaygāśi 3
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An endowment of 200 kuḻi of land at Puṅgaṉūr by one Rāma-kṛishṇappa-Nāyakkar of Vēlūr for the maintenance of a watershed (on the way from the village to Vēlūr).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/16 (page 78)
Placement
Peruṅgāñji.--North wall of the central shrine in the Agastyēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-Chōḷadēva.
Date
(Lost)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. Seems to record a gift of land to Tiruvagat-tīśvaramuḍaiya-Paramasvāmin at Peruṅgāñji and mentions Śōḻakulasundari-chaturvēdimaṅgalam, an independent village in Orukaivalla-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/17 (page 78)
Placement
Pillar in the maṇḍapa in front of the central shrine in the same temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman, ‘who took Madura and Īḻam’.
Date
41st year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of a forehead-plate to god Agastīśvarattu-Perumānaḍigaḷ in the temple to the north of the village, made out of the 5 kaḻañju and odd of gold realised as fine from a certain Nūṟṟaimbadiṉmāṉ and his sons of Tiruvēṅ-gaḍappuram alias Vijayāditta-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Kaḍa-[mūr]-kōṭṭam by the sabhā of the village.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/18 (page 79)
Placement
Another pillar in the same place
Dynasty
Do.
King
Kulōttu[ṅga-Chōḷa]
Date
31st year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning damaged. Registers gift of money by Śanaki-kramavittaṉ of Prayāgai for a lamp in the temple of Aga-ttīśvaramuḍaiya-Paramasvāmi. Refers also to gift of gold by several persons for 10 lamps and entrusted to the Sivabrāhmaṇas of the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/19 (page 79)
Placement
East wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājēndradēva
Date
2nd year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning lost. Gives a portion of the historical introduction of the king beginning with the words Tirumagaḷ-maruviya, etc. Seems to record an agreement by Karumāṇikka Ammai-appaṉ alias Śōḻakulasundara-Āchāri-yaṉ who had the tachchakkāṇi of the village Śōḻakula-sundari-chaturvēdimaṅgalam, to supply an uḻakku of ghee every day for a perpetual lamp in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/20 (page 79)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Uḍaiyār Rājādhirājadēva.
Date
34th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tiṅgalēr-peṟa, etc. Records the remission of the taxes iṛai and antarāyam on a piece of land endowed after purchase as vyākaraṇa-bhaṭṭavṛitti by (the temple of) Rājarājaviṇṇagar-Āḻvār in Śōḻakula-sundari-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Mēlmalai Ogaivalla-nāḍu, a subdivision of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam by the mahā-sabhā of the village, in consideration of a lump-sum of 20 kāśu received by them from the temple. Mentions Sēnāpati Arumoḻi-Vikramaśōḻaṉ alias Rājādhirāja-Mahābalivāṇa-rāyar on whose initiative the endowment was made.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/24 (page 79)
Placement
Śakkaramallūr.--North wall of the central shrine in the Tirukkaṇḍīśvara temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Rājarājadēva
Date
15th year (in words), Makara, śu. 13, Saturday, Punar-pūśam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment of 500 kuḻi of land for the early morning service in the temple of Mukkaṇṇadēvar at Chakramūdūr, an independent village in Dāmar-kōṭṭam of Jayaṅgoṇḍa-śōḻa-maṇḍalam, made by order of the king through the agency of Piḷḷaiyār Madhurāntakap-Pottappichchōḻar alias Gaṇḍa-gōpāla, by Dāmōdaraṉ Aruḷālapperumāḷ, the headman of Sōmaṅgalam in Maṅgala-nāḍu, a subdivision of Tirumuṉap-pāḍi-nāḍu in Rājarāja-vaḷanāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/25 (page 79)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1683, Kali 4862, Vishu, Aṟpaśi 6.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Registers a sale of land by the Mudalimār of Chakramūdūr to Pushpanātha-Nayiṉār and to Agastiya[pa] Nayinār, son of Kuntiyapa [Nayinār] two Jaina residents of Tirupparambūr for 405 Cheṉṉapaṭṭaṇam-Varāhaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/26 (page 79)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Pallava
King
Peruñjiṅgadēva
Date
22nd year, Ṛishabha
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇas of the temple of Mukkaṇ-dēvar to burn a twilight lamp in the temple in return for 300 kāśu received by them from Tāmattaṉ Aruḷāḷapperumāḷ of Sōmaṅgalam (evidently the donor mentioned in No. 24 above).

Tamil

A similar agreement to burn three twilight lamps in the temple in return for the gift of a buffalow costing 3 māḍai by Taḻuvināṉ, the son of Dēvargaḷsundaraṉ, the pāḍikāppāṉ of the village.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/28 (page 80)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An order of Śambuvarāyar issued to the ūravar of Chakra-mūdūr to take 100 vēli of land in their village as coming under taram (for purpose of taxation) from the 5th year onwards (of the reign of the king) and to record the fact on the walls of the Mukkaṇṇadēvar temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/29 (page 80)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Do
Date
14th (?) year, Vṛiś-chika, śu. 6, Sun-day, Uttirāḍam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇas to burn a perpetual lamp before the god in return for 600 kāśu endowed by Peri-yanāchchi alias Periyanāṭṭunaṅgai, a dēvaraḍiyāḷ of the temple, and the bestowal by the sthānattār on her and her descendants the right of owning the first house in the tiru-maḍaiviḷāgam and of precedence of honour on festival occasions in the temple in consideration of another gift of 500 kāśu made by her.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/30 (page 80)
Placement
West and south walls of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Tribh. Vikra-ma-Chōḷadēva.
Date
7th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pūmādu puṇara, etc. Gives a detailed list of the lands with their extent specified in each case, which had been endowed to the temple for its various requirements and recorded on its wall prior to its renovation by Tiruchchiṟṟambalamuḍaiyāṉ Tirunāgai-dēvaṉ alias Śembiyaṉ-Mūvēndavēḷāṉ of Ālattūr in Ālattūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Nittavinōda-vaḷanāḍu in Śōḻa-maṇḍa-lam and which were now confirmed by the ūrār of the place. A few donors of the lands mentioned in the list also figure as signatories at the end of the record.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/31 (page 80)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do.
Date
Do.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of lands in Naralōkavīranallūr measuring 13500 kuḻi in extent as dēvadāṉa to god Mukkaṇdēvar by the ūrār of the village so as to provide for expenses of festivals in the temple with the vēlikkāśu, veṭṭimuṭṭaiyāḷ and other taxes accruing therefrom. All the signatories of the previous inscription figure in this record also.

Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks
A gift of two lamps to the temple, weighing 588 palam by a certain Śīyāṟadēvaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/33 (page 81)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman
Date
6th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the gold and paddy received as nīrvilai from the tax-free lands of the village as well as from the dēvadāna and paḷḷichchandam lands were set apart for the celebration of the festivals in the temple of Sōmīśvaramuḍaiya-Mahādēva by the ūrār in lieu of the interest on a lump-sum received by them for the purpose from a certain lady named Āchcham-araśi, wife of Vikkaladēvaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/34 (page 81)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva
Date
25th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇas to burn two twilight lamps in the temple for the two paḻam-kāśu which they had received from Siddarāmaṉ, the headman of Puṉṉai, but which had accumulated with the interest thereon to 4 pudukkāśu by their default.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/35 (page 81)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Allun-Tirukkāḷattidēva Gaṇḍa-gōpāla.
Date
6th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the circuit round the temple was built of stone by Sūrappa-Nāyaka of Viṇṇamalai in Mēlaippaṭṭai-nāḍu, a chieftain under Tyāgasamudrappaṭṭai Vīmaraśar, who also made a gift of all the (āyam) income (due to him) from the dēvadāna (lands) of the temple and of the taxes on looms working in the tirumaḍaiviḷāgam area and also of the fee in oil realised from the oil-presses in the village, for the sacred cloth and other requirements of the god and for burning 4 twilight lamps in the temple.

Tamil

Records remission of certain taxes like antarāyam, kāttigaikāśu, kaikkūli and kuṟṟadaṇḍam due to the chief Śeṅgēṇi Vīrāsani Ammai-äppaṉ Tirumēndäṉ Kaṇṇuḍaiperumāḷ alias Vīra-vinōda-Vikramachōḷa-Śambuvarāya in favour of the temple.

…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
In characters of about the 13th century A.D. Praises the liberality of Siddhinātha alias Śaivaśēkarappiratā-paṉ, a resident of Mandiradara, who is said to have supplied the people of Chakrapurī with abundance of rice during a severe famine.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/40 (page 81)
Placement
Slab set up in a street
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva, ‘who was pleased to take Madura and the crowned head of the Pāṇḍya’.
Date
29th year (in words), Paṅguṉi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. An order of [Ammai]-appaṉ Aḻagiyaśōḻa-Śambu-varāyaṉ, probably remitting the taxes on some lands in Chakramūdūr in connection with the formation of a new village called Śittiramēḻi-Padineṇbūmippaṭṭiṉam alias Vijayapaṭṭiṉam.

POLUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/44 (page 82)
Placement
Paḍavēḍu.--South wall of the central shrine in the Rēṇukāmbā temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Narasiṅga-r[ā*]ya Uḍaiyar.
Date
Śaka 1394, Dur-mukhi, Vaigāśi 2.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Order of Pradhāna-Nayiṉār of Paḍaivīḍu, the agent of the king, treating as mānya, the fees received in the temple of Ekkalā-dēvi-Ammaṉ on ordinary days and on festival occasions.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/45 (page 82)
Placement
East wall (inside) of the mahā-maṇḍapa in the same temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Śrīraṅgadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1484 (wrong for 1488), Akshaya, Āḍi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Order of Iḍaittuṟai Tambikkōṉ and Kāvanāyakakkōṉ, the agents of China-Bommu-Nāyakarayyaṉ of Vēlūr, appointing four persons as Tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi for the annual supply of a tūṇi of ghee for burning lamps and for the sacred bath of goddess Prasanna Ekkalādēvi-Ammai of Marudaraśar-Paḍaivīḍu on the days of Tiruvādirai and of four sheep each day on the days of Mahānavamī and Paṅguṉi-Uttiram (evidently for sacrifice), in lieu of certain taxes they had to pay in Kalavai.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/46 (page 82)
Placement
Wall near the western entrance into the same temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīra-Praūḍha-Mallikārjuna-dēvarāya
Date
Śaka 1367 (wrong for 1379), Īśvara, Tai 5, Monday, Tiruvōṇam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Appointment of two persons as the tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi for (the temple of) Sōmanāthadēva-Nayiṉār at Paḍaivīḍu.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/49 (page 82)

Ends of lines built in and fragmentary. Seems to record an order by an agent (name lost) of the king to one Aiya-Nāyaṉ to supply a flower-garland (to the temple on specific occasions). Mentions a garden called Sōmadēvaṉ-tōṭṭam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/50 (page 82)

Side of rock below Vaḷḷimalai (hill), a few furlongs to the north of the same temple.

Vīra-Viruppaṇa-Uḍaiyar, son of Ariyappa-Uḍaiyar.
Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gift (by king, of land) to the east of the irrigation channel flowing from the anicut, as dēvadāna to the temple of Virū-pākshadēva.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/52 (page 83)
Placement
South wall of the central shrine in the Sōmanāthēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka [1]327, Kali 4506, Pārthiva, Āśvayuja, ba. 5, Monday, Rōhiṇī.
Language
Kannaḍa in Grantha
Remarks
Records an endowment of 1000 kaḻi of land in Āndi-nāḍu for (the remuneration of two persons) blowing the conch during service in the temple of Sōmayadēva at Paḍaivīdu by Mahāpradhāni Mallarasa, son of Mahāpradhāni Heggappa, who is also stated to have made a gift of two Dhavaḷaśaṅkha for the purpose, cased in gilded copper-plate.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/56 (page 83)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vira-Vijayarāya Uḍaiyar
Date
Śaka 133[4],
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment forming the first part of No. 55, above.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/57 (page 83)
Placement
East wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1436, Bhāva, Ṛishabha, śu.... Friday, Hastā.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An endowment of land for a flower-garden made to the deity by Ariyara-Nāyakkar as the gift of Īśura-Nāyakkar and left in charge of a certain Sōmāṇḍi and his descendants who were to supply daily 2 pairs of garlands, two fillets of flowers for the forehead and 20 pendants.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/58 (page 83)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīrapratāpa Dēvarāya-Mahārāya, son of Vīra-Vijayarāya-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 13[48], Parā-bhava, Aṟpaśi 1, Amāvāsya, Mon-day, Hastā, Dīpāvaḷi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Confirmation of Mañjakkōṉ Attigirināthaṉ in the appoint-ment of tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi of the temple of Sōmanātha-Nāyiṉār at Vaḍapuri alias Marudaraśar-Paḍaivīḍu by Eḻumbōdaḻagiyāṉ, the adhikāram of Iḍaittuṟai. Paḍaivīḍu is stated to have been situated in Murugamaṅgalapaṟṟu in Paṅgaḷa-nāḍu, a subdivision of Palkuṉṟa-kōṭṭam in Jayaṅ-goṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/59 (page 83)
Placement
North wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1351 (current), Kīlaka, Tai, Saṅkramaṇa.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
A similar appointment by Mallappa Daṇṇāyakkar of a certain Bemmu ‘paying śādam to Kaḷamūr-Kōvai’ as the tiruviḷakku-kuḍi of the temple to supply one kalam of ghee every year.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/60 (page 83)
Placement
North wall of the Ammaiyappēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Dēvarāya-Mahārāya, ‘who witnessed [the elephant-hunt]’.
Date
Śaka 1366, Rudhirō-[dgārin], Makara, śu. 1, Friday.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Another appointment of a certain Attigirināthaṉ, son of Eṭṭikkōṉ O1buḷanāthaṉ ‘paying śādam to Paḍaivīḍu’ for the supply of money or ghee to the temple of Ammaiyappa-Nayiṉār for a lamp by Malaipperumāḷ Duvarāpativēḷāṉ, the supervisor of the śādamaṇikam of Paḍaivṭṭu-rājyam to secure ‘bodily strength and universal sovereignty’ to the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/61 (page 84)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Immaḍi-Narasiṅgadēva-Mahārāya, son of Sāḷuva-Narasiṅgadēva-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1416, Ānanda, Mīṉa, śu. 10, Friday, Pūśam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Appointment of two shepherds Chinnāṅgōṉ and Śōḷakōṉ of Mukkarambai ‘paying śādam to Paḍaivīḍu-kottu’ as the hereditary tiruviḷakkukkuḍi of Ammaiyappa-Nayiṉār, by Tamiḻadaraiyar Iruḷnīkkiṉār Vallāḷanāthar Rāj nārāyaṇa-vēḷār, the agent of Tirumalai-Nāyakkar Īśurā-Nāyakkar and the śādamaṇikam of Padaivīḍu-rājyam for securing ‘universal sovereignty’ to king Immaḍi-Narasiṅga-Mahā-rāyar. The appointees were to pay 24 paṇam a year in monthly instalments and were exempted from the śammādam and kāṇikkai taxes.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/62 (page 84)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Virapratapa Dēvaraya-Mahārāya who witnessed the elephant-hunt’,
Date
Śaka 1366 (current), Rudhirōd gārin, Makara, śu. 1, Monday, Aviṭṭam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Appointment of the shepherd Dēvakkōṉ Eṭṭiäppaṉ as the tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi of the temple to which he was to pay 3 paṇam a year, by two persons who ‘managed the śādam of’ the eastern half of Murugamaṅgalap-paṟṟu.

Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/81 (page 85)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīra-Bukkaṇṇa-Uḍaiyar, son of Vīra-pratāpa Harihara-Mahārāyar.
Date
Śaka 1325, Subhānu, Makara, śu. 5, Thursday, Rēvatī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement among the Nandagōpālar and other of the Vaṇḍuvarāpati-nāṭṭār community residing in the Śōḷamaṇḍa-lam and Maḻanāḍu and having the right to hoist the gāruḍa-binner, to collect annually among themselves from each family half a Vīrachampaṉ guḻigai and conduct the services and grand festival in the Attimalaip-Perumāḷ temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/82 (page 86)
Placement
South wall of the same temple
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīra-Bukkaṇa-Uḍaiyar, son of Vīra-pratāpa Harihara-Mahārāyar.

Śaka 1325, Svabhānu, Kumbha, ba. 7, Sunday, Viśākhā.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Seems to record a similar agreement among other members of the Vaṇḍuvarāpati-[nāṭṭār] community of Paḍaivīḍu and its suburbs.

Seems to record an agreement similar to that mentioned in No. 81 above among (other) members of the shepherd community and the Vaṇḍuvarāpati-nāṭṭār of Marudaraśar-Paḍaivīḍu for conducting the grand annual festivals on ten days, and special festivals on the days of Vishuvayana-Saṅkrama, Śrījayanti, etc.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/92 (page 87)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1434, Āṅgirasa, Makara, śu. 7, Wed-nesday, Hastā.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the sale of the village Malaiyāmpaṭṭu for 500 paṇam to Tirumalai-Nāyaka, son of Ekkappa-Nāyaka, a Kannaḍiya-Nāyaka of Marudaraśar-Paḍaivīḍu, by a number of persons who fixed its rent as 20 paṇam and 45 kalam of paddy per annum which had to be paid by the purchaser to the Durgā temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/93 (page 87)
Placement
West wall of the same temple
Dynasty
Do.
King
Narasiṅgarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 140[9], Pla-vaṅga, Makara, śu. 13, Friday, Mṛigaśīraha.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an order of Būpparaśar, the agent of Nāgama-Nāyakar who was the mugappāvāḍai of the king, making a gift of the tax kāḍukāval-varttanai realised from the hill-forest near Äṟṟu-vānpāḍi to provide for scented unguents and other materials for the goddess Prasanna-Durgādēvī on special occasions, for the increasing prosperity of the king and of Nāgama-Nāyaka.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/94 (page 87)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīrapratāpa-Prauḍha-Mallikārjunadēva Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1374, Āṅgiras, Tulā, śu. 10, Monday, Pūśam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An order of Mahāpradhāna Gaṇapaṇṇa-Daṇṇāyakkar to the tānattār of the several temples including Dharmī-śvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār and Umāpatīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār allotting their annual contribution of jōḍi and śūlavari taxes amounting to 90 paṇam payable at 7(1/2) paṇam a month for the daily midday offerings and worship in the temple of Prasanna-Durgādēvī, for the merit of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/95 (page 87)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīrapratāpa Vīra-Bhū[patirāya]-Mahārāya.
Date
Śubhakṛit, Āshāḍha, śu.....
Language
Kannaḍa in Grantha
Remarks
Highly damaged. Seems to record the endowment of the (entire) village, Āṟṟuḻāmpāḍi for offerings and worship to Durgādēvī.

ARNI TALUT


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/96 (page 87)
Placement
Śamburāyanallūr.--West wall of the central shrine in the Virūpākshēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīra Virupaṇa-Uḍaiyar
Date
Śaka...., Dundubhi, Vṛiśchīka, śu. 7, [Monday, Tiru]-vōṇam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Built in in the middle. An order of Maṅgappa-Uḍaiyar to the ūravar of Śambuvarāyanallūr endowing a vēli of land and house-sites round the temple for offerings and worship to god Virūpākshadēva and appointing one Ekāmranātha as priest in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/97 (page 87)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara ......, (son of ?) Hari[hara]-Uḍaiyar.
Date
Śaka 1304 (in words), Vriśchika, śu. 7, Monday, Tiruvō-ṇam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Do. Gives detailed description of the land mentioned above and states that it was entered in the Revenue accounts.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/100 (page 87)
Placement
West wall of the deserted Vishṇu temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Viya(Vyaya), Āvaṇi
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Appointment of a shepherd (name lost), as the tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi (for supplying oil or ghee for lamps) to the temple of Pēraruḻ-āḷa-Perumāḷ at Śambuvarāyanallūr, by Śūrappavēlāṉ Koṅgarāyaṉ-Periyāvaṉ who was responsible with others for the (payment of) śādam to Murugamaṅgalappaṟṟu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/101 (page 88)
Placement
Śēdarampaṭṭu.--Side of rock known as ‘karuvēṭṭuppāṟai’ to the east of the rail-way bridge.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Īśvara, Mārgaḻi 8
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the settlement made by Nañjana-Uḍaiyar fixing the flow of water through the channel, Ariyappaṉ-kāl, from the tank at Kāmakkanallūr for one day in eight for irrigating certain lands at Śambuvarāyanallūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/102 (page 88)
Placement
Same rock
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the water flowing through the Ariyappaṉ-kāl (channel) is not to be dammed within the limits of Śambu-varāyanallūr (for purposes of storage and irrigation).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/103 (page 88)
Placement
Rock near the left bank of the Paḍaivīḍu river to the west of the railway bridge.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the canal newly dug from the tank at Śēḻiya-daraiyaṉpaṭṭu was, after irrigating lands in the village, to be let in into the tank at Kāmakkanallūr and then continued therefrom into the village Śambuvarāyanallūr (for irrigation).

TIRUVANNAMALAI TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/104 (page 88)
Placement
Malayaṉūr.--Hero-stone set up on the right bank of the Pāmbanāṟu (stream).
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman
Date
20th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 9th century A.D. States that this represents Vāṇagō-Veṭṭuvadi-araiyagaḷ. The inscription is engraved above the figure of a warrior with a sword in the right hand and a bow in the left.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/105 (page 88)
Placement
Another hero-stone set up in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 9th century A.D. This is also engraved above the figure of a warrior holding a sword by his right hand and bow by his left. Refers to a cattle-raid in which a certain Nandikuṭṭi seems to have lost his life.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/106 (page 88)
Placement
A third hero-stone set up in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In similar characters. Fragment. Mentions a certain Nandikuṭṭi, son of Mīnagarkāḷi and Malaiyaṉūr in Mīkoṉṟai-nāḍu which he was probably administering.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/107 (page 88)
Placement
Aṟaḍāppaṭṭu.--Lintel over the entrance into the maṇḍapa of the dilapidated Śiva temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Khara, Āṉi 18
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Records the perpetual devotion (to god), of Vīrappaṉ, the Kaḍaikkūṭṭu of Vāṇādarāya-Paṇḍāram. Perhaps the gift of this beam was made by the person named above.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/108 (page 89)
Placement
West wall, right of entrance, of the front gōpura of the same temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 147[9], Piṅgala, Mārgaḻi 25, śu. 12, Monday, Rēvatī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Left unfinished. Seems to record an endowment of land for the daily worship and festivals of (god) Viśvanātha-Nayiṉār at Ariyaluḍaiyā[r*]paṭṭu in Vāṇagōppāḍi-nāḍu, a dēva-maṇḍalam of god Aṇṇāmalaiyār (Aruṇāchalēśvara at Tiruvaṇṇāmalai) by Viśvanātha-Nayiṉār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/109 (page 89)
Placement
Slab set up to the west of the village
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1474, Parīdhāpi, Vṛiśchika, śu. 3, Friday, Mūlam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the grant of the different kinds of taxes realised from the wares brought for sale in the Sunday market newly opened by Viśvanātha-Nāyaka for the same purpose men-tioned above.

CHINGLEPUT DISTRICT


SAIDAPET TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/110 (page 89)
Placement
Paḻavantāṅgal.--On a stone set up in the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Achyutarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1452, Vikṛiti, Dakshiṇāyana, Vṛiśchika, śu. Paurṇamī, Friday, Kṛittikā.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Records the grant of the villages Gaṅgainallūr and Paḻavantāṅgal as dēvadāṉa to the temple of Subrahmaṇya called Seruvidi-Nayiṇār at Kōyampēḍu for the merit of the king by Mahāpradhāna Śellappa Sāḷuva-Daṇṇāyaka of Kāñchīpuram. Nearby is another slab containing a highly damaged inscription of the same king which seems also to record the gift of a village (name not clear) to the same temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/111 (page 89)
Placement
Vaḷaśaravākkam.--West wall of the ruined Śiva temple on the roadside.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Vīrarājēndradēva
Date
4th year, Siṁha, śu. 11, Punarpūśam, Sunday.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇa Mahāvrati Kāśyapaṉ Taḻuvakkuḻaindān-Paṇḍitaṉ Iḍarnīkki-Bhaṭṭaṉ to burn a twilight lamp in the temple of Tiruvēḷvīśuramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Vaḷḷiśērpākkam in Mēlūr-nāḍu for 1(1/2) Gaṇḍa-gōpālaṉ-pudumāḍai received by him from a lady, the wife of another Śivabrāhmaṇa of a temple at Kommaipākkam.

TIRUVALLUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/112 (page 89)
Placement
Tiruviḷambūdūr.--North wall of the central shrine in the Uṉṟīśvara temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rā[ja*]rā[ja*]dēva
Date
19th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an agreement given by the Śivabrāhmaṇas of the temple at Tiruviḷambōgi in Perumūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Ikkāṭṭuk-kōṭṭam in Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, for a twilight lamp to the god for 4 kāśu received by them from Tiruvāṇḍai, wife of the headman of Neṉmali.

Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Tribhuvanavīradēva, ‘who was pleased to take Madura and Īḻam’ (Ceylon).
Date
35th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a similar agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇas to burn a twilight lamp for 3 kāśu endowed by four brothers.

13th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks

SOUTH ARCOT DISTRICT


VRIDDRACHALAM TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/135 (page 91)
Placement
Vṛiddhāchalam.--Wall of the maṇḍapa at the head of the steps leading into the river.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Kali 4815, Śaka 1636, Jaya, Aṟpaśi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the stone steps of the Maṇimuktā river were constructed by Śeṭṭiyappa-Jñāniyār of Olagamādēvipuram with the financial help of Kāḷatti-Śeṭṭiyār, a merchant of Chennapaṭṭanam and that this was recorded on stone by Aruṇāchala-Paṇḍāram of the Aiyāyiravar-maḍam who supervised the construction.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/136 (page 91)
Placement
East wall (inside) of the outer prākāra of the Vṛiddhagirīśvara temple.

…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1524
Language
Telugu
Remarks

…

Language
Tamil

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/145 (page 92)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājarājadēva
Date
19th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/146 (page 92)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva
Date
34th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift, with its income in taxes like pāḍikāval, taṟiyiṟai, etc., of 5 mā of land other than those mentioned in No. 145 above by Irumuḍiśōḻa-Mūvaraiyaṉ Amattai of Karuppūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/147 (page 92)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Seems to be connected with No. 145 above. Registers a gift of 370 vēli of land, of which 360 vēli were in Nallūr, 5 vēli of flower-garden on the banks of Vaḍavār and 5 vēli at Kāchchu-vakkuḍi as archanābhōga to god Nallanāyaṉār at Nallūr by a person called Dhanmaputtiraṉ (evidently Kāḍavarāyaṉ).

Dynasty
…

…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Records the consecration of the image of Dakshiṇāmūrtti and an endow-ment of wet lands for worship to the deity by a certain Maṇḍai Ponnaṉ alias .... śōḻa-Malaiyamāṉ of (village) Śāttiyakkam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/149 (page 92)

Do.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva
Date
20th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Registers the sale of the right of singing the Tiruvembā[vai] kaḍaikkāppu in the temple of Nalla-Nāyaṉār to the dēva-raḍiyāḷ by name Uḍaiyanāchchi alias Kulōttuṅgaśōḻa-māṇikkam by the tānattār of the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/150 (page 92)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīrarājēndradēva
Date
6th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the construction of a shrine for and consecration of the image of Kshētrapāla in the temple of Nalla-Nāyaṉār at Nallūr by Āḍavalla-Nambi of Koḍumbunam, who is stated also to have endowed a quarter vēli of wet land for offerings and lamps to the deity.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/151 (page 93)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Vīrarājēndradēva
Date
Do.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Registers an endowment of the village Kāchchuvakkuḍi in Kīḻārāṟṟūr-kūṟṟam, a subdivision of Milāḍu alias Jananātha-vaḷanāḍu, as dēvadāṉa to the temple of Nalla-Nāyaṉār by Rājarājadēvaṉ alias Vāṇakōvaraiyaṉ of Āragalūr. This is signed at the end by Magadaināḍāḻvāṉ alias Vāṇakōvaraiyaṉ who was perhaps the donor himself or the officer who issued the order.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/152 (page 93)
Placement
North wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Kulūttuṅga-Chōḷadēva, ‘who was pleased to take Madura and the crowned head of the Pāṇḍya’.
Date
18th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gift of millet received in specified quantity on each vēli of land in the dēvadāṉa village from the tenants as the pāḍikāval fee by Rājarājadēvaṉ Poṉparappiṉān Vāṇakōvaraiyaṉ for offerings to god Poṉparappīśvaraṃuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār set up as an āśrayaliṅga in the temple by Tillaināyakavëḷāṉ.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/156 (page 93)

Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Kōnērmmaikoṇḍāṉ Tribh. Rājagaja-kēsari Kulaśēkharadēva.

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a similar royal order issued to the tānattār of the temple making a tax-free gift of the village Vaṇṇāttūr in the proportion of three shares to one for the expenses of a festival called after prince Sundara-Pāṇḍya and of a service in the name of the king and for the worship of the images of Vīra-pāṇḍīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār and Dēśamikka-Perumāṇāch-chiyār consecrated by the same prince in the temple Sundara-Pāṇḍya is called in the inscriptions Ubhaiyadaḷa-kumāraśārdūla.

Date

Tamil
Remarks
Records the grant of Tiruppēru, a hamlet of Tōḻiyūr on the north bank (of the river), with all its taxes, as sarvamānya for the expenses of special worship and offerings on the days of Makhā in the temple of Nalla-Nāyaṉār, for the welfare of Rājā Kōnēridēva-Mahārāja who is given the birudas, Paṭṭu-kaṭṭārirāyaṉ, Vasavaśaṅkaraṉ, Madiyādamannar-maṇa-vāḷaṉ and Kānchīpuravarādhīśvaraṉ.

KALLAKKURICHCHI TALUK.


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/166 (page 94)
Placement
Ulaganallūr.--North wall of the central shrine in the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Immaḍi Narasiṁharāya
Date
Śaka 1418, Naḷa, Makara, śu. Pūrṇai, Wednesday, Āyily-am, lunar eclipse.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the remission granted by Tyāgaṇa-Nāyakkar who held the nāyakattanam over Malāḍu (?), for the welfare of Svāmi Narasā-Nāyakkar-Uḍaiyar, of the tax nilavaḻi-kāṇikkai which had been unjustly levied in the time of Daḷavāy Kem[pa]yar of Kīḻ-Ārai, on the dēvadāṉa village Ulagiyavaliyanallūr of (god) Maddiyāna-Varadar alias Poṉparappiṉa-Nāyiṉār and other temple lands in villages round about Kallaikkuṟichchi.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/167 (page 95)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The characters are of the 13th century A.D. A deed by some officers of the king and the Puravu-variyār granting exemp-tion from the payment of poṉvari on the dēvadāṉa lands belonging to god Poṉparappiṉa-Chōḷīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Ulagiyavaliyanallūr from the seventh year of the king's reign.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/168 (page 95)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gives a list of some lands presented to the temple. Mentions a certain Iruṅgōḷappāḍivēḷāṉ. The writing belongs to about the 13th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/169 (page 95)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal order granting half a vēli of land tax-free for worship to god Vaṉ neñja-Chōḷīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār consecrated in the temple by Vāṇādarāyaṉ as āśrayaliṅga, with effect from the 16th year (of the king). The inscription is signed at the end by Vāṇakōvaraiyaṉ and Viḻuppādarāyaṉ. The writing belongs to about the 13th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/170 (page 95)
Placement
North wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Grant of 500 kaḍi of land tax-free in their village by the sabhā and the ūravar of Ulagilvaliyanallūr under royal orders, (for worship) to the goddess Tirukkāmakkōṭṭamuḍaiya-Periyanāchchiyār in the temple with effect from the 7th year (of the reign of the king).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/171 (page 95)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Plava, Māśi, 10
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an assurance given on oath on Svāmi Īśura-Nāyakkar by Tippaya-Nāyakkar, to the Nāṭṭavar of Magadai-maṇḍalam that he would not levy any taxes from them beyond the rates specified in the aḍai-ōlai executed by him nor disturb any household (as a consequence). This assurance was the result of a representation made by the nāṭṭavar that their families were broken up on account of several hardships suffered by them.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/172 (page 95)
Placement
South wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
A royal order making an endowment of 500 kuḻi of land tax-free to the goddess Tirukkāmakkōṭṭamuḍaiya-Periyanā-chchiyār in the temple with effect from the 11th year of the reign of the king. The signatories at the end are Vāṇakōvaraiyaṉ, Villavarāyaṉ and Viḻuppādarāyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/173 (page 95)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Vīrarājēndradēva
Date
6th year (in words), Puraṭṭādi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An order of Vāṇakōvaraiyaṉ issued to the sabhaiyār and ūrār remitting the taxes on a thousand kuḻi of temple land (tirunāmattukkāṇi) for the welfare of Vaṉṉañja-Nāyaṉār (king).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/174 (page 95)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Rājarājadēva
Date
6th year, Kaṟkaṭaka, śu. 10. Monday, Aviṭṭam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gift of 4 vēli of land tax-free by Ulagaṅgātta Vāṇakōvaraiyar for the prosperity of his house, to the temple of Poṉparappinēś-varamuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Ulagilvaliyanallūr in Vaḍa Naraiyūr-kūṟṟam in Malāḍu alias Jananātha-vaḷanāḍu. This was supplemented later by another gift of 4(1/2) vēli of land at Ambaṇattūr by order of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/175 (page 95)
Placement
Wall of the west verandah (over the entrance into the central shrine).
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
A (royal) gift of 500 kuḻi of tax-free land for offerings to the goddess from the 7th year (of the king), by order of Vāṇakō-varaiyar.

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
10th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Specifies the names of the dancing women who were to dance and sing before the god on each of the days of certain festivals in the temple. Signed by Vāṇādarāyaṉ at the end.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/177 (page 96)
Placement
Slab lying in the same prākāra
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Immaḍi Narasiṁharāya, son of Bhuja-balarāya Narasiṁharāya.
Date
Śaka 1422, Raudri, Tai, 1.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the nāṭṭavar of Kallaikkuṟichchi to make an annual gift of 12 kalam of oil for a perpetual and a twilight lamp in the temple and for torches on the days of festival every month.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/178 (page 96)
Placement
Inner wall of the gōpura in the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Records the construction by Andāyaṉtītta-Śēḻiyadaraiyar, son of Iruṇīkkinaperumāḷ Śēḻiyadaraiyar, and his wife Muttu Nāchchiyār, of the high wall of the Ardhanārīśvara temple, gōpura, the shrine for the goddess (Periyammai), the sacred tank with its steps and maṇḍapa, the cowshed, the kitchen and the car and the gift of several requirements for the festivals in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/179 (page 96)
Placement
Below sculptured panels containing human figurines in the outer gōpura of the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gives the names of the figures above. One is in characters of the 16th century A.D. and reads Nayināttai-Piḷḷai. The other labels which are earlier gives the names of Pachchai-Āśāri Āṟaṇipperumāḷ-Āśāri of Tiruvadikuṇḍam and Aru-[mai]-Āśāri of the same place.
