ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/181 (page 96)
Placement
Varañjaram.--North wall of the central shrine in the Paśupatīśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1227, Viśvā-[vasu*], Dhanus, ba. 1, Sunday, Tiruvādirai.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gift, after purchase, of land at Kaṟuppuḍaiyūr forming part of Pāṇḍapuram in Malāḍu alias Jananātha-vaḷanāḍu, for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Tiruvalañjuramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār by Māṇattanāyaṉ Gāṅgayanāyaṉ, son of Śembōdi Villavadāraiyar of Paḻampaṭṭiṉam in Paṭṭiṉa-nāḍu. (Vide No. 163 above; and A.R. 480 of 1937-38; 303, 304 of 1939-40).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/182 (page 96)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine
Dynasty

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/185 (page 97)
Placement
West wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Ānanda, Mārgaḻi 23
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Records a gift of 3 mā of land at Maṟuvūr (a hamlet) of Pāṇḍipuram in Mēlai Ālāṟṟam, for offerings and a perpetual lamp in the temple by Śattappa-Nāyakkar and Mallappa-Nāyakkar, sons of one Śadiraiya-Nāyakkar. Above this are three lines of writing which give the date Śaka 1293, Vi[rōdhikṛit], ... ba. 1, Sunday, Tiruvādirai.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/186 (page 97)
Placement
South wall the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Rājarājādēva
Date
17th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the permission given to the temple by Kuṉṟaṉ Vāśiṟ-ṟirundāṉ alias Eḻubattoṉbadunāṭṭu Vaḷavakōṉ, the headman of Maṇaṟpākkam (evidently an officer), to utilise for burning 60 lamps every day during service, the yield of additional trees which had been planted in the dēvadāṉa lands, over and above the quarter share of the produce already allotted to it by the state.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/187 (page 97)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva
Date
22nd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by three Śivabrāhmaṇas of the temple to maintain a twilight lamp in the temple for a hundred kāśu received by them from a resident of Māmpūṇḍi. Tiruvarañji-ram is here stated to be situated in Meyyāṟṟūr-kūṟṟam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/188 (page 97)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The characters are of about the 14th century A.D. In-complete. Seems to record a gift of the land belonging to Maṟuvūr-uḍaiyāṉ at Guṇamaṅgalam to the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/189 (page 97)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Vīrarājēndra-Chōḷadēva
Date
6th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the endowment of the village Malaiyaṉūr together with all its taxes for worship and service in the temple by Magadaināḍāḻvāṉ Rājarājadēvaṉ alias Vāṇakōvaraiyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/190 (page 97)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīrapratāpa Bhujabaladēva-Mahā-[rāya].
Date
Śaka 1422 (wrong for 1420), Kāḷayukti, Makara, śu. 7, Friday, Ratha-sap-tamī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the endowment of the village Gaṇḍarādittamaṅgalam in Pāṇḍapura-paṟṟu, a subdivision of Ālāṟṟūr-kūṟṟam by Salakaiyadēva Mahārāja and the Nāṭṭavar of the paṟṟu for special worship during the asterism Makhā for the victory (digvijaya) of the king (Svāmi Mahārāyar).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/191 (page 97)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Gift of a vessel weighing 37 palam to the temple by a shepherd named Irāṇaṉ Nakuṟan.

TIRUKKOYILUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/192 (page 97)
Placement
Iraiyūr.--Broken stone lying in a street.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Chakravartin Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva.
Date
11th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. Mentions Iraiyūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/193 (page 97)
Placement
Kuḷattūr (Elavanaśūr). Stone set up in a dry field to the south of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Nandana, Tai, 10
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of the village Kuḷattūr (renamed Kāśi-Viśvanātha-puram) in Śikkāṭṭup-paṟṟu for worship to the images of Viśvanātha and Koṇḍēśvara by Kṛishṇaya-Nāyakar Koṇḍa-ma-Nāyakar, on the occasion of the Mahōdaya.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/194 (page 97)
Placement
Śikkāḍu.--North and west walls of the central shrine in the dilapidated Śiva temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Built in and incomplete. Seems to record a royal grant of 9(1/2) paṇam for a perpetual lamp before the image of Vināyaka in the temple of Agastyēśvara, re-consecrated for the welfare of king Achyutaiyadēva-Mahārāya.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/195 (page 97)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Kōnēri[n*]maikoṇḍāṉ
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
A royal order to the tānattār of the temple of Śikkāḍuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār granting some specified plots of land for the expenses of the service conducted in the name of (king) Vikrama-Pāṇḍya, for the monthly festivals and for a perpetual lamp.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/196 (page 98)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
(Name lost)
Date
Śaka 1366 (wrong for 1362), Raudri, Āḍi [3]0.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Ends of lines lost. Seems to record an endowment of a village (name lost) on the [southern] bank of the river Peṇṇai in Vaḻudilambaṭṭu-chāvaḍi by mahāpradhānaṉ Aṇṇa ...
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/197 (page 98)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman Tribh. Vīra-Pāṇḍya-dēva.
Date
8th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Seems to record a gift of land to the temple of Tiruvakkīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār by Vīraṉ Kaṇṇuḍaiperumāḷ alias Vaṇiyapurandaraṉ of Neṟkuṉṟam, a member of the Padiṉeṇvishayam (guild).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/198 (page 98)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Rājā[dhirā]jadēva
Date
16th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the construction of the tiers, entrance, etc., in the temple of Tiruvakkīśvaram-Uḍaiyār otherwise known as Periyanāṭṭāṉ-tirukkaṟṟaḷi, by a certain Pagaḍaṉ Ūraṉ Dēvaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/199 (page 98)
Placement
East wall of the maṇḍapa, right of en-trance in the same temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1434, Āṅgiras, Āḍi 10.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an agreement given by Appaṉ, the agent of Kōnēriappar Piḷḷai to the temple, to receive certain specified amounts evidently at reduced rates on the different kinds of produce grown on some lands at Śikkāḍu which had gone fallow and lay neglected (and which had now been brought under cultivation).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/200 (page 98)
Placement
Stone set up in front of the same temple
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva
Date
3[3]rd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that two residents of the village built the tiruveḍuttuk-kaṭṭi (wall) of the temple, reclaimed certain (temple) lands and instituted a festival for the goddess.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/201 (page 98)
Placement
Rock on the hill
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1412, Sādhāraṇa.
Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
Records the construction of a tank by Kōnērirāya for growing red lilies for worship to the god Śikkāṭṭu-Īśar.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/202 (page 98)
Placement
Kāṭṭu-Iḍaiyār.--North wall of the Chidambarēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Kōṉēriṉmaikoṇḍāṉ
Date
5th year, Paṅguṉi
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the endowment of Attiyāṉpaṭṭu, a hamlet of Iṟaiyāna-raiyūr, as tax-free dēvadāna to the temple of Tirunaḍam-purindaruḷiya-Nāyaṉār (Naṭarāja) at Iḍaiyāṟu belonging to Ādaṉūr, for the expenses of worship and offerings during the service called Rājākkaṇāyaṉ-śandi instituted in the name of the royal donor and during festival days.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/203 (page 98)
Placement
East wall of the same temple
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Parākrama-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
[9]th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the paṭṭigaippaḍai of the snapana-maṇḍapa in the temple to the length of three cubits was the gift of Paṭṭaṉ Nambi, son of Maṅgalanāṭṭupparaiyaṉ Periyāṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/204 (page 98)
Placement
Stone set up in front of the same temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Vijayarājēndradēva
Date
14th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the tirumaḍaiviḷāgam known as Śeyyasēvagaṉ was (the gift) of the king who is here styled a devotee of Aḻagiya Tiruchchiṟṟambalam-Uḍaiyār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/205 (page 99)
Placement
Stone set up in a dry land about a mile to the north of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Nandana, Āṉi, 10
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The characters are of about the 15th century A.D. Records the gift of (the village) Śōḻapāṇḍ[yapuram] by the ūravar of Śeṅgaṇāṅgollai as the tirukkaivalakkam of the god at Tiruk-kōvalūr for the maintenance of the Śivandakālaḻagiyār-maṭha.

Date
6th year (in words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks

TRICHINOPOLY DISTRICT


UDAIYARPALAIYAM TALUK


Placement
Śendurai.--West wall of the Śiva temple
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman, ‘who destroyed the ships at Kāndaḷur-śālai’.
Date
1[9]th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Records a gift of land after purchasing it from the sabhā of Śendurai by a certain [Teṉ]ṉaṉ Pāttirāśēkharaṉ to the temple of Śendurai-Mahādēva for the conduct of a festival in the asterism Viśākhā in the Vaigāśi month. Śendurai is stated to have been a dēvadāṉa-brahmadēya situated in Tuṇḍanāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/208 (page 99)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1535 (wrong for 1533), Virōdhi-kṛit, Chittirai 15.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Seems to register a gift of land for worship in the temple. Mentions the temple of Kōdaṇḍa-Tambirāṉār.

…
Date
…
Language

PUDUKKOTTAI


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/211 (page 99)

King
Rājakēsarivarman
Date
15th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Unfinished. Stops with the mention of a lady by name Aṉaṁtam Paḻiyili of Uṟattūr-kūṟṟam.

Placement
Same tier
Dynasty
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman
Date
6th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a gift of ten poṉ for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Tiru-Aindaḷi-Mādēva at Koḍumbāḷūr in Uṟattūr-kūṟṟam by Tāḻi Śāttaṉ alias Rāśiṅgappallavaraiyaṉ on behalf of (his wife) Tāḻi Aṟañjigai.

Do.

Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/214 (page 99)
Placement
Same tier
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājarājakēsarvarman, ‘who destroyed the ships at Kāndaḷūr-śālai and took Gaṅgapāḍi, [Noḷa]mbapāḍi and Taḍi-gaivaḻi’.

1[4]th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/215 (page 99)
Placement
Śittannavāśal.--Wall to the left of the rock-cut cave.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
Same as A.R. No. 368 of 1904. Records the renovation of the temple of Paṇṇavar (Jaina god) and provision made for worship therein by gifts of money by Iḷaṅgautamaṉ of Madura in the reign of Śrīvallabha Avaṉipaśēkhara. (See also A.R. for 1930, pt. II., para. 4).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/216 (page 99)
Placement
Närttāmalai.--East wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the central shrine in the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that this temple (originally) founded by Śāttampūdi alias Iḷaṅgö-[A]diaraiyar having been destroyed by (heavy) rains, was renovated by Mallaṉ Viḍumaṉ alias Teṉṉavaṉ Tamiḻ-Adiaraiyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/217 (page 99)
Placement
Viśalūr.--North wall of the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman, ‘who destroyed the ships at Kāndaḷūr-Śālai’.
Date
1[2]the year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records tax-free endowment of lands made to the temple of Vāsukīśvaramuḍaiya-Mahādēva by the ūrār of Viśalūr in Mīśeṅgiḷi-nāḍu or worship and offerings to the deity.

Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that this Yakshī (image) was made by Mūvēnda-ḷūrdēvar of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻakkuḷamaṅgala-nāḍu.

…
Language
Tamil

King
…
Date
…
Language
Pallava-Grantha & Tamil
Remarks
A rectangular space marked off by thick lines contains the inscription Parivādiniē. Below this are three lines in the same script and to its proper right are two which seem to refer to the divine qualities of this (instrument).

RAMNAD DISTRICT


SRIVILLIPUTTUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/230 (page 101)
Placement
Śēttūr.--North wall of the central shrine in the Sulōchanēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Dharmapperumāḷ Kulaśēkharadēva
Date
Śaka 1483, 13th year, Durmati, Dakshiṇāyana Mēshaṛitu, Kaṉṉi-Ravi 19, śu. 10, Thursday, Utti-rāḍam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An order purporting to have been issued by god Dṛishṭīśvara ratifying the appointment made by prince Aḻagan Perumāḷ Ativīrarāma of Ūruḍaiya-Mudali alias Vīrapāṇḍ[ya*]n śūḍikkoḍutta-Mudali of the temple of Tiruvālavāyuḍaiyār at Māḍakkuḷakkīḻmadurai as the accountant of this temple, with the remuneration pertaining to the post specified. Śēṟṟūr is stated to be situated in Āṇmaṟai-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/231 (page 101)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Vikrama-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
5+1st year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the remission by the king, of the taxes on quarter vēli of land endowed by Aḻagaṉ Śiṅgaṉ alias Śiṅgaḷarāyaṉ of Śemmaram alias Kulaśēkharapuram in Āṇmā-nāḍu for feeding tapasvins in a maṭha built by the donor to the south of the temple of Kaṇṇudai-Īśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/232 (page 101)
Placement
Stone built into the west wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh.....
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. Seems to record a mortgage deed (oṟṟi-ōlai).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/233 (page 101)
Placement
North wall of the Saundaryanāyaki-Amman shrine in the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
[12]th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning of lines lost. Records the construction of the shrine of Tirukkāmakkōṭṭam Aḻagiyanāchchiyār in the temple at Śemmaram alias Kulaśēkharapuram in Āṇmā-nāḍu, by Śāttaṉ Iravi of Kīḻkuḷam in Malaimaṇḍalam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/234 (page 101)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Kulaśēkhara-dēva.
Date
3rd year, Tai
Language
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇas of the temple of Kaṇ-ṇuḍaiya-Īśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār to maintain a twilight lamp in the shrine of the goddess Aḻagiyanāchchiyār for the money received by them from Kuḻaiñjāṉ Śaṅgaṉ alias Tavapperumāḷ, a tapasvin of the place.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/235 (page 101)
Placement
North wall of the central shrine in the Śrīnivāsa-Perumāḷ temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Jaṭāvarman Tribh. Kulaśēkharadēva.
Date
13th year, 3356th day.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pūviṉkiḻatti, etc. Records a royal order granting the village Tiruvaraṅganēri, tax-free, for the expenses of worship and offerings in the temple of Śēranārāyaṇa Viṇṇagar Āḻvār built by Viradamuḍitta-Perumāḷ. The village was left in charge of the nagarak-kaṇakku by name Pulivalamuḍaiyāṉ and his descendants as tenants.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/236 (page 101)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Do.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Do. Records another gift of half a vēli of land to the temple by the king at the request of his brother-in-law Virada-muḍitta-Perumāḷ (mentioned above). The king is said to have been seated on his throne (Paḷḷippīḍam), Maḻavarāyaṉ, in his palace at Madura, east of Māḍakkuḷam in Madurōdaya-vaḷanāḍu. Mentions Mantri Rāmaṉ alias Pallavarājaṉ of Perumaṇalūr in Aṇḍa-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/237 (page 102)
Placement
Stones built irregularly into the walls of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Kulaśēkhara-dēva.
Date
13+12th year (in words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pūviṉkiḻatti etc. Records an endowment of land made for daily offerings and worship in the same temple by the nagarattār of Kulaśēkharapuram ex-cluding the pieces already endowed by them to the temples at Tirumāliruñjōlai (Aḻagarkōyil) and at Śrīvilliputtūr.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/239 (page 102)

Dēvadānam.--North wall of the central shrine in the Nachchāḍīśvara temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Kōnērimaikoṇḍāṉ Perumāḷ Aḻagaṉperumāḷ Ativīrarāmaṉ alias Śrīvalla[bha]dēva.
Date
Śaka 1494, 10th year, Āṅgirasa, Uttarā-yaṇa, Makara, śu. 7, Monday.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment, evidently by the king, of three pieces of land at Śēttūr-piḍāgai in Āṇmā-nāḍu for special offerings and worship to god Nachchāḍaitavittaruḷiya-Nayiṉār at Tiruppagavaṉ-pāṟai in the same nāḍu. Mentions a tank called Kōvalaṉ-ūraṇi among the boundaries.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/243 (page 102)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Śrīval-labhadēva.
Date
31st year (in words), Kumbha 26, śu. 1, Friday, Pūraṭṭādi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an order of the king issued from his office room (eḻuttu-maṇḍapa) at Varatu[ṅga*]dēvanallūr in Āriya-nāḍu granting the village Toṇḍaṉkuḷam for the expenses of the service called Āhavarāmaṉ-śandi instituted by the king in the temple, of festivals and of the sacred bath on ashṭamī days in the dark fortnights. Pūraṭṭādi is stated to be the natal star of the king. Refers to some previous gifts made by the king in his 28+2nd year and by Nāyaṉār Parākrama-Pāṇḍyadēva. Refers also to a donation made for conducting Parākrama-Pāṉdyaṉ-śandi.

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gift of the village Tārāṉkuḷam by the king for the expenses of the midnight service in the temple and of the sacred bath during the Paṅguni-uttiram festival.

South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty

King

The king is also called Parākrama-Pāṇḍyadēva in the body of the record.

TINNEVELLY DISTRICT


NANGUNERI TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/253 (page 103)
Placement
Tiśaiyaṉviḷai.--East wall of the Aḍaik-kalaṅkātta-Vināyaka temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
(Kollam) 967, Āvaṇi 26.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that Aḍaikkalaṅgātta-Viṉāyaka is the protector of Mīṉākshinātha-Piḷḷai, son of Śrī-Subrahmaṇya Piḷḷai of Āḷvār-Tirunagari, probably meaning that he built this temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/254 (page 103)
Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. In characters of about the 13th century A.D. Seems to record an endowment of some plots of land as tax-free dēvadāṉa (to a temple) from the 40th year (of the king).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/255 (page 104)
Placement
Śiṅgikuḷam.--South wall of the central shrine, Kailāsanātha temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
[M]āṟavarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
3rd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Beginnings of lines built in. Records an endowment of land made tax-free by the nagarattār of Pūḷam alias Rājarāja-puram in Teṉkarai-nāḍu, through Uḍaiyāṉ Malaiyaṉ alias Mādiḍaṅgoṇḍāṉ, probably a member of their guild for feeding Mahēśvaras and dēśāntiris in the Kūparāyaṉ-maṭha attached to the temple of Kulasēkhara-Īśvaram-Uḍaiyār of the place on certain festival days.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/259 (page 104)
Placement
Eastern wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
This is connected with no. 257 above. The date is given as 11+1+1st year of the king. The lands endowed are stated here to have been left in charge of Aiyāṟaṉ alias Sundarapāṇḍya-Brahmādarāyaṉ who had the right of worship in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/260 (page 104)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
11+3rd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a sale of land by the nagarattār of Pūḷam to the temple making it tax-free. The sale is said to have been necessitated by the default in the payment of the taxes pañjupīli and sandivigrahappēṟu by Viḻuppādarāyar.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/261 (page 104)
Placement
North wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
11+1+1st year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Another sale of house-site by the same community to the temple for the erection of an oil mill and for the oilmonger to live in, with the maṉaiyiṟai-tōṭṭakkaḍamai and other taxes being remitted.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/262 (page 105)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. [Kula]-śēkharadēva, ‘who took all countries’.
Date
33rd year, 61st day
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The inscription reads from bottom upwards. Built in at the ends of lines. Seems to record an endowment made in the 30th year of the king, of land for worship to the image of Tirukkāmakkōṭṭamuḍaiya-Nāchchiyār (goddess) consecra-ted in the temple by a dēvaraḍiyāḷ of the temple, to whom the kārāṇmai (tenancy) right over the land endowed was given.

Language
Tamil
Remarks

Dynasty
…

Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/269 (page 105)
Placement
North wall of the Bhagavati temple on the hill in the same village.
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh. Kōṉēriṉmaikoṇḍāṉ
Date
15th year, 388th day (in words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the uḷvari giving effect to an order of the king issued at the request of (the minister) Aṇṇaṉ Tamiḻappallava-raiyaṉ, remitting the taxes on two plots of land endowed after purchase from the nagarattār of Rājarājapuram by Madisāgaraṉ Ādibhaṭṭārakaṉ of Pugalōkarnāthanallūr in Pugalōkanātha-vaḷanāḍu as kārāṇmai-paḷḷichchandam for the worship to the image of Eṉakkunalla-nāyakar in the Jaina temple of Nyāyaparipāla-Peruṁbaḷḷi set up by the donor on the hill at Tiḍiyūr called Jiṉagirimāmalai in the name of Tamiḻappallavaraiyaṉ who is called Oruvāṟuṇarndāṉ Eṉakkunallaperumāḷ and who is stated to be a native of Rājavallavapuram in Kīḻvēṁba-nāḍu.

…

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/274 (page 106)
Placement
Kuṟumbūr.--North west and south walls of the central shrine in the Ādinārāyaṇa temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
2nd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Begins with the introduction Pūmaruviya, etc. Gives a list of several pieces of land endowed to the temple of Sundara-Pāṇḍya-Viṇṇagar-Emberumāṉ at Kuṟumbil alias Rājēndranallūr in Kuḍa-nāḍu, a sub-division of Pāṇḍi-nāḍu by the ūrār of the village and their predecessors. Refers to a gift made in the 11th year of a king whose name is not specified.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/275 (page 106)
Placement
North and west walls of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Kulaśē-kharadēva.
Date
3rd year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pūviṉ kiḻaiti, etc. Portions lost in the middle. Seems to record an agreement given by Vēḷāṉ Aiyanambi and Vēḷāṉ Ulaguttamaṉ to pay the kaḍamai, etc. taxes due on 2(1/2) mā of land sold some time previously by their jñāti Śīriḷaṅgō Irāśiṅgadēvaṉ alias Aḻagiyapāṇḍya Kaṟkuṟichchi-Muvēndavēḷāṉ to a certain Śēḻiyakōṉār, who endowed it for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Sundara-Śōḷapāṇḍya-Viṇṇagar-Emberumāṉ at Kuṟuṁbil alias Rājēndranallūr without however fulfilling his obligation of paying the taxes thereon. Kuṟumbil is said to be a dēvadāṉa village of god Tiruvānandapurattu-dēvar.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/276 (page 107)
Placement
North wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Chōḷa-Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Chōḷa-Pāṇḍyadēva
Date
24th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragmentary. Records an agreement by the ūrār of....ṇḍya-nallūr to pay the taxes on two pieces of land endowed as tax-free dēvadāṉa to the temple by Appi Purushōttamaṉ alias Uttamaśōḻachchēḻiyakōṉ and two other persons of the village for some consideration, the nature of which is not clear.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/277 (page 107)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Sundara-Chōḷa-Pāṇḍya, son of Śeṉṉi Rājēndra-Chōḷa.
Date
[2] 9th
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Portions lost. Seems to record the construction of the temple with all its adjuncts, the consecration of the images of Vishṇu with his two consorts and endowment of land for their worship by Kōḍai Uttamaṉ Ūraṉ of Kuṟumbil and his son Uttamaṉ Appi after purchasing the same tax-free from the ūrār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/278 (page 107)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jatāvarman alias Tribh. Vīra-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
6th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment of two pieces of land, after purchase, by Koṟṟaṉ Viradamuḍittāṉ and other agaṁbaḍis of Aḻagiya-pāṇḍiya-Viḻupparaiyar of Viḷattūr for offerings and worship during Tai-ayanam in the temple of Sundarapāṇḍya-Viṇṇagar-Emberumāṉ. The tenancy right over the lands was to remain however with the donor and the taxes on the puravu lands were agreed to be paid by the ūrār who received a lump-sum for the purpose.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/279 (page 107)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Śrīvallabha-dēva.
Date
6th year (in words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumaḍandaiyum, etc. Records an endowment of a land tax-free by Appi Vīṟṟirundāṉ alias Rājēndra-Śēḻiyakōṉ for the expenses of offerings to the deity Sundara-Chôḷa-Pāṇḍya-Viṇṇagarāḻvār on Amā-vāsyā days.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/280 (page 107)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Chakravartin Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva.
Date
44th year (in figures and words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pngaḻmādu viḷaṅga, etc. Records a sale of land made tax-free by the mahāsabhā of Śivandala Gaṅgaimaṅgalam, a brahmadēya in Kuḍanāḍu in Uttamaśōḻa-vaḷanāḍu, a sub-division of Rājarājapāṇḍi-nāḍu, to Śōḻa Tirunīlakaṇḍaṉ alias Rājarāja-Kuḍanāṭṭu-muvēndavēḷāṉ for an endowment to the temple as tirumaḍaippaḷḷipuṟam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/281 (page 107)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
26th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Unfinished. Begins with the same introduction as above. Stops with the mention of the temple of Sundara-Śōḻa-pāṇḍya Viṇṇagarāḻvār.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/282 (page 107)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Tribh. Śrīvallabhadēva
Date
22nd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gift of 25 sheep for a twilight lamp in the temple by Nakkaṉ Piḷḷaiyāṇḍāṉ of Śōḻa-Pāṇḍya-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Śōḻa-maṇḍalam.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/283 (page 107)
Placement
Teṉtiruppērai.--Door jambs of the north entrance into the first prākāra from the maṇḍapa of the Makaraneḍum-kuḻaikkā-dar (Vishṇu) temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman alias Rājarā-jadēva.
Date
26th year
Language
Tamil in Vaṭṭeḻuttu
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷpōla, etc. Records a sale of land made tax-free by the mahāsabhā of Kaitava-Kaitava-Chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Tiruvaḻudi-vaḷanāḍu to a certain Mādhavaṉ Udaya-divākaraṉ of Kalitavamaṅ-galam in Kuḍa-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/284 (page 107)
Placement
Slab built into the walls of the kitchen and maṇḍapa in the same temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva, ‘who was pleased to present the Chōḷa country’.
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the construction of a maṇḍapa called Jñānasamudram in the name of the king, by Śoṉṉavāṟaṟivāṉ Ārāvamud-āḻvāṉ, the headman of Peraiyūr-nāḍu. A fragment of an inscription on a second slab seems to refer to a sale of land by the ūrār of Rājarājanallūr for endowment by purchase (for worship) to Śrī Bhūmipirāṭṭiyār set up in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/285 (page 108)
Placement
North side of the inner gōpura (right of entrance) of the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
[Kollam] 757, Paṅ-guṉi 7.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a gift of 300 paṇams to the temple by Mainduva-kramavitta-nambiyār Ariyapirāṉ Tāḍaṉ for offerings in the temple during the daily recitation (adhyayana) and on the days of festival in Paṅguṉi with a right to a share of the offered food to the donor and his descendants.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/286 (page 108)
Placement
East wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the central shrine in the Kailāsanātha temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Kulaśēkhara-dēva.
Date
3+8th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇas of the temple of Kailāsam-Uḍaiyār at Teṉ-Tiruppēr alias Sundarapāṇḍya-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Tiruvaḻudi-vaḷanāḍu, to burn twelve lamps daily before the deity for the money received by them from Iḷaṁbarattuppiḷḷai, another Śivabrāhmaṇa of the same temple. Above this inscription is a fragmentary record dated in the 3rd year and 84th day of a king whose name is lost, confirming some endowment by the king made by his predecessor (Svāmidēv2ar) for the worship of goddess Tirukkāmak-kōṭṭattu-Āḷuḍaiya-Nāchchiyār consecrated in the temple by a certain Poṉṉachchi. From this endowment a portion of the paddy was allotted by the Śivabrāhmaṇas to one Āṇḍār Poṉṉārmēṉiyār for the worship of Gaṇapati probably within the same temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/287 (page 108)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
6th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the confirmation by the king of an order made by his predecessor to the tānattār remitting certain specified taxes in favour of the temple for the worship of the goddess.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/288 (page 108)
Placement
North wall of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh......., who took the Chōḷa country and (anointed himself at) Muḍigoṇḍa-śōḻapuram’.
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Stones misplaced and some lost. Refers to the consecration of the images of Sundaraperumāḷ and his consort Paravai-Nāchchiyār and to the gift of a house-site.

Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māravarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva, ‘who took the Chōḷa country and was pleased to perform the anointment of heroes at Muḍi-koṇḍaśōḻapuram’.

Language
Tamil

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/291 (page 109)
Placement
Pillar set up at the entrance into the same temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Chakravartin Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva.
Date
39th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pugaḻmādu-viḷaṅga, etc. Records a kaiyīḍu (bond) given by the mahāsabhā of Taila-kulakāla-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Tiruvaḻudi-vaḷanāḍu, a sub-division of Muḍigoṇḍaśōḷa-vaḷanāḍu in Rājarāja-Pāṇḍināḍu to the temple of Vīṟṟirundaruḷiṉa-Āḻvār at Teṉ-Tiruppēr in the same nāḍu with regard to two vēli of land in their village endowed tax-free by king Rājamahēndradēva, in place of the old deed which was lost.

TINNEVELLY TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/292 (page 109)
Placement
Tinnevelly (Tirunelvēli): South wall of the Vēṁbattūr-maḍam in the south car street.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
(Name lost)
Date
(Lost)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pūmalar tiruvum, etc. Portions lost. Records an endowment of several plots of land in different places made tax-free, by the king at the request of Aiyaṉ Maḻavarāyaṉ for feeding 38 persons including a number of dēśāntri-tapasvins, hymnists and other servants of the temple (at Tirunelvēli) in the maṭha called Śeyya-naṁbirāṭṭi-maḍam built by the king's aunt (māmatti) in her name in the south street at Tirunelvēli in Kīḻvēmbā-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/293 (page 109)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
…
King
Kōṉēriṉmelkoṇḍāṉ
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the royal order issued to the tapasvins in charge of the Śeyyanambirāṭṭiyār-maṭha communicating the above endowment, with effect from the 11th year and 184th day of the king's reign.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/294 (page 109)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the uḷvari entered in the accounts giving effect to the endowment registered above.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/295 (page 109)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
11+1st year, Āṉi
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an agreement given by the stone masons of the temple at Tirunelvēli to give a tenth of their income Tachchakkūṟu to a certain Tiruvaḷañjūḷi-Uḍaiyār, the tānāpati-Mudaliyār of the Śeyyanaṁbirāṭṭiyār-maḍam. At the end of the inscription is another agreement by the latter to pay a sixth of his emoluments for the maṭha.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/296 (page 109)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
15+1st year, Aṟpaśi
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a similar agreement given by another set of masons or architects (Śilpāchāryas) to give one-eighth of their in-come to the same individual as maḍappaṇipuṟam (main-tenance of the mat6ha). This gift is referred to in the latter portion of the above record.

KOVILPATTI TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/297 (page 109)
Placement
Kōvilpaṭṭi.--North wall of the first prākāra of the Bhuvanēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟañjaḍaiyaṉ
Date
14th year (in words)
Language
Tamil in. Vaṭṭeḻuttu Characters
Remarks
Incomplete. Seems to record the consecration of some image (Toḻakkaṉ) by a certain Nakkaṉ Gaṇapati of Iraipēṟaḍai.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/298 (page 109)
Placement
South wall of the same prākāra
Dynasty
…
King
Tribh....... ‘who conquered Īḻam (Ceylon) and Koṅgu, and performed the anointment of heroes at Perum-paṟṟapuliyūr’
Date
16th year (in words), Mithuṉa 7, Sunday
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. Seems to record some endowment for worship in the temple of Puravarīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Iram-baṟam alias Rājapu[randaranallūr] in Mudukuḍi-nāḍu, by a resident of the place.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/300 (page 109)
Placement
Iḷavēlaṅgāl.--Hero-stone set up in survey No. 247/6.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1469. Kīlaka, Paṅguṉi, 22.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the death of a certain Pōvāśi Maḻavarāya-Śiruvaṉ, the Maravaṉ of Kuṇḍaiyaṉkōṭṭai while fighting (his foes) on the occasion of the attack by Veṅgaḷarāja with his army during the sojourn of Tirunelvēlipperumāḷ alias Vēṭ-ṭuṁperumāḷ at Iḷavēlaṅgāl.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/309 (page 110)
Placement
Tenth hero-stone set up in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1469, Kīlaka, Paṅguṉi 22.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the death of the Maṟava warrior Āḷpuli Tiruvaṉ, son of Āṇḍār of Iḷavēlaṅgāl after piercing a horse on the occasion of Veṅgaḷarāja's raid.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/310 (page 110)
Placement
Vaippār.--Stone built into the balipīṭha in front of the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
........ṇḍyadēva
Date
11+1+1st year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. In characters of about the 14-15th century A.D. Mentions the Vishṇu temple of Maṇṇāl-Viṇṇagar-Emberumāṉ. A modern damaged inscription on a pillar lying in front of the temple outside records the construction of the Śadiṟkai (?) by Mammadu Subānu-Śāyabu and mentions the goddess Viśālāṭchi-Ammaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/311 (page 110)
Placement
Slab built into the ceiling of the deserted Vishṇu temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
[Kollam]779, Vaigāśi, 16.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the construction in stone of a well at Kuḷattūr alias Kumāraśēkhara[nallūr], a maḍappuṟam village of god Iḷaiya-nāya[ṉār] at Tiruchchendūr, by Vēlāyudachchivaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/312 (page 111)
Placement
Viḷāttikuḷam.--Stone set up in a dry land at Śinnakāmanpaṭṭi hamlet.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Saka 1[56]6, Subhā-[nu*], Tai[1], Pushya, Monday, Saṅkramaṇa.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment of three villages Śinnakāmaṉpaṭṭi. Kuraḷaiyaṉpaṭṭi and Ilandaikkuḷam, for worship and offerings in the temple of Chidambarēśvara and Śivakāmasaundari-Ammaṉ, by Tummichi Nāyaka on behalf of Mūrtti-Śeṭṭiyār. The gift was left in charge of one Nallaperumāḷayyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/313 (page 111)
Placement
Vānaramuṭṭi.--Gōmukha in the north wall of the central shrine in the Rāmanā-thasvāmin temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Kulaśēkharadēva
Date
13th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of this gōmukha by Śokkaṉ Purushōttamaṉ alias Dēśiyar Śiṟiya-taṭṭāṉ of Ūṟṟandūr in Neṟchura-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/314 (page 111)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Do.
King
[Māṟa*] varman alias Tribh. Sun[dara-Pā]ṇḍya-dēva, ‘who was pleased to present the Chōḷa country’.
Date
11+1st year (in words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the sale of the village Śeṅguḷam to the temple of Tiruvirāmīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Ūṟṟandūr alias Sundarapāṇḍyanallūr in Neṟchura-nāḍu a sub-division of Pāṇḍimaṇḍalam, by the ūrār of the village who agreed to pay all the taxes due thereon, themselves.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/315 (page 111)
Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Vīra-Pāṇḍya-dēva.
Date
34th year, Kaṉṉi, śu. 7, Monday, Anusham.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Records the sale of the tenancy right (kārāṇmai) over a land in the dēvadāṉa village Koṉṟaikkuḷam to a number of peṟsons by the authorities of the temple for 1000 paṇams.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/316 (page 111)
Placement
East wall of the mukha-maṇḍapa (right of entrance) in front of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Built in and stones lost. Seems to record sale of lands in a village in specified shares to several individuals by Dēvēn-dravarman evidently an officer of the king with the per mission of Kaṇḍiyadēva, as the original holders had left the place without paying the dues thereon. A fragment of an inscription on the south side close by is dated in the reign of Tribhuvanachakravartin Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/317 (page 111)
Placement
East wall of the mahāmaṇḍapa in the same temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarmaṉ alias Tribh......
Date
3rd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Portions lost. Seems to record an agreement by the authorities of the temple at Ūṟṟandūr, given to a certain Īśānadēva alias Śēḷiyasiṅgaṉ to conduct worship and offerings to the images of Kūttāḍudēva and his consort, for the land endowed by him.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/318 (page 111)
Placement
Stone built into the pavement of the verandah in the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
[Kollam] 934, Pra-mādi, Āṉi 21, Sunday Saptamī, Uttiram.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that the sōpāna-maṇḍapa in the temple was completed on this date by Śiṉṉappāṭṭiyār, son of Vaiyppāṭṭiyār of Vāṉaramuṭṭi.

CUDDAPAH DISTRICT


JAMMALAMADUGU TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/319 (page 111)
Placement
Jammalamaḍugu.--Slab paved in the verandah of the post-office.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Solar eclipse.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary and worn out. Seems to register the grant of their vartanas, by the vipravinōdins for the merit of their twenty-four families. The benefit was to go for the mahōtsa-vas (festivals) of some deity. Mentions Jaṁbulamaḍaka.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/320 (page 111)
Placement
Dommara-Nandyāla Slab in the Chenna kēśava temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Virōdhi, Vaiśākha, ba. 10.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the obeisance of Veṅkaṭanārāyaṇa-dāsari, son of Tirumalaya of Anantapuram, to god Kēśava of Nandēla, In characters of about the 18th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/321 (page 111)
Placement
Wall of the same temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Jaya, Vaiśākha, ba. 1
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a reciprocal deed given by Vēgūri-Nārasiṁharāju in favour of Pōṭi Apayyagāru to the effect that the amount of 5(1/2) varāha-gadyas was paid in cash. In characters of about the 18th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/322 (page 112)
Placement
Slab in survey No. 77, 1(1/2) miles to the west of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that the field is the mānya land of god Chennarāya of Domari-Nandyāla and specified its extent as 4 puṭṭis and 5 tūmus. In characters of about the 17th century.

King
......varsha Pṛithvīvalla[bha]
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Refers to Duggamār-Eṟeyappa who was ruling over (the territory) as far as the Kiṟudoṟe from Nariyanūru.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/324 (page 112)
Placement
Slab in the Liṅgamayya shrine behind the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Achyutadēva-Mahārāya
Date

Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and incomplete. Seems to register certain grants of land made by Pāpināyiniṅgāru, son of Goḍugumari Būmināyuḍu, and (the former's wife) Pāpasāni at the village Kanyalūru granted to them by Salakarāju Pe[da Tirumala]-rāju. (See the next number).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/325 (page 112)
Placement
A second slab in the same place
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1462, Vikārin, Kārttika, śu, 12.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers grant of land made by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Salakarāju Peda Tirumalayyadēva-Mahārāja, the brother-in-law of the king and his Vākiṭi-śirah2pradhāni, to China-Pāpināyuḍu, son of Goḍugumaṟi Būmināyuḍu at Kaṁnelūru, situated in the Cherunūru-sīma which was given as nāyaṅkara to him by the king, for the merit of the chief's father Salaka-rāju.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/326 (page 112)
Placement

…
King
…
Date
Rudhirōdgārin, Kārttika, śu. 3.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that the maṇḍapa in front of the Talakaṇṭidēvi shrine was erected by Liṅgāreḍḍi of Chadupurēla while he was holding the two villages Dēviguḍi (and) Sugumañchipale obtained by him as amara from Pemmasāni Timmānēṇḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/327 (page 112)
Placement
Pillar in the mukhamaṇḍapa of the Tala-kaṇṭamma shrine, first face.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka [1220], Viḷaṁbi, Kārttika, ba. 7, Monday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the release deed relating to his worshipping rights executed by the Bairajīya-Nāgejīya, the priest of the Tala-kaṇṭidēvī temple. The vṛittis are stated to have been sold by him for his maintenance during a period of famine in the years Jaya and Manmatha.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/328 (page 112)
Placement
Same pillar, second face
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka [1220], Viḷambi, Kārttika, ba. 7, Monday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the release deed relating to the share of Nala-Bairajīya, the priest of the Talakaṇṭidēvī temple, formerly sold by him on account of the hardship experienced during a famine in the years Jaya and Manmatha.

…
King
…
Date

Language
Telugu

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/341 (page 113)
Placement

Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīra Dēvarāya-Voḍeya
Date
Śaka 1304 (in words), Dundubhi, Māgha, ba. [3]0, Monday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks

Dynasty

…

Language
Telugu

Registers a gift of land as masīdu-mānya, made by the Dēśāyi, Reḍḍi and Karaṇam of the village to Nayanasūku Pulla-sāni-va-husēnu for having erected a Masjid in the village in honour of Khudā-Rāsūl. At the top is engraved the name Jaṁśara-Khānu.

The gift was made on the holy occasion of Śrīrāmanavamī.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/349 (page 115)
Placement
Garisalūru.--Slab lying near the ruined temple of Śiva.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Achyutarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1453, Khara, Chaitra, śu. 15
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers gift of land made by Narasabhūpāla, son of Tiru-malarāja and Tirumalādēvī and grandson of Kaṇṭhamarāja Timmarāja for the benefit of the god Chennakēśava at.... on the bank of the Kumudvatī in the Chēṁgalamaṟi-sīma of Muliki-nāḍu in the Udayagiri-rājya. The donor bears a number of epithets such as Bejavāḍapuravarādhīśvara, Mādhavavarmakula-pradīpa, Bejavāḍapālapratishṭhāpan-āchārya, etc. He belonged to the solar race and Vaśishṭha-gōtra and is said to be a subordinate of the king. Also records a provision made to the pipers, etc., for service in the temple.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/352 (page 115)
Placement
Another slab set up in the same place
Dynasty
Do.
King
Kṛishṇadēvarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1439, Īśvara, Pushya, śu. 2, Monday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records confirmation of a former grant of the sthaḷa-suṅka made by the Vidvan-Mahājanas of the village Namilidinne and by Kṛishṇayyaṅgāru, son of Pōlipalle Tipparāju made previously by Rāmarāya (of Āravīḍu) for the daśamī-mahōtsavas of the Perumāḷ. The village Namilidinne is stated to be situated in Pōlūri-sīma and given as nāyaṅkara to Bukkarāja-Timmarāja.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/358 (page 115)
Placement
Peddamuḍiyam.--Slab paved in the floor of the mukha-maṇḍapa of the Lakshmī-Narasiṁha temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Ānanda, Nija-Jyēsh-ṭha, ba. 5, [Wed-nesday].
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a grant of land as mānya made by the 108 mahājanas of Brāhmalamuḍiyam-agrahāram to two artisans for having built the śikhara to the temple of Narasiṁha and for its permanent upkeep and repairs.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/359 (page 116)
Placement
Pālūru.--Slab built into the ceiling of the mukha-maṇḍapa of the Agastīśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1646, Krōdhin, Jyēshṭha, śu. 15.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that the maṇḍapa for god Agastīśvara was built by Rāmi-Reḍḍi, son of Veṅkaṭi of Vuppalūru. Refers also to the construction of a maṇḍapa by three private people.

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1692, Khara, Jyēshṭha, ba. 10.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that the kalyāṇa-maṇḍapa was built for god Agas-tīśvara by Siṁgari, son of Peda-Gōpālayya, the Karaṇam of Pālūru.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/365 (page 116)
Placement
Slab lying in a field about a mile north-west of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Yuva, Bhādrapada, ba. 2, Friday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a grant of mānya land at Pālūru-agrahāra made by Tipā-Nāyaniṅgāru, son of Naṟavula Pedageṅgi-Nāya-niṅgāru to [Kaṁ]bhasūtram Timmābattuḍu, son of Bukka-paṭṇaṃ Peddōju. The village in which the gift land was situated is stated to have been given to the donor as nāyaṅ-kara by Vīra Narasiṅgarāya Mahārāya.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/367 (page 116)
Placement
Toṟṟivēmula.--Slab set up in front of the Āñjanēya temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1465, Śōbha-kṛit, Śrāvaṇa, [śu] 12.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Slightly damaged. Registers a gift of land made to the temple of Hanumān probably by Rāmarāju China-Tim-marāju who received, as uṁbaḷi, the villages Toravēmula and Kalumaḷa in the Rāmēśvaram-Podaṭūri-sīma, granted to him as nāyaṅkara.

…
King
…

Telugu
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/373 (page 117)
Placement
Another slab set up in the same place
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Vi[shuva,] Chaitra, śu.[1]5.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Very indiffer-ently written. Gives a number of fanciful epithets of goddess Durgā (?) and mentions Ghaṇḍikōṭa, Vōrugaṇṭi Pratāparudra and the fifty-six countries.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/375 (page 117)
Placement
Ayyavāri-Kaṁbāladinne.--Nandi pillar set up in front of the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1457, Manma-tha, Pushya, śu. 5, Wednesday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Slightly damaged. Registers a gift of the village [Kaṁ]-bhāladinne situated in the Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma by the donor (name lost), to Svayaṁbhu Śrīliṅgachakravartī Mahādēva Goṅgaḍidēva for the merit of the king. The donor is stated to have held Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma as amara-māgāṇi under the king.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/376 (page 117)
Placement
Gollala-Uppalapāḍu.--Broken slab lying in front of the Aṅjanēya temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka ...., ..... Śrāvaṇa śu. 12, Wednesday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and incomplete. Registers gift of land at Gollala-Uppalapāḍu made by Aḷiya Rāmappayyadēva Mahārāja, of the Ātrēya-gōtra, Āpastaṁba-sūtra and Yajus-śākhā, who held the Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma as nāyaṅkara under the king, to Nāraṇayya, son of Narasiṁha-Bhaṭṭa of Pulivendala.

Nārappa Nāya-niṅgāru, the dala of Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Nandēla Timmay-yadēva-Mahārāja, to the pipers and drummers for services in the temple of Chennakēśava-Perumāḷ at Gollala-Uppa-lapāḍu, situated in Ghaṇḍikōta-sīma which was given as nāyaṅkara to Timmayyadēva by the king.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/380 (page 118)
Placement
Chinnaveṇuturla.--Slab lying in the court-yard of the Kēśava temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Rāmarāja Rāmappayya ‘ruling at Vijayanagara’.
Date
Śaka 1612, Pramō-dūta, Māgha, śu. 15, Monday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that the Kāpus and the Karaṇas of Chinnavēṇuturla granted lands to Rāmaṇṇa, son of Ghaṭṭu Kēśavaya, who renovated the temple of Chennakēśvara-Perumāḷ, originally consecrated by Paraśurāma and to the scurptors Tippaya, son of Rāla-Liṅgābattuḍu and Ayyana, son of Lakkōju Buchchana.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/393 (page 119)
Placement
Slab set up in front of the Ãñjanēya image.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1476, Ānanda, Śrāvaṇa, śu. 2, Tuesday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of their tyāga-varttana income due from the Mahājanas of the village Kosinēpalle by certain Vipra-vinōdins to god Kōna-Tiruveṅgaḷanātha for the annual cherapu festival of the deity. The village was a sarva-mānya-agrahāra and was surnamed Harihararāyapuram and was included in the Chervūru-sīma.

…

…

Language
Telugu

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/398 (page 120)
Placement
Slab near the shrine of Rāma
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1734, Āṅgirasa, Mākha, ba. 3.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records that in the name of the thirty-three crores of gods and of his family deity Vīrabhadra and his ancestors, Vaḍḷu (artisan) Peddayya of Penikelapāḍu built a temple for Vighnēśvara on the platform and planted the fiens and margosa trees with a platfrom and consecrated on it an idol of Vighnēśvara.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/399 (page 120)
Placement
Slab built into the platform in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Nandana, Vaiśākha, ba. 5, [Sunday].
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that the six sons (named) of Tippi Reḍḍi of Nanda-varam endowed a trough (gāḍi) at Penukalapāḍu for the merit of their parents. In characters of about the 17th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/400 (page 120)
Placement
Slab set up near the tank a mile south-west of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1726, Raktāk-shin, Kārttika, śu. 13, Thursday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records that Voḍḷa Pedavīraṇṇa of Vēlpucharla constructed a tank in memory of his ancestors. States also that Vī-ramma, wife of Peda-Vīrabattu of Penikelapāḍu built a charity pond on the way to Vuppalūru and to the west of Vāmikoṇḍa.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/401 (page 120)
Placement
A rock called Sanyāsiguṇḍu on the Vāmi-koṇda hill.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Sanskrit verse in archaic Telugu
Remarks
States that the excellent teacher Vṛishabha who was a cloud to the crops, namely the righteous (bhavyas) and an unshakable rock to his opponents in discourse, lived on this hill’. In characters of about the 7th century A.D.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/402 (page 120)

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/403 (page 120)
Placement
Slab in survey No. 283, west of the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1468, Viśvā-vasu, Vaiśäkha, śu. 5.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the grant of the perquisites excluding the Maharāja-prayōjana, etc., that accrued in the form of money, rice, betel, etc., from the village Vēlpucherla in the Chāṁgala-maṟṟi-sīma, the nāyaṅkara of Nallan-Timarājayya, Pāṭḷāvāri-Uppalūru and Varadarājula-Dudyāla in the Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma, the nāyaṅkara of Nandyāla Timmarā-jayya-Nāraparājayya, by the asaṅkhyātas of the villages to the goddess Aṁkāḷaparamēśvarī of Vēlpucharla for worship and festivals. Records also gift of daily rations to the artisan (Vaḍla) Timvōju of Vēlpucherla for having engraved this inscription.

The gift was made on the holy occasion of prathama-dvādaśi, in the presence of god Narasiṁha on the bank of the river Pināknī.

ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/434 (page 124)
Placement
Kibilē-Sugumañchipalle.--Slab in front of the Śiiva temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1[47]0, Kīlaka, Māgha, śu. 7.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the conversion of the Karaṇika-mānyas, Vṛtti-mānyas and the wet-lands given formerly to the Karaṇams of the village by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Chinna-Timmay-yadēva-Mahārāja of Āravīḍu, into sarvamānya lands free from all taxes. The village Sukumañchipalle which is called a paḍumaṭihōra-grāma is stated to be included in the Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma, held by the donor as nāyaṅkara from the king.

Telugu
Remarks
Records the gift of the village Mēḍikuriti by Mahāmaṇḍalēś-vara Huliya Mallayadēva-Mahārāja for worship of the deities Nīlakaṇṭhadēva and Goṅgaḍayya of Niṭṭūru, stipulating that the net income from the various taxes of the village be equally shared between the two temples. The donor bears the titles Gōḍeyarāya, Rūpa-Nārāyaṇa, Rāya-Huli, Rāya-Gaṇḍabhēruṇḍa, etc. The gift was made for the, merit of Narasiṅgarājoḍeya.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/441 (page 125)
Placement
Timmāpuram near Enumulachintala.--Slab near a well west of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1[7].., .... Mārgaśira, śu. 12.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged. Registers a grant of land to some persons (names lost), by the Reḍḍis and Karaṇams of the village Peṇḍli-juvvi attached to the Jambulamaḍaka-samutu for their having dug a well and raised a grove for the merit of Hajarati Navābu Sāhebu (name not clear).

CHITTOOR DISTRICT


VAYALPAD TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/443 (page 125)
Placement
Kalakaḍa.--Tier round the basement of the ruined Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman Kulōttuṅgachōḷa-dēva.
Date
49th year.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a gift of land to the Śiva temple at Kaṟkaḍai in Kīḻai-Mārāyapāḍi situated in Iraṭṭapāḍikoṇḍa-Śōḻa-maṇḍalam by Vaidumbarājan Tiḍalīśan.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/444 (page 125)
Placement
Front wall of the same temple
Dynasty
Vaidumba
King
Bhuvanatriṇētra Iruṁgeya-Mahārāja
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the remission of all the taxes barring the Dogarācha-pannu, Paḍevāḷepannu, Paḍiyēripannu and the Sandhivi-vrahi-pannu to certain kāṁpus (names specified) of Vē-nāṇḍu by the king on the occasion of his coronation. Also seems to record certain regulations in respect of the punish-ment for adultery and consequent murder (?).
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/445 (page 125)
Placement
Hero-stone in a field about a furlong to the west of the village.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Gaṇḍatriṇētra Vaiduṁba-Mahārāja
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records the death of a hero named Ajaḷa in a cattle raid. Mentions Pallavayya, the younger brother of the king. In characters of about the 9th century A.D. The slab contains a sculpture of the fighting hero.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/446 (page 125)
Placement
Tarigoṇḍa.--Wall of the central shrine of the Narasiṁhasvāmin temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1481, Siddhār-thin, Chaitra, śu. 2.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and incomplete. Records remission of taxes on the barbers by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Jillēḷa Veṅgalarājadēva-Mahārāja with the sanction of the king and Mahāmaṇḍa-lēśvara Rāmarājadēva-Mahārāja.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/447 (page 125)
Placement
Prākāra wall (inside) of the same temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1768, Parā-bhava, Phālguṇa, śu. 5, Wednesday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the construction of a hōma-śāla and the kitchen-maṇḍapa by Eṟṟappa, son of Jagamu-Śeṭṭi and grandson of Raṁ[gi]śeṭṭi, a devotee of Guru-Bhāskarāchārya and the recipient of boons from the goddess Vāsavāmbā.
ARIE/1939-1943/List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/448 (page 125)
Placement
Slab at the entrance (inside) into the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1784, Durmati, Phālguṇa, śu. 1.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records that Kṛishṇama-Śeṭṭi, son of Subbi-Śeṭṭi and grand-son of Kaṁdula Guravappa of the Vaiśya-kula built the kalyāṇa-maṇḍapa for god Lakshmī-Nṛisiṁha.

KURNOOL DISTRICT


MARKAPUR TALUK


Placement
Tripurāntakam.--Pillar set up outside the eastern gōpura of the Tripurān-takēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Velanāṇḍu
King
Rājēndra Chōḍaya
Date
Śaka 1055, in figures and chronogram, lunar eclipse.
Language
Sanskrit & Telugu in Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of 25 cows by Baṇḍaya alias Peṇḍaya, the younger brother, and 25 cows by Rājēndra-Chōḍa, the son, of Velanāṇṭi Goṅka to Pushpātmajīya, the sthānādhipati, for maintaining a perpetual lamp in the temple of god Mahādēva of Tripurāntakam.

…
Date
…
Language
Prākṛit in Brāhmī
Remarks
Seems to state that this (image) was caused to be made by Khaṁḍuvulā, the queen of Mahārāja Siri Ehuvula Chāṁta-mūla, who was an avidhavā and a jīvaputā. In characters of about the 3rd century A.D.

KAIKALUR TALUK

Records the foundation of certain temples at Kaika-lūru alias Kaiṅkaryapura and gifts of lands made to them and their establishments by Khaṇḍērāya of the Kūḍalge family, who was a Mādhva of the Kāṇva-śākhā.

List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1941-42


VIZAGAPATAM DISTRICT


VIZAGAPATAM TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/1 (page 129)
Placement
Appikoṇḍa.--A pillar in the Śiva temple on the sea-shore.
Dynasty
Eastern Chāḷukya
King
Sarvalōkāśraya Vishṇuvardhana-Mahārāja Upēndradēva-Chakravarti.
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Incomplete. Begins with the Eastern Chāḷukya praśasi, Sakala-bhuvana, etc. Refers to god Sōmēśvara of Appakonḍa to whom some gifts were made by the king for the merit of his father Koppayadēva-Chakravarti. The king is mentioned as a devotee of god Chillīśvara-Mahādēva.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/2 (page 129)
Placement
Another pillar in the same temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1053, Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 5[5], Sādhāraṇa, Phāl-guṇa, ba. 11, Wednesday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Incomplete. Seems to record the confirmation of the exist-ing gift of the dēvabhōga village Appikoṇḍa to god Sōmēśvara of Dantivāra by the general Māchimayya-Nāyaka and the Commander Mārtaṇḍayya-Nāyaka. The former is stated to be the pradhāna of Mahāpradhāna Daṇḍanāyaka Annarāja, who bears several titles, and to be in charge of (samastādhikāri) Viśākhapaṭṭaṇa in the east of Paṁpavāḍi.

WEST GODAVARI DISTRICT


ELLORE TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/3 (page 129)
Placement
Muṇḍūru.--Broken pillar set up on the sluice of the tank called Kannasamud-ram, 1(1/2) miles to the east of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Sanskrit & Telugu prose & verse
Remarks
Fragmentary. Refers to the construction of a tank called Kannasāgara by the chief Mēdinirāya of the Chintalapaṭḷa family in the name of his mother. A tenth portion of the produce under the tank is assigned to the engineer who built it. In characters of about the 16th century A.D.

KISTNA DISTRICT


GANNAVARAM TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/4 (page 129)
Placement
Ailūru. (Ayyalūru).--Pillar set up in the compound of the Vishṇu temple.
Dynasty
Kutbshāhis of Gol-konda.
King
Hajarati Ālaṁpanah Sultān Abdullā Khutupa Śāha.
Date
Śaka 1563, Vṛisha, Jyēshṭha, Śu, 2, Friday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the grant of the village Madhurāpura as an agrahāra to Vēmūri Anantanārāyaṇa-Sarvatōmukhayājī, for having performed the sarvatōmukha-yajña, by the local chief Mīr-Jumla Amīr Muhammad Sayyad Nawab at the instance of Maṅgalagiri-Pantulu. A worn-out inscription on the reverse of the pillar seems to define some land boundaries.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/5 (page 129)
Placement
Back side of the Kṛishṇa image in the Kaṇigalaṅka in the Kṛishṇā river.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Fasli 124[9]
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Marks the boundary between Kaṇigalaṅka, the hamlet of Ayilūru and Annavaramlaṅka, the hamlet of Annavaram.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/6 (page 129)
Placement
Śāyapuram.--Pillar set up in front of the Vishṇu temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 150[0] (in words), Tāraṇa, Kārttika, Śaradṛitu, ba. 11, Thursday
Language
Sanskrit & Telugu prose & verse
Remarks
Damaged. Gives the genealogy of the minister Anantaprabhu and records the foundation of an agrahāra named Lakshmī-Nṛisiṁhapura, by him and his wife Timmāmbā.

KAIKALUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/7 (page 130)
Placement
Gōkarṇapuram (hamlet of Kollēṭikōṭa) --The pānavaṭṭam of the liṅga in the temple of Gōkarṇēśvara.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1175, Uttarā-yaṇa Saṅkarānti.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers gift of money, land and a house-site made by Vāsana-Bōyuṇḍu, son of Malle-Bōyuḍu of Guḍivāḍa and Erakā-sāni, for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Gōkarṇēśvara-Mahādēva of Guḍipūṇḍi. Refers to the measure called Nandimānika.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/8 (page 130)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1134, Uttarā-yaṇa.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Very much worn out. Records the gift of 50 inpa-eḍḻu for a perpetual lamp to the god Gōkarṇēśvara-Mahādēva. Seems to refer to a chief (?) called Kēśavabhūpati and one Sītāpati.

GUNTUR DISTRICT


PALNAD TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/9 (page 130)
Placement
Reṇṭachintala.--Slab fixed into the wall at the entrance into the temple of Mallē-śvarasvāmin.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śubhakṛit, Jyēshṭha, ba. 5, Thursday.
Language
Telugu (modern)
Remarks
Records the obeisance of Vēṇappa, son of Tūmula Ashṭamūrti, and Sāmbhanna, son of Vīranna of the same family to god Īśvara.

Language

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/17 (page 131)
Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1710, Kīlaka, Phālguṇa, śu. 15.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the endowment of an annuity of 25 varāhas, for the daily worship and offerings of the god Rāmaliṅgēśvara and the goddess Bālā-Tripurasundarī on the banks of the river Chandrabhāgā, made by Nāgulapāṭi Appāji-Pantulu, son of Veṅkanna-Pantulu and grandson of Mṛityuñjaya-Dīkshi-ita. The annuity was met by the tolls collected in the different villages of the 5 pargaṇās and the endowment made with the consent of the Dēśamukhs and Dēśapāṇḍes of the pargaṇās (See No. 13 above which is a copy of the present record).

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/48 (page 134)
Placement
Sōmireḍḍipalle.--Slab set up near the ruined temple of Śiva on the Gaṅgamma-miṭṭa, a mile east of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Svabhānu, Śrāvaṇa, śu. 15, Friday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Goḍlavīṭi Voḍḍe-Mādana-palli, now surnamed Jōtirājapuram, situated in the Sakali-pāya (division) by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Jōtirāja Guṇḍaya-dēva-Mahārāja for the merit of his parents Jōtirāja and Maldēvī, as an agrahāra to his religious preceptor Aghōraśi-vāchārya. The chief bears the epithets Tribhuvaṇīmalla, bhuvanatriṇētra, Jagaddāḷa Pāṇḍya-gajakēsari and Niśśaṅ-kapratāpa. The gift was made in the presence of god Tripurāntakadēva.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/49 (page 135)

Kēśavulanāyin-Koṭṭāla. (hamlet of Katteragaṇḍla).--Slab under a tamarind tree in a field to the east of the village.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/54 (page 135)
Placement
Pagadālapalle.--Slab lying in a field near the Eṟṟavaṅka.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1466 (wrong for 1469), Pla-vaṅga, Āshāḍha, śu. 11.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of land situated between Peda-Vaḍamānu and Sāviśeṭṭipalle in Kalachapāṭi-sīma, made by Mahānā-yaṅkāchārya Pāpā-Nāyuḍu, son of Vonnam Vōbuḷ-Nāyuḍu to Subayyaṁgāru. The sīma was given as nāyaṅkara to the donor by Nandēla Timmarājayya.

NELLORE DISTRICT


VENKATAGIRI ZAMINDARI


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/55 (page 135)
Placement
Nindali.--Slab lying near a well in Sur-vey No. 63/12.
Dynasty
Velugōṭi
King
Kumāra Yāchama-Nāyuḍu
Date
Śaka 1710, Kīlaka, Kārttika, śu. paurṇamī, Thurs-day.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the construction of a well and a maṇḍapa at Niṇḍali by Śrīrāṁ Peda-Rāmanna and Chinna-Rāmanna, of the Granthīśala-gōtra who were the clerks (gumāstā) of Chenna-ppa-Śeṭṭi, the son of Dānappa-Śeṭṭi, born of the Sūgūri-vaṁśa.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/56 (page 135)
Placement
Nandi-slab set up in Survey No. 38/10.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1[245], Rudhi-rōdgāri, Jyēsh-ṭha, śu. ......
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records gift of the village Niṁḍḍapalli as sarvamānya to god Bhīmēśvara of Dākshārāma ‘the best of the five ārāmas’ by Malevaragaṇḍa Avubhaḷanāthadēva-Mahārāja, the lord of Vēṅgīvishaya consisting of one-and-a-half lakhs of villages, and Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Apratimalla Bāchaya-Dēvachōḍa Mahārāja. On the same slab at the bottom is another much damaged inscription in later characters, which mentions the name of the village Niṇḍali.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/57 (page 135)
Placement
Slab set up in Survey No. 26
Dynasty
Velugōṭi
King
Veṅkaṭapatirāya
Date
Śaka 1539, Dundu-bhi, Māgha, ba. 10.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged. Mentions the village Niṇḍali given as amara to [Voḍe]palle Raṅgappa by the chief and records a gift of some mānya to him for the upkeep of the tank at the village.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/58 (page 136)
Placement

Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīra Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1465, Śōbha-kṛit, Āśvayuja, śu. 12.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the grant of the village Māmiḍimaḍugu now sur-named ‘Śrīnivāsapuram’ in the Veluṁpāṭi-sīma made by the king, as ēkabhōga, to Tirumala Tātāchārya of the Śaṭhamarshaṇa-gōtra. The gift was made in the presence of god Viṭhalēśvara on the bank of the Tuṅgabhadrā.

ANANTAPUR DISTRICT


ANANTAPUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/68 (page 137)
Placement
Chiyyōḍu.--Slab set up on the path near the mosque.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 14[8]0, Kāḷa-yukti, Āśvija, śu. [7], Friday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of the money income called Vīramushṭi-pannu of the villages in the Cheyyēṭi-sīma, made for the merit of the Siddhabikshāvṛitti-Aya and the Vīramushṭis by some śeṭṭi. Mentions the Ayyāvaḷi community.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/69 (page 137)
Placement
Rāchānapalle.--Slab set up near a well by the road side.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 45, Śārvari, Jyēshṭha, amā-vāsyā, Sunday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers grants of lands, houses and an oil-mill for a per-petual lamp, made by the chiefs Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Rēvi-yarasa, the son-in-law of Bhuvanaikamalla-Mahārāja, Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Kētamallarasa and Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Mummaḍi Chōḷarasa, to Mallikārjuna-Paṇḍita, the dēva-karmi of the god Mallikārjuna at R6eḍiyapalli, the head-quarters of Kuḍiya[ṇa]--40. The two latter chiefs bear a string of epithets such as Śikhidhvaja, Siṁhalāñchhana, Oṟeyūrpuravarādhīśvara, etc.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/70 (page 137)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 47, Nandana Chaitra, amā-vāsyā, Sunday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a grant of 1 paṇa from his vaḍḍarāvuḷa income realised in the Kuḍiyali-sthaḷa, made by Daṇḍanāyaka Anantadēva and a grant of one paṇa from the herjjuṅka tax made by Daṇḍanāyaka Sōvarasa and also a grant of some money income made by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Mācharasa for per-petual lamps in the temple of Mallikārjunadēva of Kuḍi-yali-sthaḷa called also Kuḍiyapeya-sthaḷa.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/71 (page 137)
Placement
Slab set up by the road side
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 45, Vaiśākha, puṇṇame, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and mutilated. Mentions Rēviyarasa and Mum-maḍi Chōḷa[rasa], of whom the latter bears the praśasti. beginning with aridurdharavara, and registers some gifts of land, oil-mill, etc., made by them to Sidharāśi-Paṇḍita, probably the servant of god Mūlasthāna.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/71a (page 137)
Placement
The same slab
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 42, Hēva-ḷambi, Bhādra-pada, ba.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated. Seems to register some gift made to the god of Mūlasthāna. Another record near this mentions Roḍḍanā-yaka, the god of Mūlasthāna and Kuḍiyali.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/72 (page 137)
Placement
Hero-stone set up by the road-side near the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
17th year, Rudhi-rōdgārin, Vaiśā-kha, ba. 5, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the manavārtte agreement relating to rents, etc. made by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Chandarasa with his pāda-mūlas (followers or tenants). Another record on the slab seems to record the death of some hero in an attack on the village. Mentions Mahāpradhāna Manevergaḍe Mahā-prachaṇḍa-daṇḍanāyaka Āneya Kēśimayya.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/73 (page 137)
Placement
Slab set up by the road-side near the model village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
In characters of about the 10th century A.D. Records the self-immolation of Kasavāḍa Gaṅga consequent on the death of (his master) Pallayya Arumu-rāju and registers a gift of 12 maṟuttus of land to his memory.

NORTH ARCOT DISTRICT


POLUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/83 (page 138)

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/84 (page 139)
Placement
East side of the rock close to a natural spring on the hillock to the west of the village.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarāja Rājakēsarivarman
Date
15th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷpola, etc., Registers a gift of land by Teṅgaḷūr Poṉkambattaiyaṉ, a member of the governing body (āḷuṅgaṇam) of Vaśugūr in Vasugūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Palkuṉṟa-kōṭṭam for providing two nāḻi of rice for offerings during the evening worship to the goddess Ūruḍaichchelvi-Śuṉaimēṉaṅgai of the place. The land was made tax-free by payment of iṟaidravyam and water-fee (nīrvilai-dravyam) to the sabhā of the village by Iṉakkuṭṭi Nakkaṉ alias Rājarājappēraraiyaṉ of Vāḻai-ppandal in Vāḻaippandal-nāḍu.

Remarks
Records a tax-free grant of land as ērippaṭṭi, by Mōndūṛ Attāḻichaḍaṅgavi, a member of the āḷuṅgaṇam of Kuṉṟattūr alias Māṟili-Mahākālachaturvēdimaṅgalam in Muhai-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/97 (page 140)
Placement
North tier of the central shrine of the ruined Vishṇu temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Pramōdūta, Puraṭṭāśi 13.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Modern. Records the gift of 100 kuḻi of land in Agaram-Kuṉṟat-tūr to the adikāri of the village for midday worship (in the temple) by Veṅkaṭādri, son of Rāmu Reḍḍiyār of Peru[ve]-ṅgaḍanallūr for the merit of Vēlūr Chinna Tippu Nāyaka.

Placement

Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/102 (page 140)
Placement
Hero-stone set up in the same place
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil in Vaṭṭeḻuttu
Remarks
The inscription is engraved above the figure of a warrior holding a bow in his left hand and a dagger in his right, with an attendant to his right. Records the death of a warrior named Pēpāṭakaṉ, evidently the hero sculptured, after defeat-ing (his enemies) in a fight. The village Varūr is mentioned. (Cf. No. 86 above).

Placement

Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇayadēva-Mahārāya
Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the provision made from the sadam due to Iḍattuṛai by Tirumalai-Nāyaka Iśvara-Nāyaka for conducting a festival as the gift of Tirumalai-Nāyaka on the day of Tiru-vādirai and for burning lamps in the temple of Virachampëś-vara at Kuṇṛattūr on the west bank (mēlkarai) of the Śeyyāṟu in Murugamaṅgalappaṟṟu, situated in Paṅgaḷa-nāḍu, a division of Pulkuṇṛa-kōṭṭam, in Jayaṅgoṅḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/108 (page 141)
Placement
Pillar in the maṇḍapa in front of the central shrine of the dilapidated Śiva temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman
Date
[8]th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the historical introduction Tirumagaḷpōla, etc. Records sale of 250 kuḻi of land by the sabhā of Kuṉṟattūr alias Mārilimahākāḷīśvara-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Mugai-nāḍu, a subdivision of Palkuṉṟak-kōṭṭam, to a merchant of Adirāma-puram alias Mummuḍi-chōḻapuram, named Muḷḷūraḍiyāṉ alias Diśaimāṇikkacheṭṭi who assigned the same for burning a night lamp till day-break in the abhishēka-maṇḍapa con-structed by him in the temple of Tirukkāri-Āḷvār.

Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/110 (page 141)
Placement
South, east and north walls of the same maṇḍapa.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Rājarāja Rājakēsarivarman alias Rājarājadēva.
Date
1[9]th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the historical introduction Tirumagaḷpōla, etc. Damaged and incomplete. Records a sale of land by the sabhā of Kuṉṟattūr alias Māṟilīśamahākāḷa-chaturvēdi-maṅgalam in Mugai-nāḍu, a subdivision of Palkuṉṛak-kōṭṭam, to a member of the āḷuṅgaṇa of the village. Another fragmentary inscription in the same place beginning with the same introduction records a sale of land by the same sabhā, to a Veḷḷāḷa of the village named Daṇḍēśvara-muttaṉ, who evidently assigned it for lamps during the three śandis in the temple of Daṇḍēśvara constructed by him. A third fragmentary inscription of the king engraved close by and beginning with the same introduction is dated in the 19th year.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/139 (page 144)
Placement
Two sides of a broken slab lying near a well in a private land.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/140 (page 144)
Placement
Padiyaṁbaṭṭu.--Pillars in the maṇḍapa of the Draupadi temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning lost. States that the mahā-maṇḍapa and the ardha-maṇḍapa, evidently of the temple, of the god Tiru-vachchiṟupākkattudēva at Koṟṟamaṅgalam was constructed of stone and also that a stone image of Ṛishabhadēva was set up by Attimalla (Hastimalla) alias Kaṉṉaradēva Pṛithi-vīgaṅgaraiyaṉ, son of Vayiri Aḍigaḷ, and ruler of Kallaḍup-pūr-maryādā and that he gave the village Koṟṟamaṅgalam for providing offerings to the deity and for feeding daily eight Brāhmaṇas. A portion of the historical introduction of Rājarāja I beginning with the words ‘Tirumagaḷpōla’ etc., is found close by. Another inscription on a pillar in the same place states that Perumānaḍigaḷ wishing to respect the gift of Pṛithivīgaṅgaraiyar issued an order to this effect through his adhikāri Mugaiyūruḍaiyāṉ and Mīnavaṉ Muvēndavēḷāṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/141 (page 144)
Placement
Idaipparai.--Two sides of slab set up in the Vēdiappaṉ temple.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṛavarman Tribh. Parākrama Pāṇḍya-dēva.
Date
8th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Purports to be an abhaya-śāsana (Añjināṉpugaliḍam) given by Kulaśēkhara Gaṅganārāyaṇachakravartti, promising to take 1/4 paṇam per family from the Kaikkōḷas, Vāṇiyar, Śeṭṭis etc., settling at Iḍaippaṟai.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/142 (page 144)
Placement
O1dalavāḍi.--South base of the central shrine in the Arhat (Jain) temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribh. Kulaśēkharadēva
Date
3rd year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of tax-free land as paḷḷichchandam by O1dalaṉ Śōḻaṉ Mūrttiyāḻvār of O1dalapāḍi, after purchasing it from the ūravar of the village to the (Jain) temple of Nāyanār Aṇiyā-daḻagiyār.
