ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/149 (page 145)
Placement
Narasiṅgapuram.--Both sides of slab set up in a private land.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1482, Raudri, Tulā, śu. 10, Mon-day, Anusham.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the formation of a pāḷaiyam in Narasiṅganallūr situat-ed in Tachchūr-nāḍu, a division of Murugamaṅgalapaṟṟu, in Palkuṉṟak-kōṭṭam, in the name of Tirumalai-Nāyaka, son of Muttu-Liṅgappa-Nāyaka, by E1kappa-Nāyaka. Emi-grants of all castes were permitted to settle on it without payment of any taxes for three years, but thereafter a fee of 3 paṇam per annum was levied on each family. Sadāśiva is given the titles Tribhuvanarāyagūḷi and Śaṁbuvarāya-sthāpanāchārya.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/155 (page 145)
Placement
Tachāṁbāḍi.--Walls of the gōpura of the Jain temple and south wall of the ruined Śiva temple on the hillock.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 136., .... śu. 10, Thursday, Punar-pūśam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
The gōpura of the Jain temple was constructed with the stones from the ruined Śiva temple on the hillock. Some of the inscribed stones are missing. Seems to record the decision arrived at by the Valaṅgai and Iḍaṅgai communities granting certain villages to the temple of Ammaiappa-Nāyiṉār at Marudaraśar-Paḍaivīḍu with the right of collecting a small cess (aḷḷu) in them. Also states that these communities bestowed upon Tiruvēṅgaḷanāthar, son of Malai-Appanā-yakkar, the title ‘Maṟaipukkār-kāvalaṉ.’
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/156 (page 146)

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/161 (page 146)
Placement
Śēttuppaṭṭu.--Three sides of a slab set up near the Dharmarāja temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śōbhakṛit, Paṅguṉi 28, Rōhiṇī, Pañcha-mī, Sunday.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that Śēshādri Ayyaṉ of Tiruvaṇṇāmalai re-settled at Śēṟṟuppaṭṭu the ryots who had migrated from it being un-able to cultivate the lands on lease according to the then prevailing rate of lease (kuttagai) assuring them that specified levies at concessional rates would be collected from them. The new arrangement (kaṭṭaḷai) was made for the merit of Raghunātha Nāyaka and Dīkshitarayyaṉ.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/190 (page 148)
Placement
Slab set up in a private land about a mile to the south of the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Viruppaṇa Uḍaiyar
Date
Rudhirōdgāri.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Refers to the construction of a tank at Villava-rāyanallūr and to a grant of 500 kuḻi of land below it, to Tiruttā-piḷḷai, the servant (paṇaiyāḷ) of [Ga]ṅgaṇaṅgaḷ. The inscription bears the signature of Malaichchōlai Villavarāyar at the end.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/191 (page 149)
Placement

Language
Tamil
Remarks

TANJORE DISTRICT


ARANTANGI TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/211 (page 151)
Placement
Piḷḷaivāyal.--Four sides of a stone set up to the north of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 142[0], Kāḷa-yukti, Āḍi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that Piḷḷaivayal alias Pāṇḍipperumāḷnallūr, the tax from which was assigned to the temple of Āḷuḍaiya-Taṁ-birāṉār at Tirupperundurai in Miḻalaik-kūṟṟam by Sūrya-dēvar Toṇḍaimāṉār, was mortgaged and purchased by several persons and that it was released and made over to the temple as tirunāmattukkāṇi, when E1kapperumāḷ-Toṇḍai-māṉār had to collect tribute for payment to the ‘Rāya who took Madura.’
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/212 (page 151)
Placement

…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1606, Raktāk-shi, Āvaṇi.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Built in the middle by the Dakshiṇāmūrti shrine. Refers to the ashṭabandha of the image of Aḻagiya Poṉṉambalanātha at Śilaṭṭūr and to a gift of land to a Śivabrāhmaṇa of Aṟan-tāṅgi in Iḷaṅgō-nāḍu, a subdivision of Sundarapāṇḍya-vaḷanāḍu.

Placement
South wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date

Tamil

Same wall
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King

16th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks

Placement

Dynasty

Tamil
Remarks
States that the shrine of Chaṇḍēśvara was repaired by an agaṁbaḍi-mudali named Śeṁbunātha, son of Pāṇḍya-perumāḷ.

MADURA DISTRICT


MADURA TALUK

Dynasty

Date
11+1+1st year
Language
Tamil
Remarks

Records a grant of uḷvari by the king at the instance of Aiyaṉ Maḻavarāyar regarding a tax free endowment of land as Maḍappuṟam for feeding tapasvins in the maṭha constructed in the name of Bagavati-Āḻvār to the north-east of the temple of Tirupparaṅkuṉ-ṟamuḍaiyār.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/240 (page 154)
Placement
Inner wall of the Mahā-maṇḍapa (proper right of entrance) in the same temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Jaṭāvarman Kulaśēkharadēva
Date
13+1+1st year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Commences with the introduction ‘Pūviṉkiḻatti’ etc., and is obstructed by images towards the end. Seems to record sale of land, free of taxes, by the authorities of the temple of Tirupparaṅkuṉṟamuḍaiyār to the assembly (ūrār) of Kulaśēkharapuram.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/242 (page 154)
Placement
East wall (inside) of the same maṇḍapa
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva ‘who was pleased to take Śōṉāḍu and perform the anoint-ment of heroes and of victors at Muḍikoṇḍaśōḻapuram.’
Date
17th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal order issued while halting at Vīra-Dhāvaḷa granting land and a house-site to a daughter of a temple servant (dēvaraḍiyāḷ). Records also a grant of land as kuśakkāṇi by the trustees of the temple to (the potter) Āḻvi Rājagaṁbhīraviṇṇavadaraiyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/243 (page 154)
Placement
Inner wall of the same maṇḍapa, left of entrance.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Kulaśēkha-radēva.
Date
13th year and 365th day.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal order, issued at the instance of Kāliṅgarāyar remitting the taxes of Kulaśēkharapuram, for providing offerings to the image of Kshētrapāla-piḷḷaiyār in the temple. The uḷvari forming Kulaśēkharapuram as a nagara by clubbing together certain villages in the 9th year of the king, is also appended to the record.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/244 (page 154)
Placement
Entrance into Mahā-maṇḍapa, left
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
...... Thursday
Language
Tamil & Sanskrit in Grantha
Remarks
In characters of the 15th century A.D. Fragmentary and ends of lines chiselled. Contains a genealogical account of the Āravīḍu chiefs and mentions Ayyana Sōmēndra-nṛipati, the king Vimalāditya and his son Rājanarēndra in whose presence a certain....ka-Nārāyaṇa rendered the Bhārata into the Āndhra-Bhāshā. The kings, Sarvajña Sōmēśvara-Nṛipati, Pinnama, Kōnapēndra-nṛipati, Viṭha-lēśvara and Timma Bhūpa are also mentioned towards the end of the inscription.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/251 (page 155)
Placement
Wall of the kaṁbattaḍi-maṇḍapa (inside), left of entrance.
Dynasty
Pāṇḍya
King
Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva ‘who was pleased to take the Chōḷa country’.
Date
5th year (in words).
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction ‘Pūmaruviya tirumaḍandaiyum’ etc. Intercepted by a wall in the middle. Records sale of land to two goldsmiths by the Śrī Rudra-Mahēśvaras for providing offerings to the god, as the original endowment of the village Tiruvuṇṇāḻigainallūr made for this purpose in the [+]+1+1st year of Periyanāyānār Kulaśēkharadēva, remained fallow without any yield.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/252 (page 155)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty

King
Māṟavarman Tribh. Vikrama-Pāṇḍya-dēva.

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Commences with the introduction ‘Tirumalarmādu’ etc. Records a royal order issued at the instance of the brother-in-law, Vikramaśōḻadēvar, while the king was halting at Aḷḷiyūr in Nāṭṭāṟupōkku, granting the village Pudukkuḷam-for providing offerings to the god Vikramapāṇḍya-Īśvaram-Uḍaiyār consecrated by Tiruchchiṟṟambalam-Uḍaiyār, a tapasvin of Kīḻaimaḍam at Tirupparaṅguṉṟam and for the maintenance of this person and his samtāna.

…
Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Refers to a grant of a pāḷaiyam as rattakkāṇikkai, to (the descendant of) Āṇḍarābaraṇa Mudali, son of Ellappa Mudali, who fell from the gōpura evidently to vindicate some right and to a gift of land for providing offerings to the god daily.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/261 (page 156)
Placement
Above the platform of the same gōpura (proper right).
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1714, Parīdāpi, Paṅguṉi 24, Wednes-day, śu. 2, Rēvatī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that during the administration of Gōpālarāya under Ahamad Khadar Saheb and Hazarat Nababu Saheb when Hazarat Kepilai Nababu Saheb was ruling the country, one Kuṭṭi, son of Vayiṟāvi Muttukaṟuppaṉ, fell from the gōpura (and died) as a protest against the demolition of the temples of Śokkanātha and Paḻaṉiyāṇḍavaṉ for which (his descen-dant) was granted a pāḷaiyam as rattakkāṇikkai making provision for providing offerings to the god daily.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/282 (page 158)

Nāyakas of Madura

Language
Tamil

Do.
King
Viśvanātha-Nāyaka Vīrappa-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1545, Dundubhi, Āvaṇi 1, Hastam, Saptamī.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records remission of taxes on the villages granted to the vehicle bearers of (the temple of) Chokkanāthasvāmi.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/289 (page 159)
Placement
Stone planted in the Mīnākshi-Nāyaka maṇḍapa.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1764, Śubhakṛit
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the provision made for daily worship in the Śrī Mīnākshi Ammaṉ shrine at Madura from the interest on one lakh of pagōḍas endowed by Kāñchīpuram Pachchayappa Mudaliyār. Also provides for the appointment of a tutor on 10 varāhaṉ for a month for teaching law (vivakāra-śāstra) and another on 5 varāhaṉ for teaching English to Hindu boys of the locality. (See also No. 145 of 1938-39).

KURNOL DISTRICT


NANDIKOTKUR TALUK

Vijayanagara

Seems to register the endowment of the village Guḍipāḍu, attached to Bannūru, situated in the Gani-sīma included in the province of Kandanavōlu, inclusive of all the privileges, to the learned Mahājanas of the place by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara (name lost) for the merit of his father Śrī-Raṅgarāju in the presence of the god Viṭhalēśvara.

Telugu

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/22 (page 162)
Placement

Dynasty
Kākatīya
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Kākati-Kumāra Rudradēva-Mahārāja ruling from O1ragal.

Śaka 1213, Khara, [Vaiśākha, śu. 15,] Thursday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a grant of land at Nandikōṭkūru made by Rudradēva, son of Mahāsāmanta Cheṟaku Manuma Bollaya Reḍḍi, to Sarvēśvarayyaṁgāru for the merit of his parents. The latter in turn gave away the gift lands to the temples of Sarvvēśvaradēva and Bollēśvaradēva founded by him at Malyāla.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/40 (page 164)
Placement
Another pillar in the same place
Dynasty
Kākatīya
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Gaṇapatidēva Mahārāja, ruling from O1ragal.
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of some vṛittis of land in two villages made by Māmala Mallaya, a feudatory of the king to god Vīśva-nātha at Siddhēśvara whose temple was constructed in the name of Viśvēśvara Śivadēva, the Rājaguru of Gaṇa-patidēva Mahārāja. The management of the endowed land was handed over to Pōchirāju Veṅgana Pegaḍa, the agent of Vidyāśivadēva, who was the sthānapati of Saṁgamēśvara and Bhāskarakshētra.

Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary. Seems to record an endowment of some vṛittis of land after purchase by Kannaya and Mallaya. In characters of about the 12th century A.D.

Placement

Dynasty
Reḍḍi
King
…
Date
Śaka 1327, Pārthiva, Chaitra, ba. 10, Wednesday.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that Kāṭamareḍḍi Vēmireḍḍi constructed the stone steps leading to Śikharēśvara for the spiritual merit of Koma-ragirireḍḍi and his queen (Ammaṅgāru). Komaragirireḍḍi bears the epithets, Jaganobbagaṇḍa and Gajapati-vibhāḍa, among others.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/54 (page 165)
Placement
A mutilated slab lying in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Records the founding of a village called Gaṇapavuram in the name of his mother and making a gift of it to god Śrīgirinātha (i.e., Mallikārjuna at Śrī-śailam) by the general Kāchaya Reḍḍi who bore the epithet, Mahārāyasthāpanāchārya (the establisher of the great king) and who is said to have vanquished the Muhammadan ruler that had penetrated into the Telugu country after conquering the Gauḷa, Gūrjara, Māḷava, Mahārāshṭra and other provinces. He is stated to be the son of Mailaya Reḍḍi who placed on a firm footing the Kākita throne (pīṭha). In characters of the 13th century A.D.

NORTH ARCOT DISTRICT


POLUR TALUK

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/88 (page 168)

Language

States that the hamlet Vēḷārēndal was purchased from the mahājanas by O1baḷarāja, son of Koṇḍarāja of Pōḷiyūr in Śiṟu[vā]lūr-nāḍu on the north bank of the river Śeyāṟu and granted to the temple of Varadarāja-Perumāḷ at Kāñchi-mānagara; and since it remained untenanted, its possession was resumed from the temple and settlement in it encouraged by promising not to levy taxes for five years.

Tamil
Remarks
Highly damaged. Begins with the historical introduction Tirumagaḷpōla etc. Records a gift of land for a perpetual lamp and for offerings during the night, in the temple of Nandipradhīśvarattāṇḍār at Śeliṟūr in Kāndaḷūr-kūṟṟam, a sub-division of Paṅgāḷa-nāḍu, by a resident of the village.

Two sides of a stone lying near the Kailā-sanātha temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Krōdhin, Āvaṇi 21
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Records a kavul given to the mahājanas of Śiru-vāḷūr by Nallāpiḷḷai, agent of Anantōji Paṇḍita.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/94 (page 169)
Placement
Two sides of a slab set up in the street
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parkēsarivarman ‘who took Madura’
Date
14th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records grant of land for a lake and to one Todupatti Āchāri-yaṉ, by Koḍukkar Toṁbattārāyiravar of Śe[l]iṟūr in Kān-daḷūr-kūṟṟam, a sub-division of Kīḻ[vē]ṇāḍu in Palguṉṟak-kōṭṭam. The lake is stated to have been dug by Mādalaṅ-kiḻāṉ Naṁpiḍāraṉ and called Aiñūṟṟuvat-toṁbattārāyirap-pērēri.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/99-100 (page 169)
Placement
Turiñjikuppam.--Two stones set up by the side of the Śiva temple in ruins.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Kṛishṇarāya
Date
Śaka 1432, (in chronogram), Śukla, Bōdhinī-ēkādaśī.
Language
Sanskrit in Telugu
Remarks
Much damaged. Records that Śiva-Dīkshita, son of Malla-māmbā, who was learned and had performed many makhas, obtained the village Kiñjalikuppam from the king and after constructing two tanks, gave it to four of his relatives who were subjected to the conditions that they should not bear any ill-will amongst themselves, nor mingle matrimonially with other castes, should be ardent in the study of the Vēdas and Śāstras and should worship only gods like Vishṇu or Īśvara and not evil deities.

King
Kṛishṇadēva-Mahārāya
Date

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a sale of land by the Ūravar of Śēṉaikkumiṇḍāṉ-vāśal near Rājagāmbīraṉ-malai in Murugamaṅgalam, a sub-division of Tachchūr-nāḍu in Palkuṉṟakōṭṭam, to Śellappaṉ of Marudaraśar Paḍaivīḍu, for which the latter agreed to give 10 paṇams every year towards the cost of a lamp for god Tiruvēṅgaḍanātha at Tiruppati, for the merit of Tirumalai Nāyaka, Namaśivāya Nāyaka and Mallappa Nāyaka.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/105 (page 170)
Placement
Kalkuppam.--Slab set up in a private land.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīra-Veṅkaṭapatirāyadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1517, Manma-tha, Siṁha, śu. 12, Wednesday Utti-rāḍam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of the village Kīḻnāgasamudram-Mēlnāgasa-mudram alias Tuvarakāḷanēndalsamudram in Murugamaṅ-galam in Tachchūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Palkuṇṟak-kōṭṭam in the Paḍaivīḍu division of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśḷōamaṇḍa-lam, by Bommu Nāyaka, son of Nāgama Nāyaka and grand son of Tippu Nāyaka for providing worship daily and for special worship on the day of dvādaśī for the merit of Nāgama Nāyaka in the temple of Araṇi Kailāsanātha. The village granted is stated to have been formerly given by Vēṅkaṭa-patirāya to Kumbakōṇam Tātāchārya and that it was now obtained from Kumāra Tātāchārya.

Language
…
Remarks
Records the division of the Mahājanas of Kaḍalāḍi alias Kumāra-Veṅkaṭādri-samudram, a hamlet of Māṁbākkam-Kuṉṟattūr, assigning three families of the shepherd class as the tenants of the temple of Lakshmīnārāyaṇa Perumāḷ, with the stipulation to supply ghee daily for a lamp in the temple and an extra quantity on the day of Kārtika for lighting the string of lamps.

CHITTOOR DISTRICT


TIRUTTANI DIVISION


ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/112 (page 171)
Placement
Dharanivarāhapuram.--Slab lying in the jungle to the south of the Kaṇṇimār (Saptamātṛis) shrine.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Śrīraṅgarāya Mahārāya
Date
Tāraṇa, Bhādrapada, ba. 5.
Language
Telugu
Remarks
Records the tax (in kind) levied on grain harvested from the lands watered by the tank at Chirutani, for its maintenance, by Baṁgāru Nāyaka, who was administering Chirutani-sīma which was situated in the Nārāyaṇavaram-sīma, which was given over for administration by the king to Tupākula-Kṛishṇappa-Nāyaka.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/146 (page 173)
Placement
Nemali.--North wall of central shrine in the Vaikuṇṭhavāsaperumāḷ temple.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman ‘who took Madura’
Date
38th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a tax-free gift of 1000 kuḻi of land below the tank Puttēri to god Tirumēṟṟaḷip-Perumāṉaḍigaḷ at Neṉmali by the assembly (ūr) of Nallāṟṟūr, in Illattūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Kunṟavattaṉa-kōṭṭam.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/147 (page 173)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Gaṇḍagōpāla
King
Vijaya Gaṇḍagōpāla
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Gives the length of the measuring rod Karuvāḻavandāṉ-kōl of Illattūr-nāḍu by two plus (+) marks on the wall, the space between which measures about 18 spans.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/148 (page 174)
Placement
North, west and south walls of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Uḍaiyār Śrī Rājēndrachōḷadēva
Date
20th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction ‘Tirumaṉṉivaḷara,’ etc. Re-cords gift of 95 sheep for a lamp to god Vajjanātha at Neṉmali alias Chaḷukkakulakāla-chaturvēdimaṅgalam situated in Illattūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Kuṉṟavattaṉa-kōṭṭam in Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, by Nāṭṭu-muttaraya Araṭṭaṟ-dēvaṉ alias Uttamaśōḻaperiyaraiyaṉ. Records also the gift of a copper lampstand to the temple by a shepherd.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/149 (page 174)
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman
Date
17th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of sheep by Āttiṟayaṉ Nārāyaṇaṉ Vāsudēvaṉ for maintaining a lamp called Tiśai āyirattu-aññūṟṟuvaṉ to the god in the temple of Tirumēṟṟaḷidēva at Neṉmali. Men-tions the liquid measure Rājakēsari.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/150 (page 174)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Rāshṭrakūṭa
King
Kaṉṉaradēva
Date
28th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a remission of taxes by the sabhā of Neṉmali on 1000 kuḻi of land granted for sounding music during the Śrībali service in the temple of Tirumēṟṟaḷi Perumāḷ by the donor mentioned above, who is stated to have belonged to Pullamaṅgalam.

Rājakēsarivarman

8th year (in words)

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/153 (page 174)
Placement
Same wall
Dynasty
Rāshṭrakūṭa
King
Kaṉṉaradēva

22nd year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Seems to state that this temple (or shrine) was renovated by (the chief) Kīḷakkayiṟṟu-Tiruvaḍi and that it is (known as) Kīḷakkayiṟṟu-Tirumēṟṟaḷi.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/154 (page 174)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Pallava
King
Aparājitavarman
Date
10th year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Ends of lines built in. Records gift of 1000 kuḻi of land in the village of Siṅgapura to the temples of god Tiru[mēṟ-ṟaḷi]dēvar and another (name lost) at Neṉmali for sounding music during the Śrībali service by Śāttandai Śutthamallaṉ alias Pallavaraiyaṉ.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/155 (page 174)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman
Date
2nd year (in words)
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Ends of lines built in and incomplete. Begins with the historical introduction Iraṭṭapāḍi ēḻaṟaiy-ilakkamum etc. Records sale of 500 kuḻi of land by the mahā-sabhā of Chaḷuk-ki[kulakāla-chaturvēdimaṅgalam] for maintaining a per-petual lamp in the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/156 (page 175)
Placement
South wall of the maṇḍapa in front of the same shrine.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman alias Rājarāja-dēva.
Date
25th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning of lines lost. Commences with the historical introduction Kāndaḷūrśālai, etc. Gives the details of taxes leviable on crops raised on different kinds of lands evidently by the sabhā of Śaḷukkikulakāla-chaturvēdimaṅgalam. A death duty of (1/4) poṉ is also stated to be leviable on the Brāhmaṇa community which was to be utilised for the benefit of the (local) tank. The document is stated to have been written by Śattiśēndaṉ Muppattiruvaṉ alias Maṅgalapriyaṉ, the madhyastha of the village.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/164 (page 175)
Placement
Chivvāḍa.--Stone set up under a tamarind tree in the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Harihararāya
Date
Pramādhin, Kar-kaṭaka.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records that Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Māchā-Reḍḍi-Gaṇapati-Reḍḍiyār, who bears the titles, Addaṅki-siṁhāsanādhīśvara, Jagadobbagaṇḍa, Basavaśaṅkara, etc., constructed a sluice for the tank at Śīyapāḍi alias Uttamaśōḻanallūr and that he provided for its dredging by authorising the fish-lease money derived from it to be utilized for the purpose.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/165 (page 175)

Language
Tamil
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/171 (page 176)
Placement
East, north and west walls of the same shrine.
Dynasty
…
King
…

Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of money and grain made in the regime of Toṇ-ḍamaṇḍalam Tūḷi Rāghavanāyani-Muttu Veḷḷakkoṇḍama Nāyakkar by the residents (ūravar) of Ārkkāḍu-kuppam for the maintenance of a watershed on the road leading to Tiruppati, instituted as the gift of Muttu-Lakshmi-Ammāḷ.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/172 (page 176)
Placement
South wall of the Mahā-maṇḍapa (left of entrance) in the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1640, Viḷaṁbi, Kārttikai 14, Pañ-chamī, Monday.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
States that Muttu Maṉṉārappa Nāyakkar, son of Veḷḷakoṇ-ḍama Nāyaka and grandson of Muttula Nāyaka, completed the construction of the central shrine and the mahāmaṇḍapa for the deities Chōḷēśvarasvāmi and his consort, besides gōpuras, shrines for Vighnēśvara and other parivāradēvatās, a sabhāmaṇḍapa and a tank. On the same stone is engraved further on, under date Śaka 1670, Vibhava, Kārttikai 28, Pañchamī, Monday, an inscription which states that Muttu Veḷḷakkoṇḍama Nāyakkar, son of Muttu Maṉṉārappa Nāyakkar mentioned above, repaired the idol of the goddess and that he constructed a ten-pillared maṇḍapa for the temple.

Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Telugu
Remarks
States that the image was the gift of Kanakāṁbā, (wife) of Muddu Veḷḷakoṇḍama Nāyaka, son of Toṇḍamaṇḍala-Dhūḷi Rāghava Nāyaka of Kannappa-gōtra and that Kumāra Muddu Rāmabhadra Nāyaka was devoted to it.

ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/183 (page 177)
Placement
Raghunāthapuram.--Stone set up in a field to the west of the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1436 (in words), Yuva, Makara, śu. 10, Monday, Tiṛuvō-ṇam.
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal gift, made on the occasion of Saṅkrama-puṇyakāla from the banks of the river Tuṅgabhadrā, of the village Tyāgachchēri in Malaippaṟṟu situated in Perumūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Kuṉṟavattanakōṭṭam to god Raghu-nātha at Neḍumbiṟai. The figure of a chakra is cut below the inscription and on the back of the stone.

…

Tamil

Language
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. States that a street belonging to god Tiruvālaṅgā-ḍu-Uḍaiyār was made over to the weavers (kaikkōḷar) free of all taxes.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/196 (page 178)
Placement
Maṅgalam.--Stone set up in the village
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Bestows imprecations on those who appropriate the village of Maṅgalam belonging to the temple of Kaṇṇappa Nayiṉār. Figures of sun and crescent and śūla are engraved below the inscription.
ARIE/1939-1943//1941-42/197 (page 178)
Placement
Hariśchandrapuram alias Kāṭramōṭū-ru.--Stone set up in the village.
Dynasty
…
King
Pārthivēndrādhipativarman
Date
10th year
Language
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of land after purchase as ērippaṭṭi by Pāra-dāyaṉ Nārāyaṇaṉ Amudaṉ of Kuladīpamaṅgalam, a brahma-dēya, situated on the south bank in Śōṇāḍu. The donor is described as a kaṉmi of Pallavamārāyar and is stated to have obtained for his livelihood (jīvitam) the village of Kāṭṭukkumuṇḍūr in Mēṉmalai-Paḻaiyaṉūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Maṉaiyiṟ-kōṭṭam.

Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40.


NORTH KANARA DISTRICT


SIRSI TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/1 (page 227)

…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka.... Āṁgirasa, Bhādra, śu. 4.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/2 (page 227)
Placement
Hero-stone in the danada bayalu
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/3 (page 227)
Placement
Hero-stone (No. I) set up in the com-pound of the Satyanāthēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Tailamadēva
Date
...., Bhādrapada, bahuḷa daśamī, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged and worn out. Mentions the god Gōkarṇa-Mahābala and paṭṭamahādēvi Laḷiyādēvī. Seems to record the gift of some money in memory of a warrior who died in a fight. Mentions also Durgādēvī and Kāmadēvī. These were perhaps his wives.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/4 (page 227)
Placement
Another hero-stone (No. II) at the same place.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Lost
Date
...., Piṁgaḷa, dīpavāḷige (dīpā-vaḷige), amāvāse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Partly broken and damaged. In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Mentions a Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara who was a worshipper of the god Mahābala of Gōkarṇa and seems to record the death of Mēdagauḍana Bīvarasa of Bakkaṇa in the battle at Puṇije. Mentions Pradhāna Sāṁtaveg-gaḍe Bommagauḍa, the younger brother of Mēdagauḍa and Banavase Bairōja.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/5 (page 227)
Placement
Barūr.--Hero-stone (No. I) set up in the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Paridhāvi
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged and worn out. The characters belong to about the 12th century A.D. Refers to the ‘Guttiya-rājya’ and one Masaṇeyanāyaka's son (name lost) who probably died in a battle.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/6 (page 227)

Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1[3]87, Vyaya, Phālguṇa, ba. 5, Tuesday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and partly worn out. Seems to refer to the requisi-tion of Kaleya-Daṁṇāyaka, son of Sātiya-Daṁṇāyaka to Chandragutti. Seems to mention some Āḷuva-Mahā-prabhu (name not clear).

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/10 (page 227)
Placement

Date

Kannaḍa

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/11 (page 228)
Placement
Chippagi.--Slab standing in front of the dilapidated Īśvara temple.
Dynasty
Western Chālukya
King
Bhuvanaikamalla
Date
Śaka [995, Pari-dhāvi], Kārtika, śu. 13, Uttara-bhādrapada.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the construction of a tank, the erection of a Śiva temple called Jakkēśvara at Sippake and gift of land for the same by four gāvuṇḍas when Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Tailapadēva was governing Banavāsi-Twelve Thousand. Mentions in the preamble that Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Kīrti-dēva was ruling the same territory. Refers to Sāntayya-dēva as administering the Mogalenāḍu-70 division.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/12 (page 228)
Placement
Dēvatēmane.--Slab lying in the forest near the village.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Iṟiva beḍeṁga Satyāśraya
Date
Śaka 928, Parā-bhava, Vaiśākha, śu. pāḍiva, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Refers to Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Chaṭṭayya as the governor of Banavāsi-Twelve Thousand and records the gift of land made by Jegatimabbe-Gāvuṇḍi before her demise.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/13 (page 228)

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/14 (page 228)
Placement
Hero-stone set up near the Bhadrakāḷi temple.
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Tailamadēva, son of Tribhuvana-malladēva.
Date
Year 11, Īśvara, Pushya, .....12, Wednesday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Broken and damaged. Relates that Komma-Gauḍa put up a heroic fight against the infantry and the cavaliers of Mallidēva, son of Kāvadēva and died in the battle of Kalu-gāla when the latter made a march and encamped at Ballāḷa-Sirise.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/15 (page 228)
Placement
Honnēhaḷḷi.--Slab set up near the Nara-siṁha temple in the Svarṇavalli Maṭha.
Dynasty
Sōde
King
Savāyi Rāmachandra-Nāyaka
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 1595, Pramādi, Māgha, śu. 4, Saturday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records the performance and completion of a sacrifice for the prosperity of the chief by His Holiness Sarvajña-Sarasvatī Śrīpāda of Honnēhaḷḷi through Viśvapati-Bhaṭṭa who was brought down from Kāśī (Benares). The stone depicts in relief the vēdī of the agnihōtra maṁṭapa with the three holy fire-pits.

Śaka 1478, Rākshasa
Language
Sanskrit in Malayāḷam characters
Remarks
Seems to record the construction of a temple by the chief.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/23 (page 229)
Placement
Hero-stone set up in the forest of Māsti-kān, near the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Rudhirōdgāri, Chai-tra, śu. 1, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 15th century A.D. States that Giriyaṇa-Nāyaka and his elder brother Māvaṇa-Nāyaka of Machagaṁḍi, who were the followers of Immaḍi Ara-sappa-Voḍeya, died in an encounter between Sadāśiva-Nāyaka and Arasappa-Voḍeya.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/24 (page 229)
Placement
Hero-stone set up at the Eḍabala-kaṭṭe in the forest near the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Mahārājādhirāja Virūpāksharāya
Date
Hēviḷaṁbi, Māgha, śu. 1[0].
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Seems to record the death of a warrior named Bīra and the erection of the hero-stone by his people. Mentions Sōdeya Arasappa-Nāyaka, Duggaṇa-Nāyaka, Māvana-siṅga-Nāyaka, etc.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/26 (page 229)
Placement
Left-side pillar at the entrance of the Lakshmīnārāyaṇa temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
San 1266 Fasali, Payiṁgaḷa, Chai-tra, śu. 2.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that [the maṇḍapa] was renovated by His Holiness Śri Lakshmīnivāsa-Tīrtha of the Vyāsarāja-Saṁsthāna. Refers to the pūrvāśrama of the pontiff.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/27 (page 229)
Placement
Pillar lying in the forest near the Rāma-liṅga temple.
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Chaṭṭayadēva
Date
Śaka 904, Chitra-bhānu, Chaitra, śu. 1, Sunday, Uttarāyaṇa-saṁ-krānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that Paṁchavaṭe-O1jiga, son of Biyaḷaiya who was administering (kāyika) the Teṁgere-Thirty (division) endowed some money to the Mahājanas of Isuḻūru for a gōsāsa and set up the stone (pillar). The chief was the lord of Banavāsi Twelve Thousand and Sāntaḷige Thousand.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/28 (page 229)
Placement
Hero-stone (No. I) in a row set up near the same temple.

King
…
Date
Durmukhi, Vaiśā-kha, śu. 15, Sun-day.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Indifferently written. Seems to record the death of a certain warrior (name not clear) who was cut to pieces in a fight. Mentions Arasappa-Oḍeya, the chief of Sōte (Sōde).

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/45 (page 231)
Placement
Kalkuṇi.--Slab standing in the site of an old temple near the village.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Harihara Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1317, Yuva, Pushya, śu. 15, lunar eclipse (sōpadhā-sōmō-parāga).
Language
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
Records the endowment, to please god Madukanātha, of the village Kalukaṇi by the chief Karuvūra Sānta-Daṇṇāyaka and the several gauṇḍas of the Kabunāligeya-nāḍu included in the Chandragutti division of eighteen Kampaṇas into the hands of Siriyaṇa Mādapa, after pur-chasing it from him. Siriyaṇa Mādapa who was entrusted with the endowment bestowed it on learned Brāhmaṇas well-versed in the shaṭkarmas and the śāstras dividing the same into twelve vṛittis, as an agrahāra called Lakshmī-pura, on Māgha ba. 30 of the same year.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/46 (page 231)
Placement
Karasvaḷḷi.--Slab set up in the village
Dynasty
Sōde
King
Arasappa-Nāyaka
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 1525, Śōbhakṛit, Jyēshṭha, śu. 15, Saturday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Partly damaged. Seems to record the gift of the village Kaḷusavaḷḷi by the chief to a certain Virupaṇṇa.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/47 (page 231)
Placement
Slab set up in the boundary of a field
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīra Harihararāya, son of Vīra Buk-karāya.
Date
Śaka 1320, Īśvara, Kārtika, ba. 2, [Wednesday].
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Partly damaged. Records the gift of some land to some Brāhmans by Kaliūra Sātapa-Daṁṇāyaka when Bā-chaṁṇa-Oḍeya was administering the Gutti-rājya.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/48 (page 231)
Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1319, Īśvara, Bhādrapada, śu. 5, Friday.
Language
Kannaḍa prose & verse
Remarks
Upper portion much damaged. Records the death of Mal-lappa-Damṇāyaka, son of Kallappa-Daṁṇāyaka. Men-tions Honnāmbikādēvī and the lord of Banavāsipura.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/50 (page 231)
Placement
Kengare-math.--Slab on the Sirsi-Sonda road.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of the 10th century A.D. States that the śāsana was set up in memory of Basava's son Eṟeyaha and his wife on the death of the former when Chaṭṭuvarasa was administering as peggaḍe of Biyaḷa. Mentions the headmen (?) of five other villages.

Placement
Slab set up in front of the same temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 1732, Pramōdūta, Māgha, śu. 7, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that Nāraṇa-Heggaḍe, son of Timmaṁṇa-Hegaḍe of Kibaḷi constructed the stone temple, installed the god Rāmanāthēśvara and performed the dhvajasthāpanā.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/53 (page 231)
Placement
Hero-stone set up in the same place
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Vīra-Kāvadēva
Date
Year 13, Durmati, Phālguṇa, [śu.] 1, Tuesday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Relates that one Jaka-Gauḍa died on the battle-field having fought valorously and killing a horse. The memorial stone was set up by his son Kaḷa-Gauḍa and (the latter's wife) Kāḷi-Gauḍimabe.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/61 (page 232)
Placement
Puṭṭanamane.--Slab lying near the Śiva temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
[Chāḷukya-Vikrama Varsha] 42, (in words), Kīlaka, Kā-rtika, śu. 13, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Much damaged. States that the village Beṭṭehaḷḷi belonged to Haḍavaḷa Maraviyaṇa and records the construction of a temple and gift of land at the village of Maṇajuganaḷi by him. Mentions the Kadaṁba chief Kāmadēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/62 (page 232)
Placement
Sahasraḷḷi.--Slab set up in the Rāmē-śvara temple.
Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyamurāri Sōvidēva
Date
Year 4, Vijaya, Phālguṇa, Puṇṇ-ami, Monday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records the installation of a liṅga by Kabbila-Gāvuṇḍa and gifts of land made by him and others to the god when the feudatory Kadaṁba Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Kīrtidēva was governing the province of Banavāse-12,000 from Hānuṁgal. Mentions Hu[li]ya-Daṇḍanāyaka as the administrator of Kabunālige-70 division. The gift was made into the hands of Mahadēva-Paṇḍita of Banavāse.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/74 (page 233)
Placement
The ḍhvajastaṁbha set up in front of the Trivikrama temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 1562, Vikrama, Jyē-shṭha, śu. 5, Mon-day.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the pillar was set up by Śrī-Vēdanidhi-Tīrtha, the grand-disciple (praśishya) of Śrī-Vādirāja-Tīrtha.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/75 (page 233)
Placement
Slab set up at a distance to the south of the same temple
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Veṅkaṭapatidēva Mahārāya
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 1515, Vijaya, Kār-tika, śu. 15.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that Śrī-Vādirajātīrtha constructed the temple and installed the image of Trivikrama while the chief Arasappa-Nāyaka was ruling at Sōde. Describes in detail the assignment of several grain and money incomes made by Śrī Vādirāja for the services in the temple. A post-script in later charac-ters states that Śālivāhana Śaka 1505, Chitrabhānu, Vai-sākha, śu. 15, Wednesday was the muhūrta of the installation of the god Trivikrama.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/76 (page 233)
Placement
Slab standing in a lawn (survey No. 79) near the Jain Maṭha.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Sadāśivarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1491 (in chro-nogram), Vibhava, Māgha, śu. 5, Monday.
Language
Sanskṛit & Kannaḍa in Kannaḍa
Remarks
The composition is faulty. Records the gift of land made for the maintenance of a satra in a maṭha at Sōdāpurī by Arasamma, daughter of the chief Arasappa-Nāyaka with the permission of the king. The chief is stated to belong to the Śūryavaṁśa. Mention is made of the Sēnabōva Timmarasa of the Kauśika gōtra and Āśvalāyana-sūtra.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/77 (page 233)
Placement
Sides of a nishidi-maṇṭapa (No. I) in the forest (burial ground).

…

Kannaḍa
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/82 (page 234)
Placement
Yasaḷe.--Pillar (No. 4) of the first group of nine pillars set up in the forest near the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 10th century A.D. States that Koṇḍaṟa, Guṇakamma performed the gōsāsa for the second time, and that Eṟechaṭṭa the son of Eṟegāri-ōja, carved this stone. Above the epigraph is sculptured the figure of a plough drawn by two bulls. The first three pillars bear no writing.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/83 (page 234)
Placement
Pillar (No. 5) set up in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Vyatīpāta, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that Tāliyara Vuṭṭayya of Tāḷavūru performed the gōsāsa. May be a continuation from pillar No. 8 (No. 86). There is a sculpture of plough and bulls above the inscription.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/84 (page 234)
Placement
Pillar (No. 6) set up in the same place
Dynasty
[Kadaṁba]
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date
Śaka 901, Sarvajit, Āśvayuja, amāvāse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Incomplete. Mentions the chief as governing Vanavāse Twelve-Thousand. Seems to be a continuation from the next pillar. Contains at the top the sculpture of the ‘talkative tortoise and the swans’ (Photo App. D. No. 1812).

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/86 (page 234)
Placement
Pillar (No. 8) set up in the same place.
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date
Śaka 907, Pārthiva, Pausha, amāvāse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Incomplete. States that Chaṭṭayya was governing Banavāsi Twelve-Thousand and Sānṭaḷige Thousand and that he was conducting the perbbarvru at Esaḻe. Seems to be continued on pillar No. 5 (No. 83 above). Bears the figure of an elephant carved at the top.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/87 (page 234)
Placement
Pillar (No. 9) set up in the same place
Dynasty
Do.
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date
Śaka 906, Tā[rāṇa], Āśvayuja, Vishu-Saṁkrāṁti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and incomplete. States that Chaṭṭayya was govern-ing Banavāsi Twelve-Thousand and Sāṁtaḷige-Thousand and that Marayya of Kammaṟūr and Chaṭṭayya were conducting the perbbārvvu at Esaḻe. The figure of an elephant is sculptured at the top.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/90 (page 235)
Placement
Pillar (No. 4) set up in the same place
Dynasty
[Western Chāḷukya]
King
Tailapadēva
Date
Śaka 9(0)15, Vijaya.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Incomplete. Seems to be continued on the next pillar, No. 91 below. The figure of an elephant is carved above the epigraph.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/91 (page 235)
Placement
Pillar (No. 5) set up in the same place
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to be a continuation from the above inscription. Mentions Chaṭṭayyadēva as governing Banavāsi Twelve-Thousand and Chaṭṭayya and Dēvayya Maṇṇachaiyya as performing perbbārvvu at Esaḻe. Contains the sculpture of two bulls with a plough. Kannayya is stated to be conducting the perggaḍetana.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/92 (page 235)
Placement
Pillar (No. 6) set up in the same place
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Chaitra, Saṁkrānti
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to be a continuation of from No. 91 above. Records the performance of gōsāsa by Andabaḷḷiya Raggasa Garuvaṇṇa. Contains the sculpture in high relief of Gaṇēśa in a shrine above the inscription and ‘the Talkative tortoise and the swans’ on the reverse side. The swans are depicted in a different attitude from that in No. 84 above.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/93 (page 235)
Placement
Hero-stone (No. 1) set up in a meadow near the above.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Mallikārjunarāya, son of Dēvarāya
Date
Śaka 1370, Prabhava, Māgha, ba. 8, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Refers to the king's capital as Hastināvati-Vijayanagara and records the gift of land at Yasaḷe, made to the son of Bīra-Nāyaka who died in a fight at the village Biḷigeṟe, by the people of Hariya-nāḍu and the local gauḍas. Mentions Bācheya-Nāyaka of Aṇṇigēri.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/94 (page 235)
Placement
Hero-stone (No. II) set up in the same place.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Virūpāksha-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1401, (in words) Vikārin, Māgha, śu. 10.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records the death of some hero (name not clear) in a fight. Mentions Hariya-nāḍu, the village Esaḷe, Hanu-ma-Nāyaka and Arasappa-Nāyaka of Sōde.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/95 (page 235)
Placement
Hero-stone (No. III) set up in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seriously damaged and worn out. The characters belong to about the 16th century A.D. Mentions Arasappa-Voḍeya, [Rēva] rasa-Voḍeya, Hariyanāḍu and the village Yasaḷe. Seems to record the death of a warrior (name not clear).

KUMTA TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/96 (page 235)
Placement
Gōkarṇ.--Slab set up above the western entrance of the raṅgamaṇḍapa of the Mahābalēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śārvari, Kārtika, śu. ..........
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 18th century A.D. States that the construction of the raṅgamaṁṭapa was completed during the management (pārupatya) of Viśvēśvarayya of Malasu-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/97 (page 235)
Placement
Slab built in the pavement of the front corridor in the same temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1[3]39, (in words), Durmukhi, Chaitra, śu. 2, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land for the maintenance of a satra in the temple of the god Mahābala of Gōkarṇa when Mahāpradhāna Baṁkarasa-Voḍeya's son (name lost) was governing the province of Hayive, Tuḷu and Koṁkaṇa from his capital at Hoṁnāvura. Seems also to record a gift of land for feeding the ascetics of three communities (parishat).
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/98 (page 235)
Placement
Pillar set up on the left side of the southern entrance of the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Built in and incomplete. In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Refers to a Mahāmaṇḍaḷeśvara who bears titles such as Gōkarṇa-puravarādhīśvara, Birudanṛipar-aṅkuśa, etc.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/99 (page 236)
Placement
Pillar set up on the right side in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1000 (in words) Kālayukta, Mā-khanavami (for Mahānavami), Aśva-yuja, śu. 9, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and incomplete. Refers to a Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara who styles himself as Gōkarṇa-puravarādhīśvara and seems to record a gift of money income for the benefit of the temple of god Mahābaḷa.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/100 (page 236)
Placement
Fragment built into the wall of the Tāmra gauri temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seriously mutilated. In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Records gift of the village Hosa-ūru to Mābala-Liṅga-Bhaṭṭa for maintaining a charitable boarding house (chhatra) in the temple of the goddess Tāṁbragauri by Mahāpradhāna Maṁju-Nāyaka. The supervision of the charity was vested in the hands of Rāghavēndra-Śrīpāda of the Dēvarāya-Maṭha at Haṁpe.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/101 (page 236)
Placement
Slab lying in the garden of Gopī Bhaṭ adjoining the Mahābala temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Bukkarāya Mahārāya
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
Damaged and mutilated. In characters of the 14th century A.D. Seems to record tax-free endowment (sarvamānya) of land by [B]asaveya-Daṇāyaka with the sanction of Bu-kkarāya to Paramahaṁsa Parivrājakāchārya Śrī-Vēdasāgara-Śrīpāda for lamps and offerings to (the god) Vēdēśvara of Gōkarṇa. Mentions the nāḍu of the twelve shares of the village Hubbaṇakeṟe.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/102 (page 236)
Placement
Slab built above the entrance of the Amṛitēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1771, Saumya
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the Amṛitēśvara temple was constructed (reno-vated ?) by Lakshumayya of Harati, the munsif of the Ankola taluk.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/103 (page 236)
Placement
Slab set up in the house of Mūle Sēsha Bhaṭ.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
Partly damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Registers an endowment of four villages to the temples of Mahābala and Amṛitēśvara for feeding Brāhmaṇas in the Bāchaṇṇoḍeya-maṭha by Mādarasa-Oḍe-yaru after purchasing them. The assignment of the income derived therefrom is recorded in minute detail. Refers to a previous transaction of Śaka 13....
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/104 (page 236)
Placement
Slab set up in the house of Śiva Bhaṭ Aḍi
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Harihara Mahārāya reigning from the nelevīḍu at Dōrasamudra.
Date
Śaka 1[3]15, (in words) Āṁgirasa, Āshāḍha, ba. 7, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and broken Registers grants made by certain śeṭṭis in the presence of god Mahābala for the maintenance of a feeding house (satra-dharma) when the king's feudatory, Mahapradhana Mallappa-Oḍeya was governing Hayive and other provinces from [Hoṁ]nāvūra-rājadhāni.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/105 (page 237)
Placement
Slab built into the wall of Nārāyaṇa Upā-dhye's house.
Dynasty
Do.
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Broken and worn out. In characters of the 15th century A.D. Registers gifts made for a feeding house at Gōkarṇa by Viṭhaladēvī, queen of Vīra-Bukka in the presence of the Rājaguru Īśvara-Bhaṭṭa. The endowment is stated to have been put into execution by Honnabbe as a deputy of the queen.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/106 (page 237)
Placement
Slab set up in the dilapidated Honnehaḷḷi-maṭha.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Bukkarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1206, Pramādi, Kārtika, śu. 1, Saturday, Svāti.
Language
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
Slightly damaged. Records in detail the assignment of the income derived from the lands endowed in the presence of the god Mahābala by Honnādēvī, queen of Bukkarāya, for a feeding house and offerings to the deity when Mallappa-Oḍeya was governing the province of [Hai]ve.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/107 (page 237)
Placement
Slab built into the entrance of the Śaṅkara-Nārāyaṇa temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa in Malayāḷam Characters
Remarks
Portions lost. Seems to record a gift of money. Mentions Rāmanāyaka and Śaṅkara[nārā]yaṇa.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/108 (page 237)
Placement
Slab set up in the house of Anant Krishna Karant.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Highly damaged. In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Registers in detail gifts and provision made for a feeding house (satra) and other services probably in the temple of Mahābalēśvara. Mentions Chaṇḍōgra-Pārśvanātha of the Hiriyabasti at Gērusoppe in connection with the impreca-tions. Chandapa-Bhakta engraved the grant.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/109 (page 237)
Placement
Slab set up near the Subrahmaṇya temple
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Harihararāya, ruling from Dōrasamu-dra.
Date
Śaka 13[11], solar eclipse...Mārgaśira.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Highly damaged and worn out. Seems to record the provision made for a feeding house (satra) by a daughter of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/110 (page 237)
Placement
Slab standing in the Kāmēśvara-maṭha
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Kāvadēvarasa, son of Śivachitta Era-Basavidēvarasa.
Date
Year 14, Vikrama, Mārgasira, śu. 15, Monday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Refers to the king as Kadaṁba-Chakravarti. States that a maṭha was constructed at Dhārēśvarakshētra in Gōkarṇa and land endowed therefor to the preceptor Purushōtta-mapurī Srīpāda and his disciples by the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/111 (page 237)
Placement
Slab lying near the Paṭṭa Gaṇapati temple
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Harihara Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1324, Vikrama, Phālguṇa, ba. 7, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a transaction made by Virupāyi, son of Āyibhaṭṭa Mādaṁna with Mahābalabhaṭṭa for the purchase of land for a satra when Mahāpradhāna Sōvidēva-Oḍeya was govern-ing the provinces of Hayive, Tuḷu and Koṁkaṇa from his capital at Hoṁnāvūru.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/112 (page 237)
Placement
Slab standing in the house of Morēbhaṭ
Dynasty
Do.
King
Dēvarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1332, Virōdhi, Kārtika, śu. 9, Wednesday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Partly damaged. Registers gift of land in the Baṁgane-nāḍu made to Amarēśvara Bhāratī-Śrīpāda in the presence of the god Mahābala for the maintenance of a chhatra by Vissaṇṇa, the son of Siddappa of the Vīśvāmitra-gōtra. Also records gift of land for a chhatra founded by Rāma-chandra-Sarasvati-Śrīpāda in the name of Biṭhapa-Oḍeya. Mahāpradhāna [Sōma]appa-Oḍeya was governing the provinces of Hayive, Tuḷu and Koṁkaṇa from his capital at Hoṁnāvura.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40/1939-40/113 (page 237)
Placement
Slab built in the wall inside the house of Hire Bhat.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Sadāśivarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 147[5], Paridhā-vi, Simha-Guru, Pushya, ba. 30, Monday, Śravaṇa-nakshatra, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers endowments of lands made for the benefit of maṭhas, rituals and other purposes such as charities in the renovated temple of Vaiśravaṇēśvara by Bhaṭṭakala Gaṇapaṇa-Jōyisa and others having purchased the same from certain pontiffs and bhaṭṭas when Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Sāḷuva Kṛishṇadēva-rasa-Oḍeya was governing the provinces of Nagira-rājya, Hayive, Tuḷu Koṁkaṇa, etc. Assignment and manage-ment of the several incomes are set forth in full detail.

Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41.


BELGAUM DISTRICT


PARASGAD TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/1 (page 240)
Placement
Arṭagaḷ: Slab set up near the Kala-mēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Chālukya-Vikrama year 24, .......... Śu. 5, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records gift of land for the salvation (?) (parōksha-dharma) of Narasuga who attained heaven by entering the sacrificial fire-pit, amidst the admiration of the people, at the demise along with his consort of his liege-lord, Dēvati, the son of Mahāsāmanta Chikkarasa and the commander of the Tuḷu guards who were the body-guard of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/2 (page 240)
Placement
Asuṇḍi: Stone set up in the Banaśaṅ-karī temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1015, Śrīmukha, Uttarāyaṇa-saṁk-rānti, Vyatīpāta.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records gifts of land to god Śaṅkara-Nārā-yaṇa after purchasing it from the Two Hundred Mahā-janas of Hiriya-Hasuṇḍi which was a sarvamānya-nitya bhūmidāna endowment of the king. Mentions land at Māṇikēśvara.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/3 (page 240)
Placement
Fragment lying in the same temple
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Invokes the Jinaśāsana. Mentions the Two Hundred Mahā janas (of Asuṇḍi) who were versed in the Ṛig, Yajus, Sāma and Atharvaṇa Vēdas and in the six tarkas. Asuṇḍi was a sarvanamasya-nitya-bhūmidāna endowment of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/4 (page 240)
Placement
Baḍli: Pillar in the Chidaṁbarēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Hoysaḷa
King
Vī[ra-Ballaḷa]......II (?)
Date
Vaiśākha, śu. 7
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
The pillar is reported to have been brought from Aṇṇīgēr (Dharwar district). Published in the Karnatak Inscriptions. Vol. I (1941), No. 29.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/7 (page 240)
Placement
Chachaḍi.--Slab standing at the entrance of the Nārāyaṇa temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Records the gift of (the village) Nāgarapāḷa to the god Bhōgēśvara of Mudgaḍe by the Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Kanna[kai]rarasa and Koṁgajarasa.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/8 (page 240)
Placement
Slab built in the pedestal of the image of god Nārāyaṇa at the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 18th century A.D. Seems to state that the image is the jīrṇōddhāraṇa (reconsecration) made by Mudeya, son of Chapa of Thavaṭi.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/9 (page 240)
Placement
Hero-stone set up behind the Saṁga-mēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 13th century A.D. Describes the valour of two warriors who died in the fight for the recovery of cows from the hands of the enemy in a cattle raid. One of these is Basava-Gāvuṇḍa. The name of the other is not clear.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/10 (page 241)
Placement
Slab lying in the dēsagati-hola
Dynasty
[Raṭṭa]
King
Kārtavīryadēva ‘ruling from Vēṇu-grāma’.
Date
Śaka 1124, Durmati, Kārtika, śu. 11, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records gift of land to the god Saṁgamēśvara by the Ūroḍeya Vāmarasa and others of the mahāgrahāra Chachchaki. The gift was made into the hands of Nāgarā-sidēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/11 (page 241)
Placement
Chik-Budnūr: Hero-stone built into the wall of the temple of Lakkavva.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya
Date
Śaka 1358, Nala, Phālguṇa, śu. 15, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to record the death of the warrior Nāgaṇa in a fight and his attaining the vīrasvarga.

King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 19th century A.D. Refers to Rudra-ppa, his bhakti and Kailāsa-mukti.

…
Language

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/14 (page 241)
Placement
Hosūr: Broken slab set up near the Basavaṇṇa temple.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Much damaged. Refer to Kūṇḍi-Three Thousand (division) and to the Raṭṭa chief [Barma]dēvarasa probably ruling over it. Mentions also some gāvuṇḍas.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/15 (page 241)
Placement
Two fragments set up near the same temple.
Dynasty
[Raṭṭa]
King
Lakshmīdēva, ‘ruling from his head-quarters at Vēṇupura’.
Date
Śaka 1030, Sarva-dhārin, Pushya, śu. 5, Monday, Uttarāyaṇa-saṁk-rānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. It is a Jina-śāsana. Records gift of land by the chief to a basadi built by himself. Mentions some Jaina teachers.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/16 (page 241)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1123, Raudri, Pushya, śu. 10, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records gift of land by a gāvuṇḍa to the basadi renovated by him.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/17 (page 241)
Placement
Hūli: Slab set up in the Pañchaliṅga temple.
Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyanārāyaṇa Āhavamalladēva, son of Vīra-Bijjaṇadēva.
Date
Śaka 1103, Plava, Vaiśākha, śu. 14, Wednesday, Vya-tīpāta.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records a gift of land for the water-shed (ara-vaṇṭe) to the venerable One Hundred of Ghaisāsagēri and the ūroḍeya of Pūli in the town-hall of the Tiguḷas (Tamilians) in the place, by Prabhu Sōma of the Bhāradvāja-gotra. Also records gifts of land to the God Tiguḷēśvara and for the renovation of the town-hall of the Tiguḷas (Tamilians) by the respectable One Hundred of Ghaisāsagēri.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/18 (page 241)
Placement
Second slab set up in the same temple
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva (Bijjaḷa)

Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Published in Ep. Ind., Vol. XVIII, pp. 208 ff.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/24 (page 242)
Placement
Lintel of the right-side door in the inner shrine of the same temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 12th century A.D. States that the two door-jambs were endowed by the merchants (nakara) Govariya Kali-Gāvuṇḍa of Navilūru, Tāvare Mahādēvi-Sashṭi (Śrēshṭhi), etc., who were the disciples of Nēmichandra Siddhānta-Chakravarti.

Kannaḍa

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/38 (page 243)
Placement
Fragment built into the wall of the Sid-dhanañjēśa-maṭha.

…
King
Vīra-Vijayarasa
Date
Śaka 901, Pramādi, Śrāvaṇa, śu. 15.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. States that the maṭha of Śrī-Siddhanañjāchārya of Pañchavaṇigi was renovated and a Paṁchapalli set up for the glory of his nijaliṅga. The characters appear to be modern.

Pillar in the same maṭha
Dynasty
Western Chālukya
King
…
Date
Do.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Authenticity questionable. Almost reproduces the text of the above record and registers a new gift of land and money-income made on the same day for the benefit of Śrī-Siddhanañjāchārya of the Puvali-agrahāra of Beḷavāḍi, by the chief Vīra-Vijayarasa through Kari Kētimayya.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/52 (page 244)
Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa

Incomplete. In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Begins with the invocation of the god Gavarēśvara, refers to a Śivasiṁhāsana and then describes the Kūṇḍi province in the Kuntala-vishaya.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/53 (page 244)
Placement
Iṅgaḷgi.--Twelve stones built in the interior walls of the Kari-guḍi.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Contains abbreviations showing the directions of the wall and the number of rounds, possibly meant to facilitate the masons in arranging the several stones of the walls.

Placement

Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 16, Prajāpati, Phālguna, śu. 8, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records the death of Gaṇigara Sōma-Gavuṇḍa in a sanguinary fight with the cavalry force of Kuṟimba Gāḷiga and his followers who had besieged Jakkivāḍa.

Placement

…
King
…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 1739, Īśvara, Dakshiṇāyana, Śaradṛitu, Kārtika, va. 1, Monday, Rōhiṇī-nakshatra.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/63 (page 245)
Placement
A stone with damaged Jaina figures set up near Kariyavvana-guḍi.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. In characters of about the 12th century A.D. States that this nisidige stone was set up in memory of Munichandradēva of Munivaḷḷi, belonging to the Yāpanīya-saṁgha by his lay disciple Gaṁgeve, daughter of Kuḷḷeya Kēta-gāvuḍa. This states that Munichandradēva was the Āchārya of the basti founded by one Siryādēvī.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/64 (page 245)
Placement
Another stone of a similar nature set up in the same place.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Sādhā[raṇa], Āśva-yuja, Kṛishṇa-pak-sha, 5, Friday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Records the demise of Pālyakī[rti]dēva, the spiritual son of Munichandra[dēva] of Munivaḷḷi of the Yāpanīya-saṁgha, on the given date.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/67 (page 245)
Placement
Murgōḍ:--Slab set up in the Mallikārjuna temple.
Dynasty
Vijayanagara
King
Vīra Sadāśivarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 1473, Virōdhikṛit [Jyēshṭha], ba. [8], Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seriously damaged and worn out. Registers the gift of land made for the worship, etc., of god Mallikārjuna, by Murugōḍu Pedi-Nāyaka, the agent of Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Bāchirāja-Narasarājayyadēva-Mahā-arasu.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/68 (page 245)
Placement
Slab set up at the back of the Vīrabhadra temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 14-6[9], Plavaṅga, Āshāḍha, śu. 11, [Sunday].
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the remission of the terige (tax) on the barbers of the villages in the Toṟagale-sīme in favour of Timmōja, Koṇḍōja and Bhadrōja of the community.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/69 (page 245)
Placement
Slab lying near the dilapidated temple of Beṭṭada Īraṇṇa.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Trailōkyamalladēva
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 9, Krōdhana, Uttarāyaṇa-saṁkr-ānti, Vyatīpāta.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers the gift of Nāgarapāḷa into the hands of [Mailāraśakti]-Paṇḍita for feeding the ascetics and worship of the god Bhōgēśvara at Mudugaḍe, whose temple was constructed at the instance of Mahā-maṇḍaḷēśvara [Koṁgāḷvarasa], who was governing Kūṁḍi Three-Thousand and Miṟiṁje Three-Thousand.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/70 (page 246)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalla Sōmēśvara
Date
Śaka [974], Naṁdana, Chaitra, śu. [1], Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Do. Registers an endowment of money into the hands of the merchants (nakara) by Vaḍiyamaseṭṭi to the Bhōgēśvara-maṭha at Mudgaḍe. The interest derived from the amount was to be used for feeding the ascetics and the students in the maṭha. Mentions twelve gāvuṇḍas, in connection with the preservation of the dharma.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/71 (page 246)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama-Varsha [10], Phāl-guna.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Seems to register gifts of oil, land, etc., to the god Nakarēśvara and to the maṭha of the Bhōgē-śvara temple by several persons. Mentions Mādiyabbe and Kalidēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/72 (page 246)

King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 10th century A.D. Seems to contain the description of the bravery of some warrior, name not clear.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/76 (page 246)
Placement
Broken slab lying near the Hāḷa Kallap-pana guḍi.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Pushya, śu. 13, Sunday, Uttarā-yaṇa.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Worn out. Invokes the Jinaśāsana. Describes Rishisṛiṁgi and its six gāvuṇḍas. Mentions Attimabbe, Dēvarasa and Kalidēva-śeṭṭi. Registers gifts of land, oil, etc., to a basadi by Bāchi Gāvuṇḍa and others (details lost). Mentions the Jaina teacher Gaṇḍavi[mukta] Siddhāntidēva.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/77 (page 246)
Placement

Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribhuvanamalla
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated. Mentions the god Mūlasthānēśvara at Śriṅgi among the holy places of the locality and refers to the sabhā-maṇṭapa, aravam[ṭage] (watershed) of the temple.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/78 (page 246)

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/79 (page 247)
Placement
Slab set up near the Mūru-Kaḷasada guḍi
Dynasty
Do.
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama-kāla 45, Śubhakṛit, Pushya, ba. 13, Sunday, Uttarā-yaṇa-saṅkrānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Commences with the praise of the gods Tṛi-kaḷēśvara and Gaṁgēśvara. Registers an endowment of land including a flower garden for the daily worship and periodical festivals of the god Gaṁgēśvara and feeding and clothing of the ascetics living in the maṭha attached to it by the Thirty Representatives (mūvadiṁbaru) of Soval. The gift was made into the hands of Kaliyuga-siddha Abhina-va-Pāśupata Brahmachāri Gaṁgarāśi. Seems to refer to the consecration of the god Gaṁgēśvara by Gaṁgarāśi.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/80 (page 247)
Placement
Śrīraṁgapūr.--Detached stone pedestal lying outside the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 11th century A.D. States that it (the pedestal) was endowed by Kandiyamma, son of Mallasara-Kāḷiyamma, the gāvuṇḍa of Modalūr.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/81 (page 247)
Placement
Slab kept near Goḍachi Vīrabhadra temple
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Mentions the Śaka year 31 (!) Viḷambi, Chaitra, Sunday and the Chāḷukya-Chakravarti. Satyāśrayadēva and states that gifts of land were made to the twenty gavuṇḍas of Modalūr by Honna-koṁtada Māḷeya. The boundaries of the village are stated. The purpose of the gift is not clear The record seems to be a forgery. Below that is engraved in late characters the gift of a maṭha and land. Mentions the god Goḍachi Vīrabhadra.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/82 (page 247)

…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated. Praises the Jinaśāsana. Refers to the reign of the king and mentions one mahāpradhāna.

BIJAPUR DISTRICT


BIJAPUR TALUK

King
Saṁkamadēva ruḷing from [Maṁ-gaḷa]vāḍa.
Date
Year 5, Śārvari, Chaitra, śu. 15, Sunday, lunar eclipse, vyatīpāta.

Kannaḍa

…

Kannaḍa
Remarks

SHOLAPUR DISTRICT


PANDHARPUR TALUK


ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/91 (page 248)
Placement
Paṇḍharpūr.--Stone pilaster built as a beam in the roof of the outer maṇḍapa of the eastern side of the Viṭṭhala temple.
Dynasty
Hoysaḷa
King
Vīra Sōmēśvara
Date
Śaka 1159, Durmukhi, Pushya, ba. 11, Uttarāyaṇa-saṁ-krānti.
Language
Nāgarī script, Sanskrit & Kannaḍa verse & prose
Remarks
Damaged. Registers gift of two hundred varāhas for the conduct of daily worship, perpetual lamps and other perqui-sites of the god Śrī-Viṭhṭhala at Pamḍaraṁge on the river Bhīmarathī by the king for his welfare while he was camp-ing in the neighbourhood after his victorious campaign against his rivals. Among these is mentioned the Kāḍavarāya.

JATH STATE


ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/92 (page 248)
Placement
Aṅkaḷagi.--Slab set up in the Hanumān temple.
Dynasty
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Bhillama
Date
5th year, Sādhāraṇa, Vaiśākha, śu. 10, Monday, Uttarā-yaṇa-saṁkramaṇa.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records a votive offering of money into the hands of Gaṁgajīya for the benefit of the god Sōmanātha at Aṁku-lage by the headman (prabhu) Chāvuṁḍeya-Nāyaka, the Mēlāḷike-adhikāri Kupparasa Daṁḍanāyaka, all the resi-dents, mānyakāras, Eṇṭuhiṭṭu, etc.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/93 (page 248)
Placement
Slab lying in the Mesappana tōṭa.
Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
Saṁkamadēva
Date
Year, 3, Viḷambi, Phālguṇa, śu. 3, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Broken and damaged. Seems to record some gift (details of which are lost) to the deity (name lost) by [Cha]vuṁḍayya-Nāyaka. This deity is described as Mahā-yōgēśvarī, Ugra-Chāvuṁḍe, Khaṭvāṁga-kamaḷa-triśūla-ḍamaruga-karāḷa-haste, Keṁjeḍe-makuṭa-chaturbhuja-kōmaḷāṁgi, Ādināthe of sixty four yōgapīṭhas and residing at the holy seat (divya-sthāna) of the glorious (Śrīmat) Aṁkuḷage.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/94 (page 248)
Placement
Bablād (Kontevvana).--Slab built in the wall of the mosque.

Ādil Shahi
King
Ibrahim II. Ādil Shah
Date
A.H. 1000 (A.D. 1591).
Language
Arabic & Persian
Remarks
States that the mosque was built in the time of Ibrahim Ādil Shah, by one Abdar Khan.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/95 (page 248)
Placement
Bagēwādi.--Two pieces of a slab lying in the Majumdar's well.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
1st Jumāda, A.H. 1005, (A.D. 1596, December, 21).
Language
Persian
Remarks
Records the endowment of a well, a plot of land and a garden by Malik Shaikh Alauddin, son of Malik Kamal, son of Malik Buzrug. Also states that after Shaik Alauddin the above property will be inherited by one Sahib Khan.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/96 (page 248)

Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
(Bijjaḷa ?)
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated. Registers various gifts of land, oil, garden, tax on sales of horses, etc., by Heggaḍe Kēśirājayya, Hergaḍe Habbaṇa and others.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/97 (page 249)
Placement
Bīḷūr.--Slab standing near Basavaṇṇa-dēvara Guḍi.
Dynasty
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Siṁhaṇa
Date
Śaka 1168, Viśvā-vasu, Pushya, ba. Amāvāsye, Mon-day, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gifts of land, flower-garden, house-site, oil-mill, etc., for the conduct of daily worship and other rituals, feeding the Brahmins, etc., in the three temples of Bhāgalēśvara, Kaṁnagōpāla and [Bai]jalēśvara erected at Bīḷūr by Viṁchuva Basavarasa of the Gautama-gōtra for the merit of the deceased Bhāgubaye(yi). Basavarasa was Bāhattaraniyōgādhipati and Sarvādhikāri to Vāsudēva Kaṁnuva-Paṁḍita who was governing the districts of Heḍa-Kaṇaṁbaḍe and Tarddavāḍi from Vijayāpura. Bīḷūr(Bilavura) was situated in the Kaṇambaḍe-nāḍu, included in [Karahaṭṭa], which formed a part of Kuṁtala-vishaya.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/98 (page 249)
Placement
Another slab standing in the same place.
Dynasty
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Siṁhaṇa, ruling from Dēvagiri
Date
Śaka 1168, Viśvā-[vasu].
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Records gifts of house-site, oil mill, wet lands, etc., for the daily worship of the god Basavēśvara whose temple was constructed at Bīḷūr by Viṁchuva Basa-varasa of the Gautama-gōtra. Bīḷūr was situated in the Kaṇabaḍe-nāḍu included in the Karahaḍa-dēśa which formed a part of Kuṁtala-vishaya. Basavarasa was the sarvādhi-kāri of Vēsugidēva son of Bhāgubāyi and his minister Kaṁ ṇuva Paṁḍita who were governing the districts of Tarda-vāḍi and Heḍa Kaṇabaḍe from their headquarters at Vijayā pura as subordinates of the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/99 (page 249)

Slab lying in Kaṁbāra Mallappa Nirvāṇi's house.

…
King
…
Date
Chāḷukya Bhūlōka year 9, Ānanda, Āshāḍha, Amāvāsye, Monday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated. Registers gift of land and money income at Biyaḷavura by Mahāpradhāna Daṇḍanāyaka Kimirapavya, Manevergaḍe Ayamarasa, etc., for the worship, offerings, etc., of the god [Mallikārjuna]dēva and the feeding of ascetics.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/100 (page 249)
Placement
Guḍḍāpūr.--Slab set up in the Dānamma's temple.
Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
Saṁkamadēva (II)
Date
4th year, Parābhava, Pushya, śu. 14, Monday, [Uttarā]-yaṇa-saṁkrāṁti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers a gift of land for the benefit of the god Vīra-Sōmanātha of Nāyiṁṭige. The gift was made into the hands of Vīrabrata-kshētrasaṁnyāsi Rēvaiya. Mentions the female devotee Guḍḍiyavve.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/101 (page 249)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Sōmēśvara [IV]
Date
2nd year, Plavaṅga, Pushya, amāvāsyā, Monday, solar eclipse, Uttarāyaṇa-seṁkramaṇa.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gift of the village Sōraḍi for the benefit of the god Guḍive-pṛiya Svayaṁbhu-Sōma-nātha, by the king and his officer Mahāpradhāna Sēnādhi-pati Prachaṁḍa-Daṁḍanāyaka Bammidēvarasa from their camp at Hū-Baṁnūru. The gift was made into the hands of Vīrabrati-kshētrasaṁnyāsi Sakaiya Taileyagaḷu. Some other gifts of land into his hands are also registered.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/102 (page 249)

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/103 (page 249)
Placement
Kōḷgiri.--Slab set up in the temple of Bhairavanātha in a valley near the village.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
Chaḷukyēśvara Vik-rama-kāla 11, Pra-bhava, Vaiśākha, puṇṇame, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the endowment of the village Kōḷegira attached to Kaṇaṁbaḍe Three Hundred (district) for the benefit of the god Kēdārēśvara into the hands of Amṛitarāsi-Paṇḍita when Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Jōgamarasa of the Kaḷachurya family was governing the province of Karahāḍa. Also records gift of toll revenue of the village to the god Iṁdrēśvara consec-rated in his own name by Pergaḍe Iṁdapayya, who was the amātya of Jōgamarasa.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/106 (page 250)

[3rd] year, Subhānu, Āshāḍha, Amāvāsye, Monday, solar eclipse.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/107 (page 250)
Placement
Saṁkha.--Slab set up in the Kumbāra Dēgula.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Saṁkamadēva
Date
Śaka 1100 (in words), Viḷaṁbi, Māgha, Amāvāsyā, Sunday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers an endowment of the village Karaṁdige situated in the kaṁpaṇa, of Aṁkuḷage Fifty included in the Tarikāḍa-nāḍu for the benefit of the gods Māṇikēśvara, Nāgēśvara and Maiḷalēśvara and for feeding the ascetics. The gift was made by the king at the request of Mahāpradhāna Masayiya Sāhaṇi. The temples of these gods were erected by Masayiya to perpetuate his own name and the names of his father and mother respectively at Saṁka in the Tarikāḍa-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/108 (page 250)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Do.
King
Vīra Bijjaladēva, son of Rāya-Murāri Sōyidēva.
Date
Parīdhāvi, Phālguṇa, Paurṇamāse, Mon-day, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers an endowment of the village Āsage included in Aṁkuḷage Fifty for the benefit of the gods mentioned in the above record. Gifts of land, garden, oil mill, etc., made by several persons and trading communities are also recorded.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/109 (page 250)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Jaitrapāḷadēva
Date
Ānanda, Kārtika, śu. 12, Monday.
Language
…
Remarks
Registers an endowment, of the village Araḷige-Khairaḷige situated in Aṁkuḷage Fifty for the benefit of god Māṇi-kēsvara and for feeding ascetics, made by the king at the request of Masayiya-Sāhaṇi. The gift was made into the hands of Amarēśvara-Paṁḍita who was the sthānāchārya of the Svayaṁbhū-Śri-Rāmēśvara-Tīrtha, situated to the south of the village, Uṁbaravāṇi in the district of Karahaḍa Four-Thousand, and whom Masayiya-Sāhaṇi installed as the sthānāchārya of the god Māṇikēśvara also.
