Adil Shahi
King
Ibrahim II Adil Shah
Date
11th Shuhijia, A.H. 1002, (A.D. 1593, August 28).
Language
Persian & Arabic
Remarks
Records the endowment of a plot of land.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/111 (page 250)
Placement
Sidhanātha.--Broken slab kept in the Siddhēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
Bhuvanaikavīradēva, ruling from the nelevīḍu at Maṁgaḷivāḍa.
Date
6th year, Vishu, Pushya, Amāvāsye, Monday, Vyatīpāta, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated. Registers a gift of land and house-site made for the benefit of the god Svayaṁbhū-Śrī-Siddhēśvara of [Doṁga]ragāve incorporated in Kaṇaṁbaḍe by Mahāpra-dhāna Sēnādhipati Piriya-Daṁḍanāyaka Kēsimayya of Gautama-gōtra and his brother Boppadēva-Daṁḍanāyaka who were jointly governing the Three-Hundred division with its headquarters at Kaṇambaḍe.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/114 (page 251)
Placement
Tikoṇḍi.--Slab set up near Svami-guḍi
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
[Tribhuvanamalladēva ?]
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama-varsha, 5, Raudri, Phālguṇa, śu. [10], Monday, Vyatīpāta, saṁkrānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/115 (page 251)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyamurāri Sōvidēva
Date
5th year, Khara, Kārtika, śu. 5, Thursday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gifts of land, oil-mill, oil, garden, etc., to the god Bhōgēśvara at Sāira by Mahāsāmanta Mācharasa of the Gōmuva family. It records further gifts of tolls on pack-horses and pack-donkeys by Suṁka-veggaḍe Soṁvarasa Daṇḍanāyaka.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/116 (page 251)
Placement
Another slab set up in the same place
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Registers gift of land and toll income by Suṁka-vergaḍe Vā[ma]rasa Nayāka to the god Kēdārēś-vara at [Lo]kkikuṇḍi. Praises Kēdāraśakti-Paṇḍitadēva of the Bhujañgāvaḷi lineage, who was the sthānāchārya of the god, and one Mācheya-Sāmanta.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/117 (page 251)
Placement
Umadi.--Broken slab lying near Rāma-ṇṇa Kulkarni's house.
Dynasty
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyamurāri Sōvidēva ruling from the nelevīḍu at Maṁgaḷivēḍa.
Date
9th year, Manmatha, Phālguṇa, śu. Puṇ-ṇami, Thursday.
Language
Sanskrit verse & Kannaḍa prose in Kannaḍa script
Remarks
Begins with five verses in praise of Śiva, Nārāyaṇa and other gods. Registers gifts of land, garden, oil-mill, etc., for the benefit of the main god Jalaśayana Nārāyaṇa amidst twelve Nārāyaṇas consecrated at Uṁmade by Mahāpradhāna Mahāvaḍḍavyavahārin Nāgadēvayya-Nāyaka, the Mūligas, the Eṇṭu Hiṭṭu, Pañcha-ṁaṭhasthāna, Aruvattokkalu (sixty tenants) all the Baṅaṁju and other groups at the instance of the king and with the approval of the five ministers (Paṁ-cha-Pradhāna). Describes in detail in Sanskrit verse the genealogy of Nāgadēva who is said to have been born in the solar race.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/118 (page 251)
Placement
Umarāni.--Slab set up at the right wall in the Hēmaliṅga temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Bhujabalamalla
Date
Śaka 1089 (in words), Sarvajit, Vaiśākha, Amāvāsye, Monday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Registers a gift of land and oil-mill for the benefit of the temples of Hemmēśvara and Chandalēśvara at Uṁ-baravāṇi by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Hemmāḍi, Daṇḍanāyaka Maduvaṇayya and other Karaṇas at the instance of the king. This Hemmāḍi bore the title Kopaṇa-puravarādhīś-vara and was the lord of Uṁbaravāṇi (modern Umarāṇi), the chief town of the thirty-six villages situated in the Kaḷaṁ-baḍe-nāḍu, which was included in Karahaḍa Four-Thou-sand province of the Kuṁtala-dēśa. Also states that Madu-vaṇayya Daṁḍanāyaka and Mallidēva-Daṇḍanāyaka were governing the province of Heḍa-Kaḷambaḍe-nāḍu.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/119 (page 251)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Do.
King
Rāyamurāri Bhujabalamalla Gaṁyi-dēvarasa (Sōyidēva ?)
Date
Śaka 1096 (in words) Vijaya, Jyēshṭha, amāvāsye, Monday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of land at Basurige for the benefit of god Hemmēśvara and feeding the ascetics by the queen Chandaladēvī who transferred it to the king, at whose instance it (the land) was assigned as a sarva-namasya endowment by Kappadēva Gōpati Daṁḍanāyaka and other Karaṇas.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/120 (page 252)
Placement
Slab set up near the left wall in the same temple.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Śaka 1044 (in words), Śubhakṛit, Māgha, Amāvāsye, Monday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Registers a gift of land, oil, garden, tolls, etc., for the benefit of the temple of god Hemmēśvara by Chandaladēvī and her son, Polakēsidēva-Vanasiṁhadēva. This temple was erected in the name of her husband by Chandaladēvī, who was the crowned queen (Paṭṭa-mahādēvī) of Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Hemmāḍidēva of the Chāḷukya lineage at their capital Uṁbaravāṇi. Mentions prince (kumāra) Mallikārjuna.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/121 (page 252)
Placement
On the same slab.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1064 (in words), Duṁdubhi, Chai-tra, puṇṇave, Mon-day, Vishu-saṁkra-maṇa.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records the conferment of the sthāna of god Hemmēśvara with all its endowments on Chandrābharaṇa-Paṇḍitadēva, who was the sthānāchārya of god Tīrthada-Śrī-Svayaṁbhū Rāmēśvara, by the Paṭṭa-mahādēvi Chaṁdaladēvī and prince Banasiṁhadēva, who had erected the temple of the said god. Also registers the gift of land and house-site to god Vukkēśvara of the Mūlasthāna, evidently by the same donors.

…

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/124 (page 252)
Placement
Wajasaṅga.--Slab set up on the right side of the entrance to the Mahādēva temple.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva, ‘ruling from Jayantīpura.’
Date
18th year, Śrīmukha, Chaitra, amāvāsye, Monday, solar eclipse, Vyatīpāta.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers an endowment of land to god Lakkhaṇēśvara of Vaḷasaṁga, situated in Kalaṁbaḍe Three-Hundred dis-trict by Piriyarasi Lakhmādēvī, Mahāsāmanta Dāyarasa, the Prabhu, the Mūligas, the Mahājanas, etc., of the two kērīs. Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Jōgamarasa was then governing the province of Karahaḍa Four-Thousand.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/125 (page 252)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Do.
King
Jagadēkamalla

Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers gifts of land for the daily worship and offerings of god Lakhkhaṇēśvara (of Vaḷasaṁga) by Mahāsāmanta Baṁmadēvarasa, who was the Manneya of Saygāve Thirty-six villages.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/126 (page 252)
Placement
Do.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
8th year (in words and figure), Krōd-hana, Phālguna, puṇname, Monday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers gifts of tolls, oil-mill, oil, etc., to the gods Lakkaṇ-ēśvara, Kēśavadēva and Mūlasthāna-Kalidēva of Vala-saṁga by Mahāmaṇḍāḷēśvara Kumāra-Rājayadēvarasa, who was governing the Kalaṁbaḍe-nāḍu. Also records a gift of oil for a perpetual lamp to the gods by the Telligas (oil-mongers).
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/127 (page 253)
Placement
Slab set up on the left side of the entrance to the same temple.
Dynasty
Do.
King
Do
Date
10th year (in words), Uttamavisigi, Pra-bhava, Pushya, śu. [11], Monday, Utta-rāyaṇa-saṁkrānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gifts of land, house-site, etc., when Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara [Gōhaṇa]rasa was governing the province of Karahaḍa Four-Thousand, by Pergaḍe Hēchimayya, Mummuridaṇḍas, etc., for the benefit of some charity founded by one Maili-seṭṭi. Mentions a certain Mahāsāmanta bearing the titles, Lattalūrapuravarādhīś-vara, Suvarṇa-garuḍa-dhvaja, etc.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/128 (page 253)
Placement
Slab built into a wall inside the same temple.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Do
Date
5th year, Duṁdubhi, Pushya, śu. 10, Monday, Uttarā-yaṇa-saṁkrānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of land for a charity pickota at Vaḷasaṁga by Sāvanta Handarasa and the headman Chauḍamayya, when Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Bijjaṇadēva was governing the province of Karahaḍa Four-Thousand and his grandmother Abhinava-Chandaladēvī was administering Vaḷasaṁga, situated in Kaḷaṁbaḍe Three-Hundred division. The last named is described as Abhinava-Śāradādēvī and as the wife of Tribhuvanamalladēva (Vikramāditya VI).

Language
Kannaḍa

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41/1940-41/135 (page 253)
Placement
Sides of pillars in the Kāśī-Viśvēśvara temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka, 1494, Āṁgirasa, Dakshiṇāyaṇa, Var-sharitu, Bhādra-pada, śu. 3, Mon-day, Hastā nak-shatra, Sādhyayōga, Taitila-karaṇa.
Language
Marāthī
Remarks
Records the renovation of the temple to the left of the well named Jōgi-Bāvi and the installation of the Viśvanātha liṅga and provision for its daily worship, etc., at Maṅgaḷa-vēḍha by Kaḷaiyadēva, the Kuḷakaraṇi of Hiparage when he was in charge of the majamu of the paragaṇe. Kaḷai-yadēva belonged to the Bhāradvāja-gōtra and Vātsyāyana-sūtra and was a Śukla-yajuh2-śākhādhyāvī. Published in the Marāṭhi journal, Granthamālā, Vol. XI, No. 11.

Placement

…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. In characters of about the 13th century A.D. States that it is the boundary stone of a land given to the basadi at Uchchaṅgi which belonged to the Yāpanīya-saṁgha and Kāḍūrgaṇa by the gauṇḍas and sthānikas of Adirggunte.

King
…
Date
6th November, 1818 A.D.
Language
English
Remarks
States that the slab was set up in memory of Captain James Cooke of H.M. 84th regiment, who fell a victim to cholera at Hubli.

States that the slab was set up in memory of George Boyd Color, Sergeant, H.M. 84th regiment and Pay Master Ser-geant, Flank Battalion, who died at Hubli.

Language
English
Remarks
States that the slab was set up in memory of the Non-commi-ssioned officers and privates of the Flank companies of H.M. 34th, 53rd, 69th and 84th regiments who died at Hubli, by their surviving comrades.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/7 (page 255)
Placement
Amaragōḷ.--Slab set up near the Bana-saṅkari temple.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Śaka 1041, Vikāri, Mārgaśira ba. 11, Monday, Dakshi-ṇāyaṇa-saṁkra-maṇa.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records that Mahāpradhāna Saudhore Jakkarasa erected the temples, installed the gods Kēśava and Bhairava therein and made an endowment of land at Aṁbaragōḷa situated in the Uṇakal kaṁpaṇa of the Halasige-nāḍu for their worship. The gift was entrusted into the hands of Dēvarāsi Paṇ-ḍita.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/9 (page 255)
Placement
Slab lying near the same place
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Jagadēkamalla-Jayasiṁhadēva
Date
Śaka 963, Vishu Śrāvaṇa, Paurṇi-māsye, Monday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Seems to record the construction of a tank and gift of land in the Sabbi-nāḍu by a Kadaṁba chief (details not clear) for the benefit of god Śivēśvara. Mentions Bavasiga-vaṁśa.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/10 (page 255)
Placement
Mutilated hero-stone set up near the village pond.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 12th century A.D. Seems to record a gift by the Gāvuṇḍas and the Hiṭṭu (of the place) in connection with the death of a hero.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/11 (page 256)
Placement
Stone lying near the Kallappana guḍi

…
Date

Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Worn out. In characters of about the 10th century A.D.

Placement
Bhairidēvakoppa.--Hero stone lying near the village pond.

…

…
Date
Śaka [1360], Piṁ-gaḷa, Māgha ba. 14.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/13 (page 256)
Placement
Stone lying on the boundary of a field called Saudattiyavara-hola about three miles away from the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. In characters of about the 16th century A.D. States that the field is the gift to Karuṇākaraya for the god Hanumān by Timmarasa-voḍeya of Mādana-Huba[ḷi] and Arasapa-Gauḍa of Ba[yi]ruvadēvana-kopa.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/14 (page 256)
Placement
Būḍarsingi.--Nandi-pillar set up in the compound of the Hanumān temple.
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Chaṭṭayadēva
Date
Śaka 1179, Piṁ-gaḷa, Vaiśākha, śu. 15, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Vuchchaṁgi in the Sabbi-kaṁpaṇa (division) of the Halasige-nāḍu for the benefit of god Kapila-Siddha-Mallikārjuna of the Somnāḷige-kshētra called Abhinava-Śrīśaila, by the king.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/15 (page 256)
Placement
Chhabbi.--Slab set up near the Huḍēda Bāvi (well).
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 9 [82], Śārvari, Vaiśākha, śu. 5, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the Jaina ascetic Kanakanandi, of the Dhora-jinālaya at Sabbi expired by the vow of samni(nya)sana. The nisidhige was set up in his memory by the nun Bhāgi-vabbe. Vajra composed the epitaph and Nākiga inscribed it.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/16 (page 256)
Placement
Broken pillar lying in the same place.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Vijayāditya
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and mutilated.

Placement

…
King
…
Date
Sarvajit, Chaitra, ba. 3, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 15th century A.D. Records the death of Sōmaṇṇa Heggaḍe, the son-in-law of Timma-Gōḍa (of Chabbi), in a battle field and the setting up of the memo-rial stone.

Placement

Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Kāmadēva
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and partly buried. Seems to record a grant to the sage Rājaguru Lakshmīdēva who was the worshipper of the glorious feet of the god Svayaṁbhu Dhavaḷēśvara of Kālaḍi and the disciple of Śivamuddudēva by Ḍāvōttara-maṇḍa-lika, the trusted general of the king.

Placement

Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1522, Sārvari, Āshāḍha, śu. 1, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records the exemption of taxes on the Jaṅgama community living on charity in the Hubbaḷḷi-sīme for the merit of Hammi-dakhāna, by the Tāṇadāra (Ṭhānēdār) Mujumdāra, Dēśāhi, Dēśakulakaraṇi, Seṭṭi and others of the Mahānāḍu.

Kannaḍa
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/36 (page 257)
Placement
Hubbaḷḷi.--A slab kept in the Mamalat-dar's office compound.
Dynasty
Rāshṭrakūṭa
King
Amōghavarshadēva
Date
Śaka 895, Śrīmukha, Jyēshṭha, ba. 8, Sunday, Dakshi-ṇāyana saṁkrānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land for the construction of a tank by Mori-yara Kali-bhiṭṭayya when Guttiya Gaṁga Permānaḍi was governing Beḷvala--300, Purigare--300 and Gaṁgavāḍi--96,000 and when his subordinate was administering the villages Nīrgoṇḍi.

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/41 (page 258)
Placement
Kaṭnūr.--Pillar built in a wall inside Kaḷamēśvara temple.
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Śivachitta Vīra Tribhuvanamalla-dēva.
Date
17th year, Śubhakṛit, Kārtika, śu. Puṇṇami, Mon-day.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of land for the benefit of the temple of Śrī Mūlasthānadēva at Kaṭṭanūru after renovation by Indeya-Sāhiṇi when Mahāpasāyita Māsāḍa Hiṭṭeya Nāyaka was ruling over the place.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/42 (page 258)
Placement
Nandi-pillar standing in a dilapidated shrine.
Dynasty
Yādava
King
Rāmachandradēva
Date
Śaka 1..... .., Pushya, ba. 10, Sunday, Uttarā-yaṇa- sa[ṁkra-maṇa].
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the endowment, with the permission of the king, of the village Kaṭṭanūr along with all its resources included in Sabbi--30 situated in the [Dāra]vāḍa division which formed a part of Palasige 12,000, for the benefit of the god Kapila-siddha Mallikārjunadēva of Soṁnaḷige-kshētra by the minister and Sarvādhikāri Nāgadēva who was administering from his headquarters at Dāravāḍa.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/43 (page 258)
Placement
Hero stone in Sur. No. 14 near the village

King

…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 9th century A.D. Records the death in a cattle raid at Kaṭṭanūr of Kaṭṭli-Tāṇaga and his son Taṭṭapa against Komāra.

…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Modern. States that it is the gadduge (tomb) of Basappa Kāḍappa Seṭṭaru, a resident of Mahajitapura and a devout follower of the Vīraśaiva tenets.

Date

Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/51 (page 259)
Placement
Slab set up in Sur. No. 217 near the village
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Bhuvanaikamalladēva
Date
Śaka 994, Parīdhāvi, Chaitra, śu. 8, Monday, Uttarā-yaṇa-samkrānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the gift of certain shares in the harvests made to the āchārya Sōmakarttāra by the twelve gāvuṁḍas of Nūle in the Halasige province of Kuntala when the Kadaṁba king Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Chaṭṭayadēva was ruling over Koṁkaṇa --900 and his son Jayakēśidēva with his queen Boppādēvī, was governing the provinces of Koṁkaṇa--900, Halasige--12,000, Kundūru 300 and Sabbi--30 from dapital Gōve.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/52 (page 259)
Placement
Same slab
Dynasty
Kadaṁba
King
Śivachitta-Vīra-Permāḍi-Vijayāditya-dēva.
Date
[30th] year, Viśvā-vasu, Āshāḍha, ba. amāvāśye, Sunday, solar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records gift of land, house-site, etc., to Kāḷēśvarārya by Appaṇa Daṇḍanāyaka and the twelve (gāvuṁḍas) at the instance of the king.

Remarks
Records the gift of certain vegetables for the daily offering (nivēdya) made by the cultivators (details lost).

ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42/1941-42/59 (page 259)
Placement
Varūr.--Hero stone set up near the Hanumān temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
29th year, Hēvi-ḷaṁbi, Chaitra, śu. 12, Friday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to record the death of Elevaḷēya Bijjaya and Jakkarasa son of Saṅkaya in an encounter between Bhairava Khaṁ-ḍērāya Saṁgarasa, the adhikāri of Nūle and Hirugidēva the maṇḍalika of Beḷagaḷe.

Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43.


BELGAUM DISTRICT


HUKERI TALUK

Placement

…

…
Date
…
Language
Arabic
Remarks
A verse from the Quran.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/2 (page 261)
Placement
Lintel of the entrance into the Kali Masjid on the main road.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Persian
Remarks
Refers to the building of a mosque by Mansur Khan in 990 H.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/3 (page 261)
Placement
Lintel at the entrance into the Jachha Ma Sahib Mosque.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Arabic
Remarks
The throne verse of the Quran.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/4 (page 261)
Placement
Slab broken into two fragments and lying near the well called Kaṭṭēbhāvi in a field about a mile east of the village.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Persian
Remarks
Seems to record an endowment of some property.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/5 (page 261)
Placement
Stone lying under a tree inside the fort near the old Munsiff's court.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Persian
Remarks
Indistinct and undecipherable.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/6 (page 261)
Placement
Fragment of a slab lying in the court yard of the Munsiff's court.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Mentions Traikīrtti, the Yāpanīya-saṅgha and some gaṇa (name lost).
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/7 (page 261)
Placement
Slab lying on the roadside near the girl's school.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1505, Subhānu, Jyēshṭha, śu. 12, Sunday.
Language
Marāṭhi in Nāgarī
Remarks
Mentions two names viz., Malik bhāī bin Sēkh Māhāmada Khatīb and Mulā Husain. Mulā Māhāmada, (this and No. 14 below were kindly deciphered for the Dept. by Mr. G.H. Khare).
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/8 (page 261)
Placement
Slab kept in the taluk office (removed to this place from Arjunwāḍ).
Dynasty
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Kannaḍa
Date
Śaka 1182, Siddhār-thin, Chaitra, ba. Amāvāsyā, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Published in Epigraphia Indica, Vol. XXI, pages 9 ff.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/9 (page 261)
Placement
Bhairāpūr.--A Slab lying in a field about half a mile to the south of the village.
Dynasty
Raṭṭa
King
Mahāmāṇḍalēśvara Vīra Lakshmī-dēvarasa, ‘ruling from Vēṇugrāma’.
Date
Śaka 1159, Dur-mukhi, Śrāvaṇa, śu. 11, Monday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a grant of land, house and (site for) haystack (baṇaṁbe) made by the queen Laliteyadēvī, at Mattivāḍa which was under her administration, to Mahāpradhāna Śēnāpati Nāgeya-Nāyaka for the maintenance of the Mūvattir-chchasira-chhatra (feeding house) at Nākēśvara.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/10 (page 261)
Placement
Ammaṇagi.--Stone set up near the image of Hanumān in front of the Svayaṁbhū-Mallikārjuna temple.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In late characters. An imprecation on those who do not take a bath in the holy pond.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/11 (page 261)
Placement
Stone lying near the ruined temple of Rāmaliṅga.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1179, Naḷa, Pushya, śu. [7], Monday, Utta-rāyaṇa-saṁkrānti.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Seems to record a gift of land after purchase, by the Mahājanas to the temple of the goddess for its maintenance.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/12 (page 262)
Placement
Kōchari.--Slab set up near the temple of Hanumān.
Dynasty
Western Chāḷukya
King
Trailōkyamalladēva
Date
Śaka 97[8], Man-matha, Āśvayuja, śu. Puṇṇame, Sunday, lunar eclipse.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged. Seems to register some gifts to the temple of Trikūṭēśvara. The details are lost.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/13 (page 262)
Placement
Beḷḷaṁbi.--Slab lying near the house of Wali Siddappa-Mallappa.
Dynasty
Raṭṭa
King
Mahāsāmanta Aṅkayyarasa
Date
Śaka 973, Khara, Śrāvaṇa, ba. 3, Saṅkrānti, Sunday.
Language
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of money made into the hands of the 50 Mahā-janas of Beḷuvabbe headed by the ūroḍeya Kāḷidāsayya, for maintaining a free feeding house (satra) for Brāhmans.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/14 (page 262)
Placement
Slab lying near the temple of Narasiṁha
Dynasty
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Kṛishṇadēva
Date
Śaka 1169, Plavaṅga, Āshāḍha, ba. 1, Thursday.
Language
Marāṭhī in Nāgarī
Remarks
Records the grant of some sites for houses and oil mills made to the village deity of Biḷḷibi by a person whose name is not clear in the inscription. Mentions Daḷavāy Bhōgadēva Yādava.
ARIE/1939-1943/Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43/1942-43/15 (page 262)
Placement
Gajabārwāḍi.--Lintel over an arch inside the mosque.
Dynasty
…
King
…
Date
…
Language
Arabic
Remarks
The throne verse of the Quran.
